archetypes.name: Family AirFryer Quick Bites
archetypes.description: Ultra-fast, kid-friendly family dinners built around the air fryer with semi-prepared components and fresh add-ons for tacos, wraps, bowls, and crispy mains with quick sides.
archetypes.rationale: Adds the missing Under15, AirFryer-driven family option with mild flavors and semi-prepared ease, complementing existing 15–30 stovetop/oven and hands-off slow-cooker archetypes without overlap.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chicken Nugget Nacho Platter
meals.description: Crispy air-fried chicken nuggets piled over cheesy nachos with mild toppings. Fast, shareable, and kid-friendly for a busy family night.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Set a large microwave-safe platter or dish for the nachos.
Drain and rinse black beans.
Thinly slice spring onion.
Grate cheddar cheese if not pre-shredded.
cook_steps: Air-fry chicken nuggets for 8–10 minutes until hot and crisp.
Spread nachos on the microwave-safe platter.
Scatter black beans over the chips and sprinkle cheddar cheese.
Microwave 45–60 seconds until the cheese melts.
Slice the cooked chicken nuggets into bite-size pieces and place over the nachos.
Spoon salsa and sour cream over the top, add small dollops of avocado dip, and finish with spring onion.
Serve immediately and let everyone scoop their portion.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chicken Strip Soft Tacos
meals.description: Crispy air-fried chicken strips stuffed into warm tortillas with mild salsa, lettuce, cheese, and creamy toppings. Fast family tacos built from semi-prepped components.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Place tortillas in a microwave-safe plate and cover lightly to prevent drying.
Shred lettuce if needed.
Grate cheddar cheese if using a block.
Drain black beans.
cook_steps: Air fry chicken strips for 6–8 minutes until hot and crisp; shake basket halfway.
Microwave the tortillas for 20–30 seconds to warm.
Microwave black beans with half of the salsa for 60–90 seconds until hot; stir.
Assemble tacos: add chicken strips to tortillas, spoon on warm beans, top with lettuce and cheddar cheese.
Finish with remaining salsa, guacamole, and sour cream. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Air Fryer Crispy Fish Taco Bowls
meals.description: Crunchy hake nuggets over warm microwave rice with lettuce, salsa, avocado dip, and mild cheddar. Fast, family-friendly taco flavors without the tortillas.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Tear a small vent in the tops of the rice pouches.
Rinse and drain black beans (if packed in liquid).
Shred or thinly slice lettuce.
Cut lemon into wedges (for serving).
Set out salsa, avocado dip, and grated cheddar cheese.
cook_steps: Air-fry hake nuggets in a single layer for 8–10 minutes, shaking halfway, until crisp and hot.
Microwave rice pouches according to pack directions (about 90 seconds each).
Place black beans in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for 60–90 seconds until warm.
Assemble bowls: add rice as the base, top with lettuce and warm black beans.
Add air-fried hake nuggets, then spoon over salsa and avocado dip.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and serve with lemon wedges. Season with salt and pepper if desired.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chicken Burgers with Crispy Wedges
meals.description: Fast family chicken burgers with lettuce, tomato, and pickles, plus air-fried potato wedges. Mild, kid-friendly, and built from semi-prepped items.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Slice 2 medium tomato into rounds.
Rinse and pat dry 1 small head lettuce; tear into burger-size pieces.
Split 4 hamburger buns.
Set out ketchup, mayonnaise, and pickles for the table.
cook_steps: Add 600 g potato wedges to the air fryer basket in a single layer; cook 12–15 minutes, shaking halfway.
At the 5-minute mark, place 4 chicken burgers in the basket beside the wedges (or on a second rack if available); air fry 8–10 minutes, flipping once, until heated through and crispy.
Microwave hamburger buns 15–20 seconds to warm (optional).
Assemble burgers: spread mayonnaise on buns, add chicken burger, top with cheddar cheese slices, lettuce, tomato, and pickles.
Serve burgers with potato wedges and ketchup on the side.

meals.name: Air Fryer BBQ Chicken Quesadilla Dippers with Quick Salad
meals.description: Crispy air-fried quesadillas stuffed with smoked chicken and cheddar, served with salsa-sour cream dip and a quick side salad. Fast, kid-friendly, and hands-on in under 15 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F for 2–3 minutes.
Slice smoked chicken breast thinly.
Lay out tortillas and shred cheddar cheese if not pre-shredded.
In a small bowl, mix salsa and sour cream for dipping.
In a large bowl, add mixed greens and drizzle with salad dressing (do not toss yet).
Microwave the sliced smoked chicken breast for 30–45 seconds to take the chill off.
cook_steps: Spread a thin layer of BBQ sauce on 4 tortillas.
Top each with a layer of cheddar cheese, the warmed smoked chicken breast, then another light layer of cheddar. Cap with the remaining tortillas.
Brush tops with a little olive oil.
Air fry 2 quesadillas at a time for 5–6 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and the cheese is melted. Repeat with remaining quesadillas.
Slice into wedges.
Toss the mixed greens with the salad dressing.
Serve quesadilla dippers with the salsa-sour cream dip.

meals.name: Air Fryer BBQ Meatball Sliders with Corn Salsa
meals.description: Quick BBQ meatball sliders finished with melty cheddar and a fresh corn salsa. Fast assembly and kid-friendly flavors using the air fryer and microwave.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F for 2 minutes.
Split the hamburger buns.
Slice cheddar cheese slices to fit buns if needed.
Rinse and chop coriander.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
In a bowl, combine corn, salsa, cherry tomatoes, and coriander; set aside.

cook_steps: Air fry meatballs in a single layer for 8–10 minutes, shaking halfway, until browned and cooked through.
During the last 1 minute, place a piece of cheddar cheese on each meatball to soften slightly (work in batches if needed).
Microwave the bun halves for 15–20 seconds to warm slightly.
Spread a little BBQ sauce on the bottom bun halves.
Place 2 meatballs on each bun, add lettuce, and a spoon of corn salsa.
Top with more BBQ sauce if desired and cap with the top buns. Serve remaining corn salsa on the side.

Shred the smoked chicken breast into small pieces.

Serve hot with salsa and sour cream for dipping, with lettuce on the side.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chipotle Fish Sandwiches
meals.description: Crispy angelfish goujons stuffed in warm buns with mild chipotle sauce, slaw, and pickles. Fast, family-friendly, and air-fryer first.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F for 3 minutes.

Place chipotle sauce in a small bowl with a spoon for spreading.

Split buns and spread chipotle sauce on the cut sides.
Layer lettuce on the bottom bun, add goujons, top with slaw and pickles.
Close sandwiches and serve immediately.

meals.name: Air Fryer Crispy Tortilla Nacho Pizzas
meals.description: Crunchy tortilla ‘pizzas’ topped with salsa, cheese, beans, and corn, finished with fresh greens. Fast, kid-friendly, and perfect for air fryer nights.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 190°C/375°F.
Drain and rinse black beans.
Slice spring onion and olives; shred lettuce if needed.
Lay out tortillas and gather salsa and shredded cheddar cheese.
cook_steps: Air-fry 2 tortillas at a time for 2 minutes to lightly crisp.
Spread each tortilla with 2–3 tablespoons salsa.
Top with black beans and corn (about 2 tablespoons each per tortilla).
Add sliced olives and spring onion, then sprinkle a generous layer of cheddar cheese.
Return topped tortillas to the air fryer (work in batches) and cook 3–4 minutes until cheese melts and edges are crisp.
Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Cut into wedges and serve topped with shredded lettuce. Optional: drizzle a little extra salsa.

archetypes.name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
archetypes.description: Blazing, pepper-forward family dinners featuring Caribbean and Mexican favorites—jerk-style grills, chile-laced tacos, and peppery rice-and-bean plates—built fast with straightforward steps.
archetypes.rationale: Adds an ExtraHot, quick-and-simple family option in undercovered Caribbean cuisine space without overlapping existing mild/medium/hot archetypes.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Jerk Chicken & Black Bean Rice Bowls
meals.description: Caribbean jerk-style chicken meets Mexican black beans over fluffy rice with a blazing habanero-hot finish. Fast, family-friendly assembly with big pepper heat.
prep_steps: Rinse and drain 1.5 cups jasmine rice.
Finely chop 1–2 habanero peppers (use gloves).
Slice 1 onion and 2 bell peppers into thin strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Juice 1 lime and cut extra wedges if desired.
Drain and rinse 1 can black beans.

In a bowl, combine chicken thighs (sliced) with allspice, oregano, ground cumin, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, half the chopped habanero, half the garlic, lime juice, and 1.5 tbsp olive oil; toss to coat.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add jasmine rice to a pot with 2.25 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer on low 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes.

Cook chicken (OutdoorGrill or StoveTop): Heat grill to medium-high or a large skillet over medium-high with 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook marinated chicken 6–8 minutes until browned and cooked through, stirring or flipping for even color.

Sauté veg and beans: In the same skillet (add 0.5 tbsp olive oil if needed), cook onion and bell peppers 3–4 minutes until tender-crisp. Add remaining garlic, remaining chopped habanero, and black beans; cook 1–2 minutes to heat through. Season with salt to taste.
Assemble bowls: Fluff rice and divide into 4 bowls. Top with chicken, the pepper-bean mix, and spoon over salsa.
Finish: Drizzle hot sauce to taste. Garnish with chopped coriander and lime wedges.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Chipotle Beef & Black Bean Tacos with Pineapple-Habanero Salsa
meals.description: Fiery chipotle beef and black beans tucked in warm tortillas, topped with a fresh pineapple-habanero salsa for a Caribbean-Mexican heat punch. Built fast for a spicy family taco night.
prep_steps: Dice onion.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips.
Mince garlic.
Finely dice pineapple and tomatoes for salsa.
Finely chop jalapenos and coriander.
Cut lime into wedges (reserve 1 for juice).
Warm tortillas: stack and wrap in foil for the grill, or cover to warm in a dry pan later.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and bell peppers; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add ground beef; break up and brown 4–5 minutes.
Stir in garlic, chilli powder, allspice, and salt; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chipotle sauce and black beans; stir and simmer 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Make salsa in a bowl: combine pineapple, tomatoes, jalapenos, coriander, lime juice, a pinch of salt, and habanero sauce to taste.
Warm tortillas on OutdoorGrill 30–60 seconds per side (or in a dry skillet on the StoveTop) until pliable.
Assemble tacos: fill tortillas with beef-bean mixture and top with pineapple-habanero salsa. Serve with extra lime wedges.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Ghost Pepper Steak Lettuce Wraps with Mango-Lime Salsa
meals.description: Sear spiced sirloin, then pile it into crisp lettuce cups with a fiery mango-lime salsa for a Caribbean-Mexican heat blast. Simple, fast, and built for chili lovers.
prep_steps: Rinse and dry 1 head of lettuce; separate large leaves for cups.
Peel and dice 1 mango into small cubes.
Finely dice 1 small red onion (about 1/2 cup).
Chop 1/2 cup coriander (leaves and tender stems).
Finely mince 1 jalapenos and 1 small ghost chilli (use gloves).
Mince 2 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 2 limes into a small bowl.
Pat dry 600 g sirloin steak; trim excess fat.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp allspice, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, and half the minced ghost chilli.
cook_steps: Preheat a heavy pan on the stovetop (or outdoor grill) over high heat for 2–3 minutes.
Rub steak with 1 tbsp olive oil; coat all sides with the spice-chilli mix.
Sear steak 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thicker pieces may need 1–2 minutes more). Rest on a board 5 minutes.
While steak rests, make salsa: In a bowl, combine mango, red onion, jalapenos, remaining ghost chilli, half the coriander, half the lime juice, and 1 tsp olive oil. Season with a pinch of salt; toss.
Make a quick lime-garlic drizzle: Stir remaining lime juice, lime zest, minced garlic, and 1 tsp olive oil. Season with a pinch of salt.
Slice rested steak thinly against the grain.
Assemble: Layer lettuce leaves on a platter. Add steak slices, spoon mango salsa on top, drizzle with lime-garlic sauce, and finish with remaining coriander.
Serve immediately and let everyone build extra-hot wraps.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Pork & Pineapple Skewers with Spanish Rice
meals.description: Caribbean-hot pork and pineapple skewers blasted with habanero and allspice, served over simple Mexican-style Spanish rice. Quick grill + stovetop combo built for heat lovers.
prep_steps: Soak wooden skewers if using. Preheat OutdoorGrill to high.
Cut pork shoulder into 1-inch cubes.
Peel and core pineapple; cut into 1-inch chunks.
Slice bell peppers into 1-inch pieces.
Peel and cut red onion into 1-inch wedges.
Finely chop habanero peppers (use gloves).
Mince garlic.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, lime juice, allspice, chopped habanero peppers, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper to make the marinade.
Toss pork cubes in half the marinade; set aside 10 minutes.
Rinse spanish rice in a sieve until water runs clear.
cook_steps: Thread skewers: alternate marinated pork, pineapple, bell peppers, and red onion.
Start rice: In a saucepan over medium heat (StoveTop), add 1 tablespoon olive oil (from the listed amount if desired), then spanish rice; toast 1 minute.
Stir in vegetable stock and diced tomatoes; bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until tender. Keep covered off heat 5 minutes.
Grill skewers over high heat, turning every 2–3 minutes and brushing with the remaining marinade during the first two turns. Cook 8–12 minutes total until pork is cooked through with light char.
Fluff rice with a fork. Plate rice and top with skewers.
Optional: drizzle hot sauce for extra heat.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Chorizo & Black Bean Skillet with Warm Tortillas
meals.description: A fiery Caribbean–Mexican chorizo and black bean skillet punched up with habanero and chipotle, served with warm tortillas and fresh lime.
prep_steps: Dice onion and bell peppers; mince garlic.
Finely chop habanero peppers (wear gloves).
Drain and rinse black beans.
Open diced tomatoes and measure chipotle sauce, ground cumin, and oregano.
Cut lime into wedges; chop coriander.
Stack tortillas in a damp paper towel for microwaving later.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chorizo and cook 3–4 minutes until starting to brown.
Stir in onion and bell peppers; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and habanero peppers; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in ground cumin, oregano, chipotle sauce, and salt.
Add black beans and diced tomatoes; simmer 5–7 minutes to thicken.
Taste and, for extra heat, add a tiny pinch of ghost chilli; stir and simmer 1 minute.
Microwave tortillas 30–45 seconds until warm.
Top the skillet with chopped coriander and serve with warm tortillas and lime wedges.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Jerk Wings with Coconut Rice and Mango Salsa
meals.description: Grilled habanero-jerk chicken wings with creamy coconut rice and a quick mango-lime salsa. Blazing heat, simple steps, and fast family cooking.
prep_steps: Pat dry 1.5 kg chicken wings with paper towels.
Finely chop 2 habanero peppers (wear gloves) and 3 garlic cloves.
Zest and juice 2 limes; keep zest and juice separate.
Peel and dice 1 large mango; finely chop a small handful of coriander.
Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until mostly clear.
Measure 1 can coconut milk (about 400 ml) and 1.5 cups vegetable stock.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high (or heat a large grill pan on the stovetop). Oil grates lightly.
cook_steps: Make jerk marinade: In a bowl, mix chopped habanero, garlic, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tsp allspice, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp olive oil, and half the lime juice.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Fish over Spanish Rice with Charred Corn-Jalapeño Salsa
meals.description: Crispy, spicy fish glazed with habanero sauce over fluffy Spanish rice, topped with a fiery corn-jalapeño salsa. Built fast with bold Caribbean–Mexican heat.
prep_steps: Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
Finely dice onion; reserve half for salsa and half for the pan.
Chop coriander (cilantro).
Seed and finely chop jalapenos (leave seeds for extra heat).
Dice bell peppers.
Cut lime into wedges.
cook_steps: Cook spanish rice according to package directions; keep warm.
Heat a grill or a large skillet over high. Add a little olive oil and char corn and half the jalapenos for 3–4 minutes until lightly blistered; cool briefly.
In a bowl, combine charred corn, reserved raw jalapenos, half the chopped coriander, half the diced onion, a squeeze of lime, and a pinch of salt; set aside as salsa.
Season fish fillets lightly with salt and chilli powder. Brush both sides with habanero sauce.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high (or use a well-oiled grill). Sear fish 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and flaky.
In the same pan, add a splash more olive oil if needed. Soften remaining diced onion and bell peppers for 2–3 minutes; toss with a small spoon of habanero sauce for extra heat.
To serve, spoon spanish rice into bowls, top with seared fish, the warm pepper-onion mix, and the corn-jalapeño salsa. Finish with remaining coriander and lime wedges.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Steak & Pineapple Pepper Stir-Fry over Rice
meals.description: Quick seared sirloin tossed with bell peppers and pineapple in an allspice–habanero sauce, served over fluffy jasmine rice. Caribbean heat meets Mexican brightness for a fast family burn.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Slice 1 lb (450 g) sirloin steak thinly against the grain.
Core and slice 2 bell peppers into strips.
Slice 1 onion and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 2 cups pineapple into bite-size chunks.
Chop a small handful of coriander.
In a bowl, mix 2–3 tbsp habanero sauce, juice of 1 lime, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp allspice, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1/2 tsp salt.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender; rest covered 5 minutes.
Heat a large skillet on high. Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Sear steak in a single layer 1–2 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Stir-fry onion and bell peppers 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and pineapple; cook 2–3 minutes to lightly char edges.
Return steak and pour in the habanero-lime spice mix. Toss 30–60 seconds until glossy and hot. Season to taste with salt.
Fluff rice and portion into bowls. Top with the steak-pepper-pineapple mix. Sprinkle coriander.

Outdoor grill option (optional, for extra char): While rice cooks, grill pepper strips and pineapple on high heat 2–3 minutes per side, then proceed from the steak sear step and add the grilled pieces in.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Chicken & Pineapple Roti Wraps
meals.description: Caribbean-Mexican fusion wraps: fiery habanero chicken with sweet pineapple, warm spices, and fresh lime in soft roti. Fast skillet cook with optional grill-warm roti for a charred finish.
prep_steps: Thinly slice red onion and bell peppers.
Finely chop habanero peppers (wear gloves).
Mince garlic.
Cut pineapple into small chunks if not pre-cut.
Roughly chop coriander.
Cut lime into wedges.
Trim chicken thighs and slice into thin strips.
Place roti near the stove or grill for warming.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken strips; season with salt, cumin, and allspice. Stir-fry until lightly browned, 4–5 minutes.
Add garlic and chopped habanero peppers; cook 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Add sliced red onion and bell peppers; sauté until crisp-tender, 3–4 minutes.
Stir in chipotle sauce and pineapple; simmer 2–3 minutes to glaze and thicken. Adjust salt to taste.
Warm roti: heat on a dry skillet or OutdoorGrill 20–30 seconds per side until pliable and lightly charred.
Assemble wraps: spread a spoon of salsa on each roti, pile on the spicy chicken-pepper mix, top with coriander, and squeeze lime.
Fold and serve immediately.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Jerk Chicken & Black Bean Coconut Rice Bowls
meals.description: Fiery jerk-style chicken over coconut rice with limey black beans and peppers. Caribbean heat meets Mexican staples in a fast family bowl.
prep_steps: Dice chicken thighs into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Finely mince habanero peppers (use gloves).
Mince garlic.
Slice onion and bell peppers into thin strips.
Rinse and drain black beans.
Chop coriander and cut lime into wedges; squeeze 1 lime for juice.
If using an outdoor grill, preheat to high. If using stovetop, place a large skillet over medium-high heat.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix olive oil, minced habanero peppers, garlic, allspice, cumin, lime juice, and salt. Toss in chicken to coat.
Grill or pan-sear chicken in a single layer until browned and cooked through, 6–8 minutes, turning once. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet (or a grill-safe pan), add a little more olive oil if needed and cook onion and bell peppers with a pinch of salt until tender-crisp, 3–4 minutes. Remove from heat.
Warm coconut rice in a covered pot over low heat with a splash of water, 3–4 minutes, fluffing occasionally.
In a small pot, warm black beans over medium heat with a splash of water and hot sauce; simmer 2–3 minutes and season with a pinch of salt.
Assemble bowls: coconut rice, black beans, peppers and onions, and jerk chicken. Top with coriander and extra hot sauce if desired. Serve with lime wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
archetypes.description: Bold, spicy family dinners with Korean and Latin American flavors—multi-component plates (marinated proteins, quick pickles/salsas, rice or veg sides) built from scratch in 30–60 minutes for confident home cooks.
archetypes.rationale: Adds an Advanced, Hot-heat family archetype with new Korean and Latin American cuisines and 30–60 minute builds—filling gaps not covered by the existing mild/no-heat, simple, and showstopper entries.

meals.name: Gochujang-Grilled Chicken with Chimichurri and Charred Corn Rice
meals.description: Hot gochujang-marinated chicken grilled and topped with bright chimichurri, served with charred-corn jasmine rice and a crunchy chilli-vinegar cabbage slaw. A Korean–Latin mashup built from scratch with bold heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain well.
Trim 900 g chicken thighs and pat dry.
In a bowl, combine 3 tbsp gochujang, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sesame oil (divided later), 1 tbsp brown sugar, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, and zest of 1 lime; mix into a paste.
Toss chicken thighs in the gochujang paste to coat; marinate 15–20 minutes at room temperature.
Thinly slice 4 spring onion; set green tops aside for garnish.
Shred 1/2 small cabbage (about 4 cups).
Halve the lime and reserve for squeezing.
Preheat Outdoor Grill to medium-high heat. Place a medium saucepan with lid on the StoveTop.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice, 2 1/2 cups water, and a big pinch of salt to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, stir once, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 10 minutes.

Char corn: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet on the StoveTop (or a grill basket on the Outdoor Grill). Add 1 1/2 cups corn, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Cook 4–6 minutes until lightly charred. Stir in half of the sliced spring onion whites; remove from heat.
Grill chicken: Oil grill grates with 1 tsp canola oil. Grill marinated chicken thighs 5–6 minutes per side, until cooked through and lightly charred (juices run clear). Rest 5 minutes.

Make slaw: In a large bowl, toss shredded cabbage with 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, juice of 1/2 lime, 1 tsp chilli flakes, a pinch of salt, and 1 tsp sesame oil. Add remaining spring onion whites; toss again.
Finish rice: Fluff rice with a fork. Fold in charred corn mixture, 1 tsp sesame oil, and a squeeze of lime. Adjust salt to taste.
Serve: Slice or leave chicken thighs whole. Spoon chimichurri over the chicken. Sprinkle with spring onion greens and sesame seeds. Plate with charred-corn rice and a side of chilli-vinegar slaw.

meals.name: Gochujang Ribeye with Mango-Habanero Salsa, Cucumber Quick Pickle, and Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Charred, gochujang-glazed ribeye meets a bright mango-habanero salsa and a snappy cucumber quick pickle over fluffy jasmine rice. A bold Korean–Latin American family feast with real heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until mostly clear; drain.
Peel and dice mango (small cubes).
Finely mince 1–2 habanero peppers (remove seeds for slightly less heat).
Roughly chop coriander.
Thinly slice cucumber into rounds.
Mince garlic.
Slice spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and black pepper to make a steak glaze.
Pat dry ribeye steak and lightly oil with canola oil; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
In a small bowl, mix rice vinegar, sugar, and a pinch of salt until dissolved for the pickle brine.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and water to a pot (about 3 cups water). Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes. Rest off heat, covered, 5–10 minutes.
Start quick pickle: Toss cucumber with the vinegar brine and a pinch of chilli flakes. Press down so it’s submerged; chill while you cook.
Preheat an outdoor grill to high heat or heat a heavy stovetop skillet over high until very hot.

Grill/sear steak: Cook ribeye 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thicker steaks may need another minute per side). During the last minute, brush generously with the gochujang glaze on both sides to lacquer.
Rest steak 5–8 minutes on a board; brush with a little more glaze while resting.
Make salsa: In a bowl, combine diced mango, minced habanero, chopped coriander, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Stir and let sit 2–3 minutes.
Finish rice: Fluff rice with a fork. Fold in sliced spring onion and a light drizzle of sesame oil; season with salt to taste.
Slice steak against the grain.
Plate: Mound jasmine rice, top with sliced gochujang ribeye, spoon over mango-habanero salsa, and add cucumber quick pickle on the side. Sprinkle sesame seeds over steak and rice.

meals.name: Korean BBQ Pork Belly Tacos with Habanero Slaw and Sticky Rice
meals.description: Grilled Korean BBQ pork belly tucked into tortillas with a hot habanero-lime slaw and quick-pickled onions, served alongside fluffy sticky rice. A bold, from-scratch Korean–Latin mashup built for heat lovers.
prep_steps: Place pork belly in the freezer for 10 minutes to firm for slicing if needed.
Thinly slice pork belly into 1/4-inch strips.
In a bowl, whisk Korean BBQ sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and chilli flakes to make a marinade.
Toss pork belly in the marinade; set aside 15 minutes.
Finely shred cabbage; peel and julienne carrots.
Chop coriander and thinly slice spring onion; set aside for garnish.
Thinly slice red onion; place in a small bowl with rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and a splash of water to quick pickle.
Rinse sticky rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain and soak 10 minutes.
Halve and juice the lime; in a large bowl whisk habanero sauce, lime juice, a pinch of salt, and 1 teaspoon canola oil for slaw dressing.
Pat cabbage and carrots dry if wet; keep tortillas ready; preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high (or heat a grill pan on StoveTop).
cook_steps: Combine soaked sticky rice with water and a pinch of salt in a pot; bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 10 minutes off heat.
Toss cabbage and carrots with the habanero-lime dressing; set aside to lightly wilt.
Oil grill grates (or pan) lightly with canola oil. Grill marinated pork belly 2–3 minutes per side until charred edges and cooked through; transfer to a plate and tent loosely.
Warm tortillas on the grill or a dry pan 20–30 seconds per side until pliable.
Drain quick-pickled red onions.
Assemble tacos: place slaw on each tortilla, add pork belly, top with pickled red onions, spring onion, coriander, and sesame seeds. Add extra habanero sauce if desired.
Fluff sticky rice and serve on the side.

meals.name: Gochujang-Grilled Tilapia with Pineapple-Jalapeño Salsa, Sesame Cucumber Pickles, and Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Hot, sweet, and smoky tilapia glazed with gochujang, served with bright pineapple-jalapeño salsa, quick sesame cucumber pickles, and fluffy jasmine rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Dice 2 cups pineapple, finely chop 1 jalapeno (seeds optional), and finely dice 1/2 red onion.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup coriander.
Thinly slice 1 large cucumber into rounds.
In a bowl, whisk 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp sesame oil for quick pickles.
In another bowl, whisk 2 tbsp gochujang, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 grated garlic clove, juice of 1/2 lime, and 1 tbsp water for the fish glaze.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets and brush lightly with canola oil; season both sides with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high (or heat a grill pan on stovetop) and set a saucepan for rice on stovetop.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice, 2 1/4 cups water, and a pinch of salt to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12–15 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Make quick pickles: Toss cucumber with the rice vinegar mixture and set aside, stirring once during resting.
Make salsa: In a bowl, combine pineapple, jalapeno, red onion, half the coriander, a squeeze of lime, and a pinch of salt. Set aside.

Grill fish: Oil grill grates. Place tilapia on the grill, cook 2–3 minutes until opaque at edges. Flip, brush tops with the gochujang glaze, and cook 2–3 minutes more until just cooked through. Brush once more in the last 30 seconds.

Finish and plate: Scatter remaining coriander and 1 tsp sesame seeds over the fish. Serve fillets with jasmine rice, a mound of pineapple-jalapeno salsa, and drained sesame cucumber pickles. Offer extra lime wedges if desired.
instructions: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear.

Roughly chop 1/2 cup coriander.
Thinly slice 1 large cucumber into rounds.
In a bowl, whisk 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp sesame oil for quick pickles.
In another bowl, whisk 2 tbsp gochujang, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 grated garlic clove, juice of 1/2 lime, and 1 tbsp water for the fish glaze.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets and brush lightly with canola oil; season both sides with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high (or heat a grill pan on stovetop) and set a saucepan for rice on stovetop.
Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice, 2 1/4 cups water, and a pinch of salt to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12–15 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Make quick pickles: Toss cucumber with the rice vinegar mixture and set aside, stirring once during resting.
Make salsa: In a bowl, combine pineapple, jalapeno, red onion, half the coriander, a squeeze of lime, and a pinch of salt. Set aside.

Grill fish: Oil grill grates. Place tilapia on the grill, cook 2–3 minutes until opaque at edges. Flip, brush tops with the gochujang glaze, and cook 2–3 minutes more until just cooked through. Brush once more in the last 30 seconds.

Finish and plate: Scatter remaining coriander and 1 tsp sesame seeds over the fish. Serve fillets with jasmine rice, a mound of pineapple-jalapeno salsa, and drained sesame cucumber pickles. Offer extra lime wedges if desired.

meals.name: Fire-Grilled Picanha with Habanero Chimichurri, Korean-Style Cucumber Quick Pickle, and Brown Basmati Rice
meals.description: Char-grilled picanha in a hot chilli-garlic glaze, served with tangy cucumber quick pickles and brown basmati rice, finished with a fiery chimichurri. Advanced, from-scratch build with bold Korean and Latin American heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups brown basmati rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
Thinly slice 1 cucumber into half-moons; slice 2 spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of chilli flakes for the quick pickle.
In a small bowl, mix 1/3 cup chimichurri with 1–2 tbsp habanero sauce and the juice of 1/2 lime; adjust salt to taste.
In another bowl, make a glaze: 1 tbsp chilli paste, 2 grated garlic cloves, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp brown sugar, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Pat dry 1–1.2 kg picanha steak; score fat cap lightly and coat with the chilli-garlic glaze.
Chop 2 tbsp coriander and 2 tbsp parsley for garnish.
Preheat outdoor grill to high (two zones if possible: hot and medium).
cook_steps: Combine rinsed rice with 3 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt in a pot; bring to a boil on the stovetop, then cover and simmer on low until tender, 25–30 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes.
Toss cucumber slices in the pickle brine; set aside, stirring once or twice while you cook.
Oil grill grates lightly with a paper towel dipped in olive oil. Place picanha fat-side down over medium heat zone to render for 6–8 minutes, managing flare-ups.

Move to hot zone and sear 2–3 minutes per side for a deep char. Continue grilling over medium heat until internal temp reaches your preference (about 50–54°C for medium-rare), 10–15 minutes total depending on thickness.
Rest steak on a board 8–10 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
Fluff rice with a fork. Drain excess liquid from the cucumber pickles.
Plate: spoon rice, fan sliced picanha, add cucumber quick pickles, and drizzle the habanero chimichurri over the steak.
Garnish with spring onion, coriander, and parsley. Serve extra habanero chimichurri on the side.

meals.name: Gochujang Lomo Saltado with Crispy Oven Potatoes and Jasmine Rice
meals.description: A hot, Korean–Latin stir-fry of sirloin, red onion, tomatoes, and bell peppers in a gochujang–soy–vinegar glaze, served over jasmine rice with a side of crispy oven potatoes and a bright coriander–lime finish.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F; place a sheet pan inside to heat.
Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Slice 700 g sirloin steak into thin strips; pat dry.
Thinly slice 1 red onion; wedge 2 tomatoes; slice 1 bell peppers into strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 900 g potatoes into 1 cm fries; pat dry.
Chop 1 small bunch coriander and 2 spring onion; quarter 1 lime.
In a bowl, whisk sauce: 2 tbsp gochujang, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp habanero sauce (or to taste), 1/3 cup water.
In a small cup, mix 2 tsp cornflour with 2 tbsp water (slurry).
Season steak strips with 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp canola oil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Spread on the preheated sheet pan and roast 25–30 minutes, turning once, until deeply golden and crisp.
Start rice: combine rinsed jasmine rice with 2.5 cups water and a pinch of salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and cook 12 minutes. Off heat, rest covered 10 minutes.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil; sear half the steak 60–90 seconds until just browned; transfer. Repeat with remaining steak.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil to the pan. Stir-fry red onion and bell peppers 2 minutes on high. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.

Return steak to the pan with tomatoes. Stir sauce; add to pan and boil 30 seconds. Stir in cornflour slurry and cook 30–60 seconds until glossy and coats ingredients. Adjust heat with more habanero sauce if desired.
Off heat, toss in most of the chopped coriander and spring onion; squeeze half the lime over.
Fluff rice. Serve rice in bowls, top with the gochujang lomo saltado. Add crispy potatoes on the side. Garnish with remaining coriander and spring onion; serve with remaining lime wedges.

meals.name: Chipotle-Gochujang Pork Skewers with Grilled Pineapple and Spanish Rice
meals.description: Spicy Korean-Latin fusion: pork shoulder skewers in a gochujang–chipotle glaze, grilled with pineapple, served alongside fluffy Spanish rice and a fresh corn–jalapeño salsa. Built for heat lovers with layered components.
prep_steps: Soak 8 wooden skewers in water for 15 minutes if using wooden skewers; or set out metal skewers.
Cut pork shoulder into 1.5-inch cubes; pat dry.
Peel and core pineapple; cut into 1.5-inch chunks.
Finely chop garlic.
Finely dice red onion and jalapenos; chop coriander.
Juice the lime.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high heat (clean and oil grates).
Set a medium saucepan with lid on the stovetop for rice.
cook_steps: Make marinade: In a bowl, whisk gochujang, chipotle sauce, rice vinegar, honey, avocado oil, half the chopped garlic, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Marinate pork: Toss pork cubes in the marinade to coat; reserve 2 tablespoons marinade separately for basting.
Skewer: Thread pork and pineapple alternately onto skewers; lightly oil the outside with a touch of avocado oil.

Start rice: Add spanish rice and water to the saucepan (follow pack ratio; typically 2 cups water per cup rice). Add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low until tender. Rest 5 minutes off heat, covered.

Make corn–jalapeño salsa: Char corn kernels in a hot skillet or on the grill until blistered. Toss with diced red onion, jalapenos, remaining garlic, lime juice, chopped coriander, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Set aside.

Grill skewers: Place skewers on the hot grill. Cook 8–10 minutes total, turning every 2–3 minutes. Brush with reserved marinade during the last turns to glaze. Cook until pork is just cooked through with light char.
Fluff rice with a fork. Adjust salt to taste.
Serve: Plate Spanish rice, top with pork–pineapple skewers, and spoon corn–jalapeño salsa on the side. Sprinkle extra coriander if desired.

meals.name: Gochujang–Chorizo Fried Rice with Grilled Corn and Quick-Pickled Cabbage
meals.description: Spicy gochujang fried rice studded with crispy chorizo and fire-kissed corn, served with a bright, crunchy cabbage pickle and avocado-lime finish. A bold Korean–Latin mashup built from scratch.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain well.
Measure 2 1/2 cups water.
Thinly slice 1/2 head cabbage.
Dice 1 onion and 1 bell peppers.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Shuck 2 ears corn (or measure 1 1/2 cups kernels).
Dice 1 avocado; cut 1 lime into wedges and reserve half for juice.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup coriander.
In a bowl, mix 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt for the quick pickle.
In a small cup, stir together 2 tbsp gochujang, 1 tsp chilli flakes, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Combine rinsed jasmine rice and water in a pot; bring to a simmer, cover, and cook on low 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 10 minutes; spread on a tray to steam off.
Quick-pickle cabbage: Toss sliced cabbage with the vinegar-sugar-salt mix and a squeeze of lime. Massage 30 seconds and set aside, tossing occasionally.
Grill corn: Preheat OutdoorGrill to high. Grill corn 6–8 minutes, turning, until lightly charred. Cut kernels off cobs. (StoveTop alternative: char kernels in a dry skillet on high 3–4 minutes.)
Crisp chorizo: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high. Add diced chorizo; cook 3–4 minutes until browned and rendered. Scoop out, leaving fat in pan.
Stir-fry aromatics: Add onion and bell peppers; stir-fry 3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Fry rice: Add 1 tbsp canola oil and the cooled rice. Stir-fry 3–4 minutes, breaking clumps until hot and a bit toasted.

Season: Push rice to the sides; add the gochujang mixture to the center. Sizzle 30 seconds, then toss to coat evenly. Add grilled corn and cooked chorizo; stir. Drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil and adjust salt to taste.

Finish and serve: Fold in half the chopped coriander and a squeeze of lime. Plate fried rice, top with diced avocado, remaining coriander, and extra chilli flakes or habanero sauce to taste. Serve with quick-pickled cabbage on the side and lime wedges.

meals.name: Spicy Dak-Galbi Rice Bowls with Avocado-Jalapeño Salsa and Quick Pickled Red Onions
meals.description: Korean-style gochujang chicken stir-fry over Spanish rice with a fresh Latin avocado-jalapeño salsa and quick pickled red onions. Built hot and from scratch for a bold family feast.
prep_steps: Cut chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, rice vinegar (2 tbsp), sesame oil, sugar, garlic (minced), black pepper, and chilli flakes. Toss in chicken to coat; marinate 15–20 minutes.
Thinly slice red onion and place in a small bowl with rice vinegar (2 tbsp) and a pinch of salt and sugar. Toss and set aside to quick pickle.
Dice tomatoes and avocado; mince jalapenos; chop coriander. In a bowl, combine with lime juice and a pinch of salt to make salsa.
Slice onions and bell peppers; shred cabbage.
Measure spanish rice, water, and salt.
cook_steps: Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil and spanish rice; toast 1 minute, stirring.
Add water and 1 tsp salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15–18 minutes until tender. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes.
Heat a large skillet or grill pan (or OutdoorGrill with a flat plate) over high heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil.
Stir-fry sliced onions and bell peppers 2–3 minutes until charred-tender; add cabbage and cook 1–2 minutes more. Season with a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp canola oil to the hot pan. Add marinated chicken in an even layer. Sear 3–4 minutes, then toss and cook 3–4 minutes more until cooked through and lightly charred.
Return vegetables to the pan with the chicken and toss 30–60 seconds to glaze and heat through. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Fluff the spanish rice with a fork.
Assemble bowls: rice, spoon over the spicy chicken and vegetables, top with avocado-jalapeño salsa, and finish with quick pickled red onions.

meals.name: Gochujang-Carne Asada Sirloin with Charred Corn-Jalapeño Salsa, Quick Pickled Cucumber, and Brown Basmati Rice
meals.description: Grilled gochujang-lime marinated sirloin meets a punchy corn–jalapeño salsa and sesame cucumber quick pickles, served with fluffy brown basmati rice. Built hot and from-scratch for a family feast.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Smash and finely mince 4 cloves garlic.
Halve 2 limes; juice both and reserve.
Thinly slice 1 cucumber; place in a bowl.
Finely dice 1 red onion (divide: half for salsa, half for pickles).
Finely chop a handful of coriander (stems and leaves).
Finely chop 2 jalapenos (seed for less heat if desired).
Shuck 3 ears worth of corn kernels (or measure 3 cups corn).
Pat dry 1 kg sirloin steak; trim silver skin if needed.
Preheat outdoor grill to high (two-zone if possible). Set a stovetop pot with 3.5 cups water ready for rice.
cook_steps: Marinate steak: In a bowl mix 2 tbsp gochujang, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp canola oil, 2 minced garlic cloves, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Coat sirloin; rest 15–20 minutes at room temp.
Start rice: Bring 3.5 cups water to a boil, add rinsed brown basmati rice and 1 tsp salt. Reduce to low, cover, and simmer 30–35 minutes until tender; rest 5 minutes off heat, covered.
Quick pickles: Toss sliced cucumber with remaining red onion, 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp sesame seeds. Massage lightly and chill.

Char salsa base: Toss corn with 1 tbsp canola oil and a pinch of salt. Grill in a perforated tray or cast-iron pan 6–8 minutes, stirring, until charred. Cool slightly, then mix with half the red onion, jalapenos, 2 tbsp lime juice, chopped coriander, and a pinch of salt and black pepper.

Grill steak: Sear marinated sirloin over high heat 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thickness dependent), moving to indirect heat to finish if needed. Rest 8–10 minutes, then slice against the grain into thin strips.
Finish rice: Fluff with a fork. Optional: sprinkle a pinch of sesame seeds.
Plate: Mound rice, top with sliced steak and spoon over any resting juices. Add a generous scoop of charred corn–jalapeño salsa and a side of sesame cucumber pickles.
Serve: Lime wedges optional (use remaining lime juice to drizzle if preferred) and extra chopped coriander.

archetypes.name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
archetypes.description: Set-and-forget family dinners with zero chili heat using sheet pans and slow cookers, leaning on Greek and Middle Eastern flavors for busy weeknights and relaxed weekends.
archetypes.rationale: Fills a gap by offering family-friendly, no-heat, hands-off meals in the 30–60 and 60+ min ranges with different equipment and cuisines than the existing weeknight classics.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Lemon-Oregano Chicken with Potatoes, Peppers, and Olives
meals.description: Hands-off Greek–Middle Eastern style roast chicken and vegetables with bright lemon, oregano, and sumac. Everything goes on one tray for an easy family dinner with no chili heat.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil for easy cleanup.
Scrub potatoes and cut into 2–3 cm chunks.
Seed bell peppers and slice into thick strips.
Peel and slice red onion into wedges.
Mince garlic.
Zest then halve the lemon; cut one half into wedges and reserve the other half for juice.
Rinse and drain olives. Roughly chop parsley.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss potatoes, bell peppers, and red onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Spread in an even layer.
Roast vegetables for 15 minutes to start them cooking.

While veg roasts, pat chicken thighs dry. In a bowl, mix remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, remaining garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp lemon juice, oregano, sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Coat chicken thighs in the mixture.
Remove pan, push vegetables to make space, and nestle chicken thighs on top, skin side up if skin-on.
Return pan to oven and roast 25–30 minutes, until chicken is cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F) and potatoes are tender.
Scatter olives over the pan and roast 3 more minutes to warm.
Squeeze remaining lemon over the tray. Sprinkle parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Optional slow cooker variation (set-and-forget): Add potatoes, peppers, onion, garlic, olives, and chicken (coated in the same seasoning) to the slow cooker. Cook on High 3–4 hours or Low 6–7 hours until chicken is done and potatoes are tender. Finish with lemon juice and parsley. For crisper edges, broil finished chicken and veg on a sheet pan for 3–5 minutes.
instructions: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil for easy cleanup.
Scrub potatoes and cut into 2–3 cm chunks.
Seed bell peppers and slice into thick strips.
Peel and slice red onion into wedges.
Mince garlic.
Zest then halve the lemon; cut one half into wedges and reserve the other half for juice.
Rinse and drain olives. Roughly chop parsley.
On the sheet pan, toss potatoes, bell peppers, and red onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Spread in an even layer.
Roast vegetables for 15 minutes to start them cooking.

While veg roasts, pat chicken thighs dry. In a bowl, mix remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, remaining garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp lemon juice, oregano, sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Coat chicken thighs in the mixture.
Remove pan, push vegetables to make space, and nestle chicken thighs on top, skin side up if skin-on.
Return pan to oven and roast 25–30 minutes, until chicken is cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F) and potatoes are tender.
Scatter olives over the pan and roast 3 more minutes to warm.
Squeeze remaining lemon over the tray. Sprinkle parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Optional slow cooker variation (set-and-forget): Add potatoes, peppers, onion, garlic, olives, and chicken (coated in the same seasoning) to the slow cooker. Cook on High 3–4 hours or Low 6–7 hours until chicken is done and potatoes are tender. Finish with lemon juice and parsley. For crisper edges, broil finished chicken and veg on a sheet pan for 3–5 minutes.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Baharat Beef & Chickpeas with Herbed Couscous
meals.description: Hands-off Middle Eastern–Greek comfort: tender baharat beef and chickpeas simmered in tomatoes, served over lemon-parsley couscous. Mild, family-friendly, and set-and-forget.
prep_steps: Peel and dice onion.
Scrub and slice carrots into 1 cm rounds.
Rinse and drain chickpeas.
Roughly chop parsley.
Cut lemon into wedges; reserve a half for juicing.
Measure baharat, salt, and black pepper.
Have couscous and water ready for later.
cook_steps: Add beef stew meat to the slow cooker.
Add onion, carrots, chickpeas, crushed tomatoes, beef stock, baharat, bay leaves, salt, black pepper, and olive oil. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook on Low for 6–8 hours or on High for 3–4 hours until beef is tender.

15 minutes before serving, bring water to a boil in a pot. Stir in couscous, a pinch of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil if desired, cover, and remove from heat. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Stir chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice into the couscous. Sprinkle oregano and toss.
If using, stir preserved lemon into the stew and remove bay leaves.
Serve couscous in bowls, top with beef and chickpeas, and add lemon wedges on the side.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Za'atar Salmon with Courgette & Tomatoes and Lemon Couscous
meals.description: Hands-off roasted salmon and vegetables with bright Mediterranean flavors, paired with quick lemon couscous. Minimal prep, family-friendly, and no chili heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan with parchment.
Slice courgette into half-moons and red onion into wedges.
Rinse cherry tomatoes and pat dry.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, za'atar, sumac, minced garlic, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper.
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
Bring water to a boil in a small pot for couscous.
Roughly chop parsley and cut lemon in half for juicing.
cook_steps: Toss courgette, cherry tomatoes, and red onion with half of the za'atar oil. Spread on the sheet pan in a single layer.
Roast vegetables for 15 minutes on the middle rack.
Remove pan, make space, and place salmon on the pan. Brush salmon with the remaining za'atar oil.
Return pan to oven and roast 10–12 minutes, until salmon flakes and vegetables are tender.
While salmon roasts, add couscous to a heatproof bowl. Pour boiling water over, cover, and let stand 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in chopped parsley, lemon juice (to taste), and a drizzle of olive oil. Adjust salt if needed.
Scatter olives over the roasted vegetables, then serve salmon with the veg and lemon couscous.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Lemon–Olive Lamb Shanks with Potatoes
meals.description: Hands-off lamb shanks gently braised with potatoes, oregano, preserved lemon, and olives for mellow Greek–Middle Eastern flavors. Minimal prep; the slow cooker does the work.
prep_steps: Peel and slice onion.
Peel carrots; cut into thick chunks.
Scrub potatoes; cut into large chunks.
Finely chop garlic.
Rinse olives and drain.
Rinse preserved lemon; remove pulp and finely chop the peel.
Measure spices, salt, and pepper.
Set slow cooker to Low or High based on desired cook time.
cook_steps: Add potatoes, carrots, and onion to the slow cooker in an even layer.
Place lamb shanks on top of the vegetables.
Sprinkle garlic, oregano, ground cumin, cinnamon, bay leaves, salt, and black pepper over the shanks.
Drizzle olive oil over everything, then pour in beef stock around the sides.
Cover and cook: Low for 7–8 hours or High for 4–5 hours, until lamb is very tender.
Stir in olives and preserved lemon during the last 15 minutes of cooking; re-cover.
Optional finish: Transfer shanks to a sheet pan and place under a hot oven broiler for 3–5 minutes to brown; return to cooker to baste with juices.
Discard bay leaves. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Serve lamb shanks over the potatoes and vegetables, spooning braising juices on top.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Lemon-Oregano Whole Chicken with Potatoes & Olives
meals.description: Set-and-forget Greek–Middle Eastern style whole chicken with tender potatoes and a bright lemon-olive finish. Optional quick oven blast crisps the skin before serving.
prep_steps: Scrub 1 kg potatoes and cut into 3–4 cm chunks.
Peel 2 onions and cut into thick wedges.
Rinse 4–5 carrots and cut into 3–4 cm pieces.
Crush 6 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; cut the squeezed lemon into wedges.
Pat dry 1 whole chicken.
Measure spices: 2 tsp oregano, 1.5 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper.
Measure liquids: 2 tbsp olive oil, 120 ml water.
Optional: Rinse 1 preserved lemon and chop the rind; drain 100 g olives.
cook_steps: Add potatoes, onions, and carrots to the slow cooker. Scatter half the garlic, half the oregano, and half the salt and pepper over the vegetables.
Stir together olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, remaining garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Place whole chicken breast-side up on top of the vegetables. Pour the lemon-oil mixture over the chicken. Tuck lemon wedges around. Add water and 2 bay leaves.
Cover and cook on Low for 6–7 hours or on High for 3.5–4 hours, until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Optional crisp: Transfer chicken to a roasting tray and brush with some cooking juices; roast in a hot oven (220°C) for 8–10 minutes to crisp the skin.
Return chicken to the vegetables (remove bay leaves). Stir in olives and optional chopped preserved lemon rind. Rest 5 minutes.
Carve and serve chicken with the potatoes and vegetables, spooning over the lemony juices.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Oregano Halloumi with Courgette & Tomatoes and Lemon Couscous
meals.description: Hands-off roasted halloumi and vegetables with Greek/Middle Eastern flavors, served over quick lemon couscous. Simple prep, mostly oven time.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan.
Cut halloumi cheese into 2–3 cm cubes.
Slice courgette into 1 cm half-moons.
Slice bell peppers into strips and red onion into wedges.
Lightly crush or mince garlic.
Halve the lemon; finely zest one half and juice both halves, keeping zest and juice separate.
Rinse and drain olives.
Measure couscous and water.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss courgette, bell peppers, red onion, and garlic with olive oil, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Spread in an even layer.
Roast 20 minutes until vegetables start to soften.
Remove pan, add halloumi cheese and olives, and gently toss with the vegetables. Return to oven and roast 10–15 minutes until halloumi is golden at the edges.
While the pan finishes, bring water to a boil (kettle or small pot). Add couscous to a heatproof bowl with a pinch of salt and half the lemon zest. Pour boiling water over, cover, and rest 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in lemon juice and remaining lemon zest; adjust salt to taste.
Serve couscous in bowls and top with the roasted halloumi and vegetables.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Chermoula Turkey with Peppers & Courgette, served with Herbed Couscous
meals.description: Hands-off roasted turkey and vegetables coated in chermoula, finished with olives and lemon, with a quick parsley couscous on the side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan.
Slice bell peppers into strips, courgette into half-moons, and red onion into wedges.
Pat turkey dry with paper towels.
In a bowl, mix chermoula with olive oil to make a loose paste.
Rinse parsley and finely chop.
Halve the lemon; zest one half and cut the rest into wedges.
Bring 1.5 cups water to a boil in a small pot for couscous.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss bell peppers, courgette, and red onion with half the chermoula mixture, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Add turkey to the pan and brush with the remaining chermoula; spread everything in a single layer.
Roast for 25–30 minutes, turning vegetables and flipping turkey once halfway, until turkey is cooked through.
During roasting, pour the boiling water over couscous in a pot, add a pinch of salt, stir, cover, and let sit off heat for 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork; mix in chopped parsley, lemon zest, and a drizzle of olive oil.
In the last 5 minutes of roasting, scatter olives over the sheet pan to warm.
Squeeze lemon over the turkey and vegetables. Serve with the herbed couscous and extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Greek Meatballs with Peppers & Red Onion, served with Tzatziki Pitas
meals.description: Hands-off sheet-pan meatballs roasted with sweet peppers and red onion, finished with lemon and served in warm pitas with tzatziki. Greek/Middle Eastern flavors with no chili heat.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a sheet pan with foil.
Cut bell peppers into strips.
Slice red onion into wedges.
Mince garlic.
Zest then cut lemon into wedges.
In a bowl, combine olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt, and black pepper.
cook_steps: Toss bell peppers and red onion on the sheet pan with half the olive oil mixture.
Add meatballs to the pan and brush or spoon the remaining olive oil mixture over them.
Roast for 20 minutes, then stir vegetables and turn meatballs.
Roast 10–15 minutes more until meatballs are browned and cooked through.
Warm pita bread: microwave 20–30 seconds just before serving or wrap in foil and place on the sheet pan for the last 5 minutes.
Squeeze lemon wedges over meatballs and vegetables; sprinkle lemon zest and chopped parsley if using.
Serve meatballs and vegetables tucked into warm pita bread with tzatziki.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Baked Feta with Chickpeas, Tomatoes, and Warm Pitas
meals.description: A Greek-inspired, hands-off sheet-pan bake of feta, chickpeas, and tomatoes with oregano and lemon. Serve with warm pita for an easy family dinner with no chili heat.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 200°C/400°F and line a large sheet pan.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Slice red onion into thin wedges.
Cut lemon into wedges.
Roughly chop parsley (optional).
cook_steps: Add chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, and red onion to the sheet pan. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and black pepper, and sprinkle with oregano. Toss to coat and spread out.
Nestle a block or thick slab of feta cheese in the center. Drizzle the feta with a little olive oil and a pinch of oregano.
Bake for 20–25 minutes until tomatoes soften and edges of feta are lightly golden.
During the last 5 minutes, add pita bread wrapped in foil to the oven to warm, or microwave pita bread for 20–30 seconds just before serving.
Squeeze lemon wedges over the pan. Scatter olives and parsley on top.
Serve the baked feta, chickpeas, and vegetables with warm pita bread.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Cumin–Tomato Lentil Stew with Lemon Basmati
meals.description: Hands-off Middle Eastern-style lentil and vegetable stew simmered in the slow cooker, finished with parsley and served over fluffy lemon basmati rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups lentils under cold water; drain.
Peel and dice 1 large onion.
Peel and slice 2 carrots into 1 cm rounds.
Peel and finely chop 3 cloves garlic.
Rinse 1 1/2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Wash and chop a small handful of parsley.
Halve and juice 1 lemon.
cook_steps: Add to the slow cooker: lentils, onion, carrots, garlic, 1 can (about 400 g) crushed tomatoes, 3 cups vegetable stock, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 bay leaf, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Stir.
Cook on High for 3–4 hours or Low for 6–7 hours until lentils are tender. Remove bay leaf.
Near serving time, cook the rice: add rinsed basmati rice and 2 1/4 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12 minutes. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes.
Fluff rice and stir in 1–2 tablespoons lemon juice and a pinch of salt.
Stir 1–2 tablespoons lemon juice into the stew. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve lemon basmati in bowls, ladle stew over, and top with chopped parsley.

archetypes.name: Family High-Protein Dinners (30–60, Mild, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Protein-forward family dinners that build balanced plates around lean meats, seafood, and plant proteins with mild seasoning in 30–60 minutes.
archetypes.rationale: Introduces a clearly missing HighProtein family archetype with mild flavors and 30–60 minute intermediate builds, complementing existing weeknight, low-carb, and spicy options without overlapping their focus.

meals.name: Za’atar Lemon Chicken with Herbed Basmati and Chickpea Tomato Salad
meals.description: Oven-finished za’atar lemon chicken thighs with fluffy herbed basmati rice and a bright chickpea-tomato-cucumber salad. Mild, protein-forward and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Position a rack in the center.
Rinse 1.5 cups basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear; drain well.
Peel and finely chop 1 medium onions.
Peel and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Zest 1 lemon, then juice both lemons (about 6 tbsp juice total); keep zest and juice separate.
Roughly chop parsley (about 1/2 cup chopped), divide into two portions.
Dice tomatoes and cucumber into bite-size pieces.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon zest, 3 tbsp lemon juice, minced garlic, za'atar, paprika, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Add chicken thigh fillets and toss to coat.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken thigh fillets 2–3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 12–15 minutes until chicken is cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F). Rest 5 minutes; spoon pan juices over the chicken.
While chicken bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Sauté chopped onions 3–4 minutes until translucent.

Add drained basmati rice to the pan; stir 1 minute to coat. Pour in chicken stock, add a pinch of salt (to taste), bring to a boil, then reduce to low. Cover and simmer 12 minutes. Remove from heat and steam covered 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork; fold in half the chopped parsley and a pinch of black pepper.
Make the salad: In a bowl, combine chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, remaining chopped parsley, 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 tbsp lemon juice, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Toss to coat.
Plate herbed basmati rice, top with za’atar lemon chicken and pan juices, and serve salad on the side.

meals.name: Lemon-Herbed Beef and Broccoli Orzo Skillet
meals.description: Tender beef sirloin and broccoli fold into a lemony, garlic-herb orzo for a balanced, protein-forward family skillet. Mild flavors, hearty texture, ready in under an hour.
prep_steps: Cut broccoli into small florets; peel stems and slice thin.
Mince garlic.
Zest and halve lemon; juice one half and reserve the other for wedges if desired.
Slice beef sirloin steak thinly across the grain; pat dry.
Finely chop parsley.
Warm chicken stock in a saucepan on low (helps the orzo cook evenly).
cook_steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high.
Season beef with salt and black pepper; sear in two batches 1–2 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate (it will finish later).
Reduce heat to medium; add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the same skillet. Add orzo and toast 2 minutes, stirring.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in warm chicken stock and sprinkle in italian seasoning. Stir, bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook orzo uncovered 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally so it doesn’t stick.
Scatter broccoli over the orzo, cover the skillet, and steam 5–6 minutes until broccoli is tender-crisp and orzo is al dente. If pan looks dry before orzo is done, add a splash of stock or water.
Return seared beef and any juices to the pan; fold through for 1–2 minutes to warm and finish cooking.
Stir in lemon zest and lemon juice; season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Turn off heat, sprinkle parsley, rest 2 minutes, then serve.

meals.name: Turkey Basil Meatballs in Tomato Sauce with Quinoa and Green Beans
meals.description: Juicy turkey meatballs simmered in a mild tomato-garlic basil sauce, served over fluffy chicken-stock quinoa with crisp-tender green beans. High-protein and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F.
Rinse 1.5 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Finely chop 1 large onion.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup basil leaves.
Trim 400 g green beans, cut any long ones in half.
Set out a large oven-safe skillet and a medium saucepan with lid.
cook_steps: Start sauce: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in the oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook 4–5 minutes until translucent. Add half the minced garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add 800 g crushed tomatoes, half the chopped basil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Simmer on low while you form meatballs.
Mix meatballs: In a bowl, combine 800 g turkey, remaining minced garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Gently mix and form 16 golf-ball-sized meatballs.
Sear meatballs: Increase skillet to medium-high, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Nestle meatballs into the pan, sear 2 minutes, turn to sear another 2 minutes.
Bake to finish: Spoon some sauce over the meatballs, transfer skillet to the oven, and bake 12–15 minutes until meatballs are cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F).
Cook quinoa: In the saucepan, bring 3 cups chicken stock to a boil. Stir in rinsed quinoa, reduce to low, cover, and cook 15 minutes. Rest off heat 5 minutes, then fluff.
Cook green beans: While quinoa cooks, bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and cook 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain and toss with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt.
Finish and serve: Stir remaining basil into the tomato sauce. Plate quinoa, top with meatballs and sauce, and serve green beans on the side.

meals.name: Cumin-Paprika Chicken with Chickpea Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables
meals.description: Juicy spiced chicken thighs served over lemony chickpea quinoa with a tray of roasted onions, peppers, and zucchini. Mild, protein-forward, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F with a large sheet pan inside.
Rinse 1.5 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Measure 3 cups water for the quinoa.
Drain and rinse chickpeas; set aside 1.5 cups.
Cut onions, bell peppers, and zucchini into bite-size pieces.
Mince garlic cloves.
Zest then juice the lemon; keep separately.
Pat dry chicken thigh fillets and trim excess fat.
Roughly chop parsley.
cook_steps: Roast vegetables: In a bowl, toss onions, bell peppers, and zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper. Spread on the preheated sheet pan and roast 18–22 minutes, tossing once, until tender and lightly charred.
Season chicken: In a large bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, lemon zest, 1/2 tsp salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Add chicken and coat well.
Sear chicken: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until browned.

Finish chicken in oven: Transfer the skillet to the oven (or move chicken to the sheet pan edges) and roast 8–12 minutes more, until cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F). Rest 5 minutes, then slice.

Cook quinoa: While chicken cooks, bring 3 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in rinsed quinoa, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 14–16 minutes until water is absorbed. Remove from heat, cover, and rest 5 minutes.
Finish quinoa: Fluff quinoa with a fork. Fold in chickpeas, 1 tbsp lemon juice, half the chopped parsley, a pinch of salt, and black pepper to taste. Warm over low heat 1–2 minutes if needed.
Plate: Spoon chickpea quinoa onto plates, top with sliced chicken, add roasted vegetables on the side, and finish with remaining parsley and extra lemon juice to taste.

meals.name: Herb-Paprika Seared Tuna with Roasted Potatoes and Green Beans
meals.description: Pan-seared tuna steaks with a mild lemon-garlic herb rub, served alongside oven-roasted potatoes and sautéed green beans. A balanced, high-protein family plate with straightforward timing.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F (fan 200°C).
Scrub and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks.
Trim green beans.
Finely chop parsley.
Zest and halve the lemon.
Peel and mince garlic.
Pat tuna steak dry with paper towels.
cook_steps: Roast potatoes: Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper on a baking tray. Roast 25–30 minutes, turning once, until golden and tender.
Make herb rub: In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, lemon zest, 1 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp salt, and half the chopped parsley.
Season tuna: Rub the herb mixture over tuna steak on both sides. Set aside 5–10 minutes while potatoes finish.
Start green beans: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium. Add green beans and 2 tbsp water, cover, and steam-sauté 3–4 minutes until bright green.
Finish green beans: Uncover, season with a pinch of salt and black pepper, and cook 2–3 minutes more to lightly char. Squeeze in a little lemon juice and transfer to a warm plate.
Sear tuna: Increase skillet heat to medium-high. Add a thin film of olive oil if needed. Sear tuna 2–3 minutes per side for medium (adjust to preference).
Finish and serve: Toss roasted potatoes with remaining parsley and a squeeze of lemon. Plate tuna with potatoes and green beans; serve with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Garlic-Herb Chicken and Mushroom Quinoa Skillet with Roasted Green Beans
meals.description: Seared chicken thigh fillets simmered with mushrooms, onions, and garlic over fluffy quinoa, served with oven-roasted green beans. Mild, protein-forward, and weeknight-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Rinse 1 1/2 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Trim ends from 400 g green beans; pat dry.
Slice 250 g mushrooms.
Dice 1 large onion.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop a small handful of parsley.
Cut 700–800 g chicken thigh fillets into 3–4 cm pieces; pat dry.
Halve and juice 1 lemon.
cook_steps: Toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper on a tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender-crisp; shake once midway. Keep warm.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and black pepper, then sear 4–5 minutes until browned. Remove to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Sauté onions and mushrooms with a pinch of salt for 5–6 minutes until lightly browned.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add rinsed quinoa and toast 1 minute, stirring.
Pour in 3 cups water and 1 tsp chicken stock concentrate; stir to dissolve. Return chicken and any juices to the skillet.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer. Cover and cook 16–18 minutes until quinoa is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Turn off heat. Fluff the quinoa; stir in 2 tbsp lemon juice and parsley. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken-quinoa skillet topped with extra parsley alongside the roasted green beans.

meals.name: Turkish-Style Beef & Lentil Stuffed Peppers with Brown Basmati-Quinoa Pilaf
meals.description: Bell peppers filled with a mild spiced beef and lentil tomato mixture, baked until tender and served with a brown basmati-quinoa pilaf. A balanced, high-protein family plate with gentle seasoning.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice with quinoa under cold water until it runs clear.
Halve 4 bell peppers lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes.
Peel and finely chop 1 large onions.
Peel and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Rinse 1 cup lentils under cold water.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup parsley.
cook_steps: Place bell pepper halves cut-side up on a baking tray, brush with 1 tsp olive oil, and bake for 10 minutes to soften.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large stove-top pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 500 g minced beef, 1 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes, breaking up meat until no longer pink.
Stir in 1.5 tsp ground cumin and 1 tsp paprika; cook 30 seconds.

Add 400 g diced tomatoes, rinsed lentils, and 1 cup water. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low and cook 18–22 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lentils are just tender and mixture is thick. Adjust seasoning with salt and black pepper to taste.

While filling simmers, add rinsed brown basmati rice with quinoa to a pot with 3 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 18–22 minutes until tender; rest 5 minutes covered, then fluff.
Stir chopped parsley into the beef-lentil mixture.
Spoon the filling into the par-baked bell pepper halves. Drizzle with 1 tsp olive oil.
Return stuffed peppers to the oven and bake 10–12 minutes until peppers are tender and tops slightly caramelized.
Serve stuffed peppers alongside fluffed brown basmati-quinoa pilaf.

meals.name: Lemon-Dill Rainbow Trout with Brown Basmati Rice and Roasted Asparagus
meals.description: Oven-roasted rainbow trout with dill and lemon, paired with fluffy brown basmati rice and crisp roasted asparagus. A mild, protein-forward family dinner done in under an hour.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large baking tray with foil or baking paper.
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Trim woody ends from asparagus.
Finely chop dill and mince garlic.
Pat rainbow trout dry with paper towels.
Zest the lemon, then cut it in half (reserve one half for juice, slice the other half for garnish).
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice and 3 cups water with a big pinch of salt to a saucepan; bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Keep covered to steam 5 minutes off heat.
On the lined tray, toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until crisp-tender; push to one side of the tray.

Place trout fillets skin-side down on the cleared side of the tray. Drizzle with 2 tbsp olive oil, sprinkle minced garlic, most of the chopped dill, salt, and black pepper. Lay a few lemon slices on top.
Roast trout 8–10 minutes until it flakes easily with a fork (thicker fillets may need up to 12 minutes).
Fluff the cooked rice with a fork; fold in lemon zest and a squeeze of lemon juice. Adjust salt and pepper.
Plate rice, top with trout, and serve with roasted asparagus. Finish with remaining dill and an extra squeeze of lemon to taste.

meals.name: Teriyaki Tofu Veggie Brown Rice Bowls
meals.description: Crispy tofu and mixed vegetables in a mild teriyaki glaze over brown basmati rice for a balanced, protein-forward family dinner. Simple stir-fry technique with a quick pan sauce.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Cut 600 g tofu into 2 cm cubes and pat dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, whisk 1/3 cup teriyaki sauce, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tsp cornflour, and 1/3 cup water; set aside.
Cut 1 large head broccoli into small florets; peel and slice the stalk thinly.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Slice 4 spring onion (whites and greens separated).
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice and 3 cups water to a pot with a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 6–8 minutes, turning to brown on multiple sides.
Push tofu to one side; add 1 tsp sesame oil and the broccoli. Stir-fry 3 minutes.
Add 300–400 g stir-fry vegetables and spring onion whites; stir-fry 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add minced garlic; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Whisk the teriyaki mixture, then pour into the pan. Toss gently and cook 1–2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats tofu and vegetables. Adjust with a splash of water if too thick.
Taste and season with a little black pepper and a few drops of soy sauce if needed. Finish with 1 tsp sesame oil off heat.
Serve bowls of rice topped with teriyaki tofu and vegetables. Garnish with spring onion greens and 1 tbsp sesame seeds.

meals.name: Lemon-Herb Chicken with Roasted Veg, Couscous, and Dill Yogurt
meals.description: Seared lemon-herb chicken thighs with roasted zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion, served over fluffy couscous with a cool dill-yogurt sauce. Mild flavors, high protein, and weeknight-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Cut zucchini into half-moons and bell peppers into strips; slice red onion into wedges.
Mince garlic (4 cloves for chicken/marinade and 1 clove for yogurt).
Zest then halve the lemon; squeeze juice into a small bowl.
Pat chicken thigh fillets dry with paper towels.
Finely chop parsley (2 tbsp) and dill (2 tbsp).
Grate cucumber on large holes, then squeeze out excess liquid with a clean towel.
Measure couscous and water.
cook_steps: On a sheet pan, toss zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Roast 18–22 minutes, tossing once, until tender and lightly charred.

In a bowl, mix 1 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp lemon zest, 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tbsp chopped parsley, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Add chicken thigh fillets and coat well.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Transfer skillet to the oven (or move chicken to the sheet pan edges) and roast 8–12 minutes, until chicken reaches doneness.

While chicken cooks, bring 1 1/4 cups water and a pinch of salt to a boil. Stir in couscous, cover, remove from heat, and rest 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and fold in remaining lemon zest and 1 tbsp chopped parsley.

In a small bowl, combine yoghurt, grated cucumber, remaining minced garlic clove, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp chopped dill, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Stir to make a smooth sauce.
Slice chicken if desired. Plate couscous, top with roasted vegetables and chicken, and spoon dill yogurt over or alongside. Garnish with remaining dill.

Cut zucchini into half-moons and bell peppers into strips; slice red onion into wedges.
