Pat chicken thigh fillets dry with paper towels.
Finely chop parsley (2 tbsp) and dill (2 tbsp).
Grate cucumber on large holes, then squeeze out excess liquid with a clean towel.
Measure couscous and water.
On a sheet pan, toss zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Roast 18–22 minutes, tossing once, until tender and lightly charred.

In a bowl, mix 1 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp lemon zest, 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tbsp chopped parsley, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Add chicken thigh fillets and coat well.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Transfer skillet to the oven (or move chicken to the sheet pan edges) and roast 8–12 minutes, until chicken reaches doneness.

While chicken cooks, bring 1 1/4 cups water and a pinch of salt to a boil. Stir in couscous, cover, remove from heat, and rest 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and fold in remaining lemon zest and 1 tbsp chopped parsley.

In a small bowl, combine yoghurt, grated cucumber, remaining minced garlic clove, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp chopped dill, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Stir to make a smooth sauce.
Slice chicken if desired. Plate couscous, top with roasted vegetables and chicken, and spoon dill yogurt over or alongside. Garnish with remaining dill.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
archetypes.description: Presentation-forward Indian family dinners—layered biryanis, tandoori-style roasts, festival curries with chutneys and raita—that reward slow, careful cooking for a memorable weekend spread.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a non-Western weekend showstopper with medium heat and long build time—coverage not met by the existing Spanish/Portuguese-only showstopper—while staying Family + None scope.

meals.name: Saffron Chicken Dum Biryani with Cucumber Raita
meals.description: A layered chicken biryani sealed and baked on dum with saffron milk, fried onions, and herbs, served with a cooling cucumber raita. Weekend showstopper with medium heat and classic Indian flavors.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Warm milk slightly and crumble saffron into it; set aside to bloom.
Slice onions thinly.
Chop coriander and mint.
Mince garlic.
Cut cucumber into small dice for raita.
In a bowl, combine yoghurt, lemon juice, salt, turmeric powder, garam masala, chili flakes, and minced garlic; add chicken thighs and coat well. Marinate 30–60 minutes refrigerated.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Mix flour with enough water to form a pliable rope for sealing the pot lid; cover to prevent drying.
cook_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add salt and a bay leaf. Add soaked basmati rice and cook until 70% done (grains still firm), about 5–6 minutes. Drain and spread to steam off.

Heat ghee with a little canola oil in a heavy oven-safe pot over medium heat. Fry sliced onions, stirring, until deep golden and crisp at edges. Remove half to a plate for layering; leave the rest in the pot.
Add cumin seeds, peppercorns, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and a bay leaf to the pot; toast 30–45 seconds until aromatic.
Increase heat to medium-high. Add marinated chicken thighs and any marinade; sear 2–3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Reduce heat to medium. Cook chicken with lid ajar 8–10 minutes, stirring once, until just starting to release juices.
Turn heat off. Scatter half the chopped mint and coriander over the chicken, then half the reserved fried onions.
Layer par-cooked rice evenly over the chicken. Drizzle saffron milk over the rice and dot with a little ghee. Top with remaining fried onions and remaining herbs.
Run the flour rope around the pot rim, press on the lid to seal. Transfer to oven and bake 35–40 minutes.
Rest 10 minutes out of the oven, then break the seal. Gently fluff, lifting chicken and rice together to keep layers distinct.
For the raita: In a bowl, mix yoghurt, diced cucumber, ground cumin, a pinch of salt, and chopped mint. Serve alongside the biryani.

meals.name: Tandoori-Style Whole Chicken with Cashew Korma Gravy and Jeera Saffron Rice
meals.description: A centerpiece roasted whole chicken in a yoghurt-spice marinade, served with a rich cashew-coconut korma gravy and fragrant cumin-saffron basmati rice. A family-style Indian feast built for weekend showtime.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F. Set a rack in the middle.
Rinse basmati rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak in fresh water for 20 minutes.
Soak cashews in hot water for 20 minutes; drain.
In a bowl, whisk yoghurt, lemon juice, oil, garlic (minced), salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, turmeric powder, and garam masala to make the marinade.
Pat the whole chicken dry with paper towels. Using a small knife, score shallow slashes in the thighs and breasts.
Thinly slice onions. Pick mint leaves.
Bloom saffron in 2 tablespoons warm water and set aside.
cook_steps: Rub the yoghurt marinade all over and under the skin of the whole chicken. Place on a rack over a roasting tray. Roast 20 minutes at 200°C/390°F.
Reduce oven to 180°C/355°F and continue roasting 45–60 minutes, basting twice with tray juices, until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 75°C/167°F. Rest 10–15 minutes.
While chicken roasts, make the cashew korma base: In a pot over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon ghee. Add sliced onions with a pinch of salt and cook 12–15 minutes until deeply golden.
Add garlic (minced) and cook 1 minute. Stir in cumin, coriander, chili flakes, turmeric powder, and garam masala; cook 30 seconds.

Add drained cashews and coconut milk. Simmer 5 minutes. Blend until smooth (carefully) and return to the pot. Adjust with water for a pourable gravy. Season with salt, lemon juice, and a pinch of sugar to balance. Keep warm on low.
Cook the jeera saffron rice: Drain soaked basmati rice. In a saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon ghee over medium. Add cumin seeds and bay leaves; sizzle 30 seconds until fragrant.

Add rice and stir 1 minute to coat. Add water (about 1.5 cups per cup of rice), saffron water, and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low. Cook 12 minutes; rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Carve the rested chicken. Spoon cashew korma gravy onto a platter, nestle chicken pieces over, and drizzle more gravy on top.
Garnish with mint. Serve with jeera saffron rice on the side.

meals.name: Rogan Josh Lamb Shanks with Saffron Peas Pulao and Cucumber-Mint Kachumber
meals.description: Fall-apart lamb shanks braised in a deep rogan josh gravy, paired with fragrant saffron peas basmati rice and a bright cucumber-mint kachumber. A centerpiece Indian feast with layered aromas and medium heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Pat dry 4 lamb shank pieces with paper towels and season with salt and black pepper.
Slice 3 large onions thinly.
Crush 6 garlic cloves.

Measure spices: 2 tsp turmeric powder, 2 tsp garam masala, 2 tsp ground cumin (or 2 tsp cumin seeds), 2 tsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 bay leaves, 4 green cardamom, 4 cloves, 1 small cinnamon stick.
Open 1 can crushed tomatoes (about 400 g).
For kachumber: dice 1 cucumber and 2 tomato; finely chop 1 small red onion, a handful of mint, and a handful of coriander; slice 1 chilies; cut 1 lemon in half.
For pulao: measure 1 pinch saffron, 1 cup peas, and 2.5 cups water; keep 2 tbsp oil ready.
cook_steps: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sear lamb shank on all sides until browned (8–10 minutes). Remove to a plate.
Lower to medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring, until deep golden (12–15 minutes).
Add garlic; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in turmeric powder, garam masala, ground cumin (or cumin seeds), coriander seeds, chili flakes, black pepper, bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon; toast 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes and 1 cup water; scrape up browned bits. Return lamb shank to the pot, spooning sauce over.
Bring to a gentle bubble, cover tightly, and transfer to the oven. Braise 2–2.5 hours, turning lamb once midway, until very tender.
30 minutes before lamb is done, start the saffron peas pulao: Warm 2.5 cups water; crumble saffron into it and let steep 5 minutes.
In a medium pot, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium. Add drained basmati rice; stir 1 minute to coat.
Pour in saffron water and 1 tsp salt; bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low. Cook 10 minutes.
Scatter peas over the rice (do not stir), cover, and cook 5 more minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes, then fluff gently.
Make kachumber: In a bowl combine cucumber, tomato, red onion, mint, coriander, and chilies. Squeeze lemon over, season with salt and black pepper, and toss.
Finish the lamb: Remove pot from oven. If sauce is thin, simmer uncovered on stovetop 5–10 minutes to thicken. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Serve lamb shanks with plenty of rogan josh gravy over saffron peas pulao. Add kachumber on the side for freshness.

meals.name: Paneer Tikka Masala Feast with Saffron Jeera Rice and Poppadoms
meals.description: Charred oven-baked paneer tikka folded into a creamy masala, served with saffron-cumin basmati rice, crisp poppadoms, and mango chutney. A weekend showstopper with medium heat and classic Indian flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 230°C/450°F. Line a baking tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Cut paneer into 3 cm cubes.
In a bowl, mix yoghurt, tikka paste, lemon juice, grated garlic, garam masala, cumin, chili flakes, and salt to make the marinade.
Toss paneer in the marinade; cover and set aside 30 minutes.
Rinse basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; drain well.
Soak a pinch of saffron in 2 tbsp warm water.
Finely slice onions and mince garlic for the sauce.
Chop coriander for garnish.
Gather rice aromatics: ghee, cumin seeds, bay leaf, cardamom, salt, peas.
cook_steps: Paneer tikka: Arrange marinated paneer on the oiled tray. Bake 12–15 minutes until edges char slightly; broil for 1–2 minutes if needed. Set aside.
Masala base: Heat ghee in a wide pot over medium heat. Add sliced onions; cook 12–15 minutes, stirring, until deep golden.
Add minced garlic; cook 1 minute. Stir in tomato paste and cook 2 minutes.
Pour in crushed tomatoes, black pepper, and sugar; simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low, stir in cream and a pinch of salt; simmer 5 minutes until silky.
Fold the baked paneer into the masala; simmer 5 minutes to coat well. Adjust salt and heat to taste. Keep warm on low.
Rice: In a medium pot, melt ghee over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and cardamom; toast 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add rinsed rice and stir 1 minute to coat. Pour in water, saffron with its soaking liquid, peas, and salt. Bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered. Fluff with a fork and remove whole spices.
Poppadoms: Heat 1–2 cm oil in a wide pan over medium-high. Fry poppadoms one at a time for a few seconds per side until puffed and crisp; drain on paper towel.
Serve: Spoon rice onto a platter, top with chopped coriander. Ladle paneer tikka masala into a serving bowl. Serve with poppadoms, mango chutney, and lemon wedges.

meals.name: Keema-Stuffed Peppers with Saffron Pea Pilaf and Cucumber-Mint Yoghurt
meals.description: Baked bell peppers filled with spiced lamb keema, served alongside fragrant saffron basmati with peas and a cooling cucumber-mint yoghurt. A colorful family centerpiece with medium heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F. Lightly oil a baking dish.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until clear; drain well.
Warm 2 tablespoons water and crush a pinch of saffron into it; set aside to bloom.
Halve 4 bell peppers lengthwise, remove seeds and membranes; set cut-side up in the baking dish.
Finely chop 2 onions and 2 tomatoes; mince 4 cloves garlic.
Finely chop 2 tablespoons mint and half a cucumber for the yoghurt.
Measure spices for keema: 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon chili flakes (or to taste), 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.
Measure spices for pilaf: 1 bay leaf, 3 cardamom pods (lightly crushed), 1 small cinnamon stick, 1 teaspoon salt. Rinse 1 cup peas if using frozen.
cook_steps: Make the keema (stovetop): Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for 30 seconds.
Add onions and cook 6–8 minutes until deep golden. Add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add 700 g lamb mince, break it up, and cook until browned and most liquid evaporates, 8–10 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili flakes, salt, and black pepper. Cook 5–7 minutes until thick and spoonable. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Stuff peppers: Spoon hot keema into each pepper half, mounding slightly. Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over the tops.
Bake peppers (oven): Place baking dish on middle rack and bake 25–30 minutes until peppers are tender and lightly blistered.
Cook saffron pea pilaf (stovetop): In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon oil or ghee over medium heat. Add bay leaf, cardamom, and cinnamon; toast 30 seconds.

Add drained rice and stir 1 minute to coat. Add 2 1/2 cups water, saffron water, peas, and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes; fluff with a fork.
Make cucumber-mint yoghurt: In a bowl, combine 1 cup yoghurt, chopped cucumber, mint, a pinch of salt, and 1 teaspoon lemon juice.
Finish and serve: Plate pilaf, top with baked keema-stuffed peppers, and add a spoon of cucumber-mint yoghurt. Serve extra lemon wedges on the side.

meals.name: Raan-Style Leg of Lamb with Saffron Almond Pilaf and Cucumber-Mint Raita
meals.description: Slow-roasted North Indian spiced leg of lamb served with a fragrant saffron-almond basmati pilaf and a cooling cucumber-mint raita. A festive, centerpiece roast with classic sides.
prep_steps: Soak 2 cups basmati rice in cold water for 20 minutes; drain.
Crush 6 cloves garlic to a paste.
Finely chop 2 onions.
Grate or finely chop 1 cucumber; squeeze out excess liquid.
Chop a small handful of mint.
Warm 2 tablespoons water and steep a pinch of saffron for 10 minutes.

Make lamb marinade in a bowl: 1.5 cups yoghurt, juice of 1 lemon, garlic paste, 2 tablespoons garam masala, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1–2 teaspoons chili flakes, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 tablespoons oil.
Pat dry 1 leg of lamb and score shallow crosshatches on the surface.
Rub marinade all over the leg of lamb, pushing into cuts; cover and refrigerate 2–12 hours.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F. Set out a large roasting pan with rack and foil.
cook_steps: Place marinated leg of lamb on a rack in the roasting pan; cover loosely with foil.
Roast at 160°C/320°F for 2 hours, basting with pan juices every 30 minutes.
Remove foil, increase oven to 200°C/390°F, and roast 20–30 minutes more until deeply browned and internal temp reaches about 60–65°C/140–149°F for medium. Rest 20 minutes, tented.
For raita: in a bowl combine 1 cup yoghurt, grated cucumber, chopped mint, 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds (lightly crushed), a squeeze of lemon, and salt to taste. Chill.
For pilaf: heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom, 4 cloves, and a small piece of cinnamon; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions with a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until golden.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 2 minutes to coat in ghee.
Add saffron with its soaking water, 3.5 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper; bring to a simmer.
Fold in 1 cup peas and 1/2 cup roughly chopped almonds. Cover, reduce to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Warm naan in the hot oven for 3–5 minutes just before serving.
Slice lamb across the grain. Serve with saffron almond pilaf, cucumber-mint raita, and warm naan.
instructions: Soak 2 cups basmati rice in cold water for 20 minutes; drain.

Pat dry 1 leg of lamb and score shallow crosshatches on the surface.
Rub marinade all over the leg of lamb, pushing into cuts; cover and refrigerate 2–12 hours.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F. Set out a large roasting pan with rack and foil.
Place marinated leg of lamb on a rack in the roasting pan; cover loosely with foil.
Roast at 160°C/320°F for 2 hours, basting with pan juices every 30 minutes.
Remove foil, increase oven to 200°C/390°F, and roast 20–30 minutes more until deeply browned and internal temp reaches about 60–65°C/140–149°F for medium. Rest 20 minutes, tented.
For raita: in a bowl combine 1 cup yoghurt, grated cucumber, chopped mint, 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds (lightly crushed), a squeeze of lemon, and salt to taste. Chill.
For pilaf: heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom, 4 cloves, and a small piece of cinnamon; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions with a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until golden.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 2 minutes to coat in ghee.
Add saffron with its soaking water, 3.5 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper; bring to a simmer.
Fold in 1 cup peas and 1/2 cup roughly chopped almonds. Cover, reduce to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Warm naan in the hot oven for 3–5 minutes just before serving.
Slice lamb across the grain. Serve with saffron almond pilaf, cucumber-mint raita, and warm naan.

meals.name: Aloo Matar Masala with Jeera Rice and Lemon-Mint Kachumber
meals.description: A from-scratch family feast: spiced potato and pea masala, fragrant cumin basmati rice, and a bright lemon-mint kachumber. Medium heat, layered flavors, and showstopper presentation.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; drain well.
Peel and cut 5 medium potatoes into 2 cm cubes; keep in water to prevent browning.
Finely chop 2 onions.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Open 1 can diced tomatoes and measure 1.5 cups.
Measure 1 cup peas.
Dice 2 tomatoes, 1 cucumber, and finely slice 1/2 red onion for the salad.
Chop a handful of mint and a handful of coriander; keep some leaves for garnish.
Halve and juice 1 lemon.
Set out spices: cumin seeds, turmeric powder, garam masala, chili flakes, bay leaves, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, and salt.
Boil a kettle or have 4 cups water ready for cooking.
cook_steps: Make Aloo Matar Masala: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions and a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes, stirring, until deep golden.
Add minced garlic; stir 30 seconds. Add 1 tsp turmeric powder and 1 tsp chili flakes; stir 20 seconds.
Stir in 1.5 cups diced tomatoes and cook 5 minutes until thick and glossy.
Drain potatoes and add to the pot with 1.5 cups water and 1 tsp salt. Cover and simmer 15 minutes, stirring once.
Add 1 cup peas; simmer uncovered 5–8 minutes until potatoes are tender and sauce coats them.
Stir in 1.5 tsp garam masala and a handful of chopped coriander; adjust salt and heat to taste. Keep warm.
Cook Jeera Rice: In a medium saucepan, heat 1.5 tbsp oil over medium. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 bay leaf, 1 small piece cinnamon, 2 cloves, and 2 cardamom pods; toast 45 seconds.
Add drained basmati rice; stir gently 1 minute to coat.
Add 3 cups water and 1 tsp salt; bring to a boil. Reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes, then fluff with a fork.

Make Lemon-Mint Kachumber: In a bowl combine diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, and sliced red onion. Add 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, chopped mint, and chopped coriander; toss.
Plate: Mound jeera rice on a platter, spoon Aloo Matar Masala beside it, and serve kachumber on the side. Garnish with extra mint and coriander leaves.

meals.name: Malai Kofta Feast with Tomato-Cashew Cream and Saffron Cardamom Rice
meals.description: Paneer–potato dumplings in a silky tomato-cashew cream sauce, paired with fragrant saffron cardamom basmati rice and warm garlic naan. A centerpiece Indian family spread with medium heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Warm 2 tablespoons milk and crumble a pinch of saffron into it; set aside to bloom.
Peel and boil 3 medium potatoes until tender; drain and cool slightly.
Finely chop 2 onions and 4 cloves garlic.
Soak 1/2 cup cashews in hot water for 15 minutes; drain.
Crumble 250 g paneer into a bowl.
Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F). Line a tray for holding koftas warm.
Blend soaked cashews with 1/4 cup milk to a smooth paste; set aside.

Measure spices: 1 teaspoon cumin seeds (for sauce) + 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds (for rice), 4 green cardamom pods (split), 1 small cinnamon stick, 2 cloves, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, 2 bay leaves.
Dice open 1 can diced tomatoes (about 400 g) and have 1/2 cup tomato puree ready.
Chop a small handful of coriander for garnish.
cook_steps: Make kofta mixture: Mash the warm potatoes in a bowl. Add crumbled paneer, 2 tablespoons chickpea flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1/4 teaspoon garam masala. Mix until it holds together; form 12 golf-ball-sized koftas.
Shallow-fry koftas: Heat 1/4 cup oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Fry koftas in batches, turning to brown all sides (5–7 minutes total). Transfer to the preheated oven to keep warm.
Start sauce: In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon ghee over medium. Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 2 split cardamom pods, the cinnamon stick, and 2 cloves; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring, until deep golden (10–12 minutes). Add garlic; cook 1 minute.
Add 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, and 1 teaspoon garam masala; stir 30 seconds.
Stir in diced tomatoes and 1/2 cup tomato puree; simmer 6–8 minutes to thicken. Add the cashew paste and 1/2 cup water; simmer 3–4 minutes more.
Finish sauce: Stir in 1/3 cup cream and 1/2 teaspoon sugar; season with salt to taste. Reduce heat to low.

Cook rice: In a medium pot, heat 1 teaspoon ghee. Add 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds, 2 split cardamom pods, and 2 bay leaves; toast 30 seconds. Add the drained rice, 2 1/4 cups water, and 1 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Rest off heat 10 minutes.
Stripe rice with the bloomed saffron milk; fluff gently to marble the color.
Assemble: Nestle the warm koftas into the simmering sauce; spoon sauce over and heat 2 minutes without boiling. Discard whole spices if desired.
Warm garlic naan bread on an oven rack for 3–4 minutes.
Serve: Plate rice, ladle over malai kofta, garnish with chopped coriander, and serve with warm garlic naan.

meals.name: Goan-Style Coconut Fish Curry with Saffron Jeera Rice and Oven-Warmed Naan
meals.description: A festival-worthy coconut fish curry balanced with tamarind, served with fragrant saffron jeera rice and warm naan. Medium heat and layered flavors for a weekend family feast.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Slice 2 large onions thinly.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Cut 700–800 g fish fillets into large chunks (about 5 cm).
In a bowl, toss fish with 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice; set aside 15 minutes.
Warm 1/4 cup water and pinch saffron together in a small cup; let bloom.
Preheat oven to 180°C for warming naan.
cook_steps: Make the curry base: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds and 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; let them crackle 30 seconds.
Add sliced onions and a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes, stirring, until deep golden.
Stir in minced garlic; cook 1 minute.
Add 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1 teaspoon paprika; stir 30 seconds.
Add 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes and 1 teaspoon sugar; simmer 6–8 minutes until thick and glossy.
Pour in 400 ml coconut milk and 2 tablespoons tamarind chutney; add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Simmer gently 5 minutes; taste and balance with more tamarind chutney or sugar if needed (medium heat).
Slide in marinated fish pieces in a single layer. Simmer on low 6–8 minutes until just cooked through. Finish with a handful of chopped coriander and a squeeze of lemon.
Cook the rice: In a saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon ghee over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add the drained basmati rice; stir to coat 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and the bloomed saffron with its water.
Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low; cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered. Fluff with a fork.
Warm the naan: Wrap naan in foil and warm in the preheated oven for 5–7 minutes until soft.
Serve: Spoon saffron jeera rice onto a platter, ladle fish curry on the side, scatter with extra coriander, and serve with warm naan and lemon wedges.

meals.name: Chicken Dum Biryani Feast with Mirch Ka Salan and Cucumber-Mint Raita
meals.description: Layered chicken dum biryani finished in the oven, served with a classic peanut–sesame mirch ka salan and cooling cucumber-mint raita. A weekend showstopper with medium heat and big aroma.
prep_steps: Rinse 3 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Slice 4 large onions thinly; keep 1 large onion separate for the salan.
Finely chop 1 cup mint and 1 cup coriander; reserve half for garnish.
Crush 6 garlic cloves.

In a bowl, mix 1 cup yoghurt, 3 tbsp biryani mix, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp salt, juice of 1 lemon, and half the chopped mint/coriander; add 1.2 kg chicken thighs and coat well. Marinate 30–60 minutes (longer is better).
Warm 1/4 cup milk and steep a big pinch saffron; set aside.
Measure whole spices for rice: 2 bay leaves, 6 cardamom, 6 cloves, 1 cinnamon stick.
For salan: measure 1/3 cup peanuts, 2 tbsp sesame seeds, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 cup coconut milk, 2 tbsp tamarind chutney.
Halve 10–12 chilies (keep seeds for heat) and slice 1 cucumber for raita.
cook_steps: Fry onions for biryani: Heat 3 tbsp oil and 2 tbsp ghee in a wide pan over medium-high. Fry 3 of the sliced large onions with 1/2 tsp salt, stirring, until deep golden and crisp at edges (15–20 minutes). Remove half for layering; leave the rest in the pan.

Parboil rice: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil with 1 tbsp salt, the bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon. Add soaked rice; cook 5–6 minutes until 70% done. Drain; spread briefly to steam off.

Start chicken base: In the onion pan, add the marinated chicken and 2 crushed garlic cloves. Sear 3–4 minutes per side until lightly colored. Turn heat to low; cook 5 minutes to start releasing juices. Turn off heat.

Layer biryani (dum): Transfer chicken and its juices to a heavy oven-safe pot. Scatter half the reserved fried onions, half the remaining mint/coriander, and 4–5 halved chilies over chicken. Spread the parboiled rice on top. Drizzle saffron milk and 1 tbsp ghee over rice. Top with remaining fried onions and herbs.
Seal and bake: Cover pot tightly with a lid (use foil under lid if loose). Bake at 180°C/350°F for 35–40 minutes. Rest 10 minutes before opening.
Make mirch ka salan paste: In a dry pan, toast 1/3 cup peanuts and 2 tbsp sesame seeds over medium heat until fragrant (3–4 minutes). Add 1/2 cup water and blend to a smooth paste.

Cook salan: In a saucepan, heat 2 tbsp oil. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds and 1 tsp cumin seeds; let them crackle. Add the reserved 1 large sliced onion; cook until golden. Stir in the peanut–sesame paste, 1 cup coconut milk, 2 tbsp tamarind chutney, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 cup water. Add 6–8 halved chilies. Simmer gently 12–15 minutes until thick, adjusting water as needed. Salt to taste.
Mix raita: Whisk 1 cup yoghurt with a pinch of salt and 1/2 tsp cumin. Fold in sliced cucumber and 2 tbsp chopped mint.
Finish biryani: Gently fluff the top rice layer, then fold down into the chicken in two or three scoops to keep layers intact. Taste and adjust salt.
Serve: Plate biryani with extra herbs on top. Ladle mirch ka salan alongside and add a spoon of raita.

archetypes.name: Family Keto Weeknight Plates (Mild, 15–30, Simple)
archetypes.description: Fast, keto-friendly family dinners built around lean proteins, leafy or cruciferous veg, and rich but simple sauces—no grains, sugars, or starchy sides—using approachable Greek, Middle Eastern, and American flavors.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a missing Family keto archetype with mild heat and 15–30 minute simplicity, complementing existing low-carb/high-protein sets and avoiding overlap with prior cuisines and formats.

meals.name: Greek Lemon-Oregano Chicken Thighs with Zucchini and Tzatziki
meals.description: Pan-seared, oven-finished chicken thighs with lemon, oregano, and garlic, served over sautéed zucchini and topped with tzatziki and feta. Mild, keto-friendly flavors for a quick family dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Pat dry the chicken thigh fillets with paper towels.
Zucchini: trim ends and slice into half-moons about 1 cm thick.
Mince the garlic.
Zest and juice the lemon; cut remaining lemon into wedges.
Crumble the feta cheese.
Chop the parsley.
cook_steps: Season chicken on both sides with salt, black pepper, half the oregano, half the minced garlic, and half the lemon zest.
Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer skillet to the oven and cook 8–10 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Rest 3 minutes.
While chicken bakes, heat a large pan over medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add remaining garlic and sauté 30 seconds.
Add zucchini, remaining oregano, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Sauté 3–4 minutes until just tender; remove from heat and toss with remaining lemon zest and half the lemon juice.
Slice chicken if desired. Plate zucchini, top with chicken, spoon tzatziki over, and scatter feta and parsley.
Finish with a light sprinkle of sumac and a squeeze of lemon to taste.

meals.name: Lamb Kofta Lettuce Boats with Tahini-Lemon Drizzle
meals.description: Seared and broiled lamb koftas served in crisp romaine leaves with a simple cucumber-tomato-mint salad and a tahini-lemon drizzle. Mild, keto-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat oven broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a rack on top.
Grate onions and squeeze out excess liquid with your hands.
Mince garlic.
Chop parsley and mint.
Halve cherry tomatoes and dice cucumber.
Juice lemon.
Separate romaine lettuce leaves, rinse, and pat dry.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine lamb mince, grated onions, half the garlic, parsley, cumin, paprika, 1 tsp salt, and black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Shape mixture into 12 small oval koftas.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear koftas 4–5 minutes, turning to brown all sides.
Transfer koftas to the prepared rack and broil 2–3 minutes until cooked through (internal temp 71°C/160°F).
In a small bowl, whisk tahini, lemon juice, a pinch of salt, remaining garlic, and 1 tbsp olive oil until smooth and drizzleable.
In another bowl, toss cucumber, cherry tomatoes, mint, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Assemble: place 2–3 koftas in romaine lettuce leaves, top with the cucumber-tomato mix, and drizzle with tahini-lemon sauce. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lemon-Sumac Pork Chops with Roasted Broccoli
meals.description: Quick-seared pork chops finished with a bright lemon-sumac drizzle, served alongside crisp roasted broccoli. Mild, keto-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Cut broccoli into medium florets; dry well.
Mince garlic.
Zest then halve the lemon.
Pat pork chops dry; set out spices, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Toss broccoli with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper; spread on a sheet pan.
Roast broccoli for 15–18 minutes until edges are browned and tender.
While broccoli roasts, season pork chops on both sides with 1 tsp salt, black pepper, oregano, and half the sumac.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high until shimmering.
Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until nicely browned and just cooked through (internal temp ~63°C/145°F); rest on a plate.
Turn heat to low; add remaining 0.5 tbsp olive oil and garlic to the skillet. Stir 20–30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in lemon juice and remaining sumac to make a quick pan drizzle, scraping up browned bits. Remove from heat.
Plate pork chops with roasted broccoli. Spoon lemon-sumac drizzle over the chops and a little over broccoli. Sprinkle lemon zest and parsley to finish.

meals.name: Pan-Seared Sirloin with Garlic Herb Butter, Roasted Asparagus, and Greek Salad
meals.description: Quick steak night with a bright Greek salad and tender roasted asparagus, all keto-friendly and mild. Simple steps for a family weeknight plate.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Trim woody ends from asparagus.
Pat beef sirloin steak dry with paper towels.
Slice cucumber into half-moons and halve the cherry tomatoes.
Thinly slice red onion.
Cut lemon in half for juice.
In a bowl, combine 3 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1/2 lemon, 1 tsp oregano, a pinch of salt, and black pepper for dressing.
Add cucumber, cherry tomatoes, olives, red onion, and crumbled feta cheese to a large salad bowl (do not toss yet).
cook_steps: Toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper on a baking tray. Roast 10–12 minutes until tender-crisp.
Season beef sirloin steak on both sides with salt and black pepper.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear steak 3–4 minutes per side for medium (adjust to preference).
Transfer steak to a plate and rest 5 minutes. Top with 2–3 tbsp garlic herb butter to melt over the steak.
Toss the salad with the lemon-oregano dressing just before serving.
Slice steak against the grain. Plate with roasted asparagus and the Greek salad.

meals.name: Middle Eastern Turkey Patties with Lemon Kale, Roasted Tomatoes, and Cauli Rice
meals.description: Juicy cumin-paprika turkey patties seared then finished in the oven, served with lemony kale, roasted cherry tomatoes, and quick cauliflower rice. Mild, keto-friendly, and weeknight fast.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a sheet pan with baking paper.
Finely chop onions. Mince garlic. Roughly chop parsley.
Remove tough kale stems; tear leaves into bite-size pieces. Rinse and dry.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Zest and juice lemon into separate small bowls.
In a bowl, combine turkey, half the onions, half the garlic, parsley, ground cumin, paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Mix gently and form 8 equal patties (about 2 cm thick).
cook_steps: Toss cherry tomatoes with 1 tsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, black pepper, and sumac. Spread on half of the sheet pan.
Toss kale with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and 1 tbsp lemon juice. Spread on the other half of the pan. Roast 10–12 minutes until tomatoes blister and kale edges crisp.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear turkey patties 3 minutes per side until browned.
Transfer skillet to the oven (or move patties to an oven-safe tray) and bake 5–7 minutes until cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F).

While patties finish, warm 1 tsp olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add remaining onions and garlic; cook 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Add cauliflower rice and cook 3–4 minutes, stirring, until hot. Season with a pinch of salt, black pepper, and lemon zest.
Return the turkey skillet to the stovetop over low heat. Add remaining 1–2 tbsp lemon juice to the pan and swirl to pick up browned bits for a quick drizzle.
Plate cauliflower rice, top with turkey patties and pan drizzle. Add roasted tomatoes and kale on the side.

meals.name: Lemon-Dill Baked Salmon with Sautéed Asparagus and Almonds
meals.description: Oven-baked salmon with a cool dill yoghurt sauce, served alongside buttery skillet asparagus and toasted almonds. Mild, fast, and family-friendly keto plate.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
Finely chop dill. Mince garlic.
Zest and juice the lemon; keep zest and juice separate.
Trim woody ends from asparagus.
Roughly chop almonds.
cook_steps: Make sauce: In a bowl, combine yoghurt, half the dill, half the minced garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Chill.
Bake salmon: Place salmon on the tray. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil, season with salt, black pepper, and 1 teaspoon lemon zest. Bake 10–12 minutes, until just opaque and flaky.

Cook asparagus: Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add asparagus and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Sauté 4–6 minutes until crisp-tender. Stir in remaining minced garlic for the last 30 seconds.
Toast almonds: In a small dry pan over medium heat, toast almonds 2–3 minutes, stirring, until golden. Remove from heat; season with a tiny pinch of salt.
Finish and serve: Plate salmon with asparagus. Spoon dill yoghurt over salmon, sprinkle with remaining fresh dill and toasted almonds. Serve with remaining lemon juice to taste.

meals.name: Za'atar Pork Chops with Tahini Green Beans and Cauli Rice
meals.description: Seared pork loin chops finished in the oven, served with garlicky green beans and a lemon-tahini drizzle over quick-sautéed cauliflower rice. Mild, keto-friendly, and weeknight fast.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Pat pork loin chops dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, mix za'atar, salt, and black pepper.
Trim green beans and mince garlic.
Chop parsley and halve the lemon.
Open the cauliflower rice packs so they’re ready to use.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Rub the pork loin chops with 1 tbsp olive oil, then coat all over with the za'atar mixture.
Sear pork 2–3 minutes per side until browned. Transfer skillet to the oven and roast 5–7 minutes, until just cooked through (juices run clear). Rest on a plate for 5 minutes.

While pork cooks, make sauce: in a bowl whisk tahini with 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt until smooth. Add a little more lemon juice or olive oil to reach a spoonable consistency.

In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium. Add green beans and cook 4–5 minutes, tossing until crisp-tender. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Toss in parsley and 1–2 tbsp of the tahini sauce; remove from heat.
In the same or another skillet, melt butter over medium. Add cauliflower rice and sauté 3–4 minutes until hot and steamy. Season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Slice pork if desired. Plate cauliflower rice, top with pork, add green beans on the side, and drizzle remaining tahini sauce over pork. Serve with lemon wedges from the remaining half lemon.

meals.name: Garlic-Lemon Prawn Skewers with Sautéed Zucchini and Aioli
meals.description: Quick, mild prawn skewers seared with garlic and lemon, served over tender sautéed zucchini with a side of aioli. Keto-friendly and family-simple.
prep_steps: Pat dry the prawn skewers with paper towels.
Mince the garlic.
Roughly chop the parsley.
Zest and halve the lemon.
Trim ends of zucchini and slice into thin ribbons or half-moons.
In a bowl, toss prawn skewers with half the olive oil, minced garlic, lemon zest, half the parsley, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
cook_steps: Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Add a drizzle of olive oil, then place the prawn skewers in a single layer.
Cook 2–3 minutes per side until prawns are pink and opaque; transfer to a plate and squeeze half the lemon over the top.
Return the pan to medium heat with the remaining olive oil.
Add zucchini, a pinch of salt and pepper, and sauté 2–3 minutes until just tender.
Finish zucchini with the remaining lemon juice.
Plate zucchini, top with prawn skewers, and sprinkle with remaining parsley.
Serve with aioli on the side for dipping.

meals.name: Beef & Eggplant Tahini Skillet over Cauli Rice
meals.description: A quick Greek-Middle Eastern style beef and eggplant skillet finished with lemon-tahini, served over cauliflower rice for a keto family dinner.
prep_steps: Dice the onions.
Cut the eggplant into small cubes (about 1.5 cm).
Mince the garlic.
Chop the parsley.
Juice the lemon into a small bowl.
Stir tahini with half the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon olive oil to make a pourable drizzle; set aside.
Open the diced tomatoes.
Have the cauliflower rice ready; pierce package if microwaving.
cook_steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onions and eggplant; cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 5–7 minutes.
Push vegetables to the sides; add beef mince to the center. Cook, breaking up, until browned, 4–5 minutes.
Stir in garlic, cumin, oregano, tomato paste, salt, and black pepper; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in diced tomatoes and remaining lemon juice; stir and simmer until thickened, 3–5 minutes. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Meanwhile, heat cauliflower rice: microwave per pack directions until hot, or sauté in a separate pan with 1 teaspoon olive oil for 3–4 minutes.
Portion cauliflower rice into 4 bowls. Top with beef-eggplant mixture.
Drizzle with the lemon-tahini and sprinkle with parsley.

meals.name: Creamy Lemon Garlic Chicken Thighs with Spinach & Artichokes
meals.description: Quick-seared chicken thighs finished in a mild, creamy lemon-garlic sauce with wilted spinach and artichokes, plus a fast sautéed zucchini side. Family-friendly, keto, and weeknight simple.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Pat dry chicken thigh fillets with paper towels.
Mince garlic.
Drain and roughly chop artichokes.
Zest and halve the lemon.
Trim zucchini and slice into thin ribbons or half-moons.
Measure out cream and parmesan cheese.
Season chicken on both sides with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken thigh fillets 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 6–8 minutes until chicken is cooked through; set chicken on a plate and keep warm.
Return the skillet to the stove over medium heat; add 1 tbsp olive oil and the garlic. Cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in cream, add lemon zest, and stir in parmesan cheese. Simmer 2–3 minutes to thicken slightly.
Stir in spinach and artichokes; simmer 1–2 minutes until spinach is wilted. Squeeze in half the lemon (to taste) and season with salt and black pepper.
Return chicken and any juices to the skillet, turning to coat in the sauce. Simmer 1 minute to heat through, then remove from heat.
In a separate skillet, sauté zucchini in a little olive oil over medium-high heat for 2–3 minutes until just tender; season with salt and black pepper.
Serve chicken with the creamy spinach-artichoke sauce and the sautéed zucchini on the side.

archetypes.name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
archetypes.description: Balanced, family-friendly American and French bistro-style dinners with mindful salt control—roasts, braises, and hearty veg sides—cooked from scratch in 30–60 minutes with mild flavors.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a unique low-sodium focus and introduces French cuisine for family diners without overlapping existing heat, equipment, or nutrition profiles.

meals.name: Herb-Roasted Chicken Thighs with Dijon Pan Sauce, Green Beans & Carrots, and 7-Grain Medley
meals.description: Comforting roasted chicken with a bright mustard pan sauce, tender green beans and carrots, and a hearty 7-grain side. Built for low-sodium, family-friendly flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse 1 1/2 cups 7-grain medley under cold water; drain.
Peel and slice 1 onion.
Peel and cut 3 carrots into 1/4-inch coins.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Zest then halve 1 lemon.
Pat dry 6–8 chicken thighs with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
Mix 1 tsp thyme and 1 tsp rosemary together.
cook_steps: Combine 7-grain medley, 3 cups water, and 1 bay leaf in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 35–40 minutes until tender. Remove bay leaf and keep covered off heat.

Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Add chicken thighs skin-side down; sear 4–5 minutes until golden. Flip, sprinkle mixed thyme and rosemary over the chicken, and transfer skillet to the oven. Roast 20–25 minutes until juices run clear.

While chicken roasts, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a second skillet over medium. Add onion and carrots; cook 5 minutes, stirring. Add 2 tbsp water, cover, and steam 4 minutes. Add green beans and another 2 tbsp water; cover and cook 4–6 minutes until crisp-tender. Season with black pepper and half the lemon zest; keep warm.
Transfer cooked chicken to a plate to rest. Return the oven-safe skillet to medium heat (pour off excess fat, leaving about 1 tbsp). Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 2 tbsp mustard and 1/2 cup white wine; scrape up browned bits. Simmer 2–3 minutes to reduce by half.

Add 1 cup vegetable stock and the juice of half a lemon. Simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened and glossy. Stir in remaining lemon zest and 2 tbsp chopped parsley (optional). Season with black pepper to taste.
Fluff the 7-grain medley with a fork. Plate grains, add green beans and carrots, top with chicken, and spoon pan sauce over.

meals.name: Pork Chops with Apple-Sage Pan Sauce, Roasted Green Beans & Carrots, and Creamy Mash
meals.description: Seared pork chops finished with a mild apple-onion-sage pan sauce, paired with oven-roasted green beans and baby carrots, plus creamy mashed potatoes. Built for low-sodium flavor using herbs, aromatics, and vinegar.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Scrub and peel 2 lb potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks and place in a pot of cold water.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Rinse 12 oz baby carrots and pat dry.
Core and thinly slice 2 apples.
Peel and thinly slice 1 large onion.
Finely chop 1 tablespoon sage leaves (or keep whole if preferred).
Pat dry 4 pork chops with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
Measure vegetable stock and apple cider vinegar; set out butter, milk, and olive oil.
cook_steps: Start potatoes: Bring the pot to a boil over high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, 12–15 minutes.

Roast vegetables: On a sheet pan, toss green beans and baby carrots with 1 tablespoon olive oil, a big pinch of black pepper, and a pinch of garlic flakes if using. Roast until tender and lightly browned, 15–20 minutes, tossing once halfway.
Sear pork: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear pork chops 2–3 minutes per side until well browned.
Finish pork (optional oven finish): If chops are thick, transfer skillet to the oven for 5–7 minutes until cooked through (internal temp about 145°F). Transfer chops to a plate; tent with foil.
Make pan sauce: Return skillet to medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon butter; sauté sliced onion 3–4 minutes until softened. Add apple slices; cook 2–3 minutes until just tender.

Deglaze: Add 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar; simmer 30 seconds, scraping up browned bits. Add 3/4 cup vegetable stock and chopped sage; simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened and glossy. Season with black pepper to taste. Return pork chops to the pan to warm 1 minute; remove from heat.
Mash potatoes: Drain cooked potatoes well. Return to pot; add 2 tablespoons butter and 1/2 cup milk. Mash until smooth and creamy. Add black pepper to taste.
Serve: Plate mashed potatoes, roasted green beans and carrots, and pork chops. Spoon apple-sage sauce over the chops.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Scrub and peel 2 lb potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks and place in a pot of cold water.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Rinse 12 oz baby carrots and pat dry.
Core and thinly slice 2 apples.
Peel and thinly slice 1 large onion.
Finely chop 1 tablespoon sage leaves (or keep whole if preferred).
Pat dry 4 pork chops with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
Measure vegetable stock and apple cider vinegar; set out butter, milk, and olive oil.
Start potatoes: Bring the pot to a boil over high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, 12–15 minutes.

Roast vegetables: On a sheet pan, toss green beans and baby carrots with 1 tablespoon olive oil, a big pinch of black pepper, and a pinch of garlic flakes if using. Roast until tender and lightly browned, 15–20 minutes, tossing once halfway.
Sear pork: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear pork chops 2–3 minutes per side until well browned.
Finish pork (optional oven finish): If chops are thick, transfer skillet to the oven for 5–7 minutes until cooked through (internal temp about 145°F). Transfer chops to a plate; tent with foil.
Make pan sauce: Return skillet to medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon butter; sauté sliced onion 3–4 minutes until softened. Add apple slices; cook 2–3 minutes until just tender.

Deglaze: Add 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar; simmer 30 seconds, scraping up browned bits. Add 3/4 cup vegetable stock and chopped sage; simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened and glossy. Season with black pepper to taste. Return pork chops to the pan to warm 1 minute; remove from heat.
Mash potatoes: Drain cooked potatoes well. Return to pot; add 2 tablespoons butter and 1/2 cup milk. Mash until smooth and creamy. Add black pepper to taste.
Serve: Plate mashed potatoes, roasted green beans and carrots, and pork chops. Spoon apple-sage sauce over the chops.

meals.name: Bourguignon-Style Beef with Buttered Parsley Potatoes and Roasted Green Beans
meals.description: A family-friendly, low-sodium beef and mushroom skillet in a wine-tomato reduction, served with buttered parsley potatoes and lemon-kissed roasted green beans.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse and quarter 2 lb potatoes; keep pieces similar in size.
Trim 12 oz green beans; pat dry.
Slice 10 oz mushrooms.
Dice 1 large onion.
Peel and slice 2 carrots into 1/4-inch rounds.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley.
Zest 1 lemon; reserve.
Pat dry 1.5 lb beef stew meat; season with black pepper.
cook_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add potatoes and cook until just tender, 12–15 minutes. Drain and keep warm.
On a sheet pan, toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of black pepper. Roast at 425°F until tender with light char, 12–15 minutes. Finish with lemon zest.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a wide pot over medium-high. Brown beef in 2 batches, 3–4 minutes per batch. Transfer to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add onion and carrots; cook 4 minutes, stirring.
Add mushrooms; cook until they release moisture and lightly brown, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in garlic and 2 tbsp tomato paste; cook 1 minute.
Deglaze with 1/2 cup white wine, scraping up browned bits; simmer 1–2 minutes.

Add 1.5 cups water, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, and several grinds of black pepper. Return beef and any juices. Bring to a simmer, then cook gently uncovered, stirring occasionally, 20–25 minutes until beef is tender and sauce is reduced.
Off heat, swirl in 1 tbsp butter for gloss. Remove bay leaves and adjust black pepper to taste.
Toss drained potatoes with 1 tbsp butter and parsley. Plate beef with sauce, potatoes, and roasted green beans.

meals.name: Lemon-Herb Tilapia en Papillote with Zucchini-Tomato Medley and Herbed Quinoa
meals.description: Tender tilapia baked in parchment with lemon, thyme, and vegetables, served over fluffy parsley quinoa. Mild, family-friendly, and low in sodium.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rinse quinoa under cold water for 30 seconds; drain well.
Slice 2 shallots thinly.
Slice 2 medium zucchini into half-moons.
Slice 3 medium tomatoes into wedges.
Zest 1 lemon, then cut it into thin rounds; cut the second lemon into wedges for serving.
Chop parsley to make 1/4 cup.
Pat tilapia fillets dry with paper towels.
Cut 4 large rectangles of parchment paper (about 12x16 inches).
cook_steps: Combine quinoa, water, and bay leaves in a medium pot; bring to a boil on StoveTop.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender and water is absorbed, 15–18 minutes. Remove from heat and keep covered.
Lay parchment sheets on a baking tray. Lightly brush centers with olive oil.
Season tilapia on both sides with black pepper and thyme.

Place 1/4 of the shallots, zucchini, and tomatoes on each parchment center. Top with a tilapia fillet, a few lemon slices, and dot each with a small piece of butter. Drizzle a little olive oil over the top.
Fold parchment over and crimp edges tightly to seal packets.
Bake packets in the Oven until fish flakes easily, 12–15 minutes. Rest 2 minutes before opening (watch steam).
Discard bay leaves from quinoa. Stir in lemon zest, chopped parsley, and a drizzle of olive oil; fluff with a fork.
Open packets, transfer fish and vegetables over the quinoa. Serve with lemon wedges.

meals.name: Turkey–Quinoa Mini Meatloaves with Mushroom-Thyme Gravy, Garlic Mash, and Green Beans
meals.description: Family-friendly mini meatloaves baked and topped with a silky mushroom-thyme gravy, served with creamy garlic mashed potatoes and tender green beans. Built for low-sodium cooking with plenty of fresh aromatics.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rinse 1 cup quinoa under cold water in a fine strainer.
Peel and cut 2 lb potatoes into 1-inch chunks.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Finely chop 1 medium onion (divide: half for meatloaf, half for gravy).
Mince 3 cloves garlic (divide: 2 for mash, 1 for meatloaf).
Slice 8 oz mushrooms.
Chop 2 tablespoons parsley.
Measure 1.5 cups mushroom stock and 1/2 cup white wine.
cook_steps: Cook quinoa: In a small pot, combine rinsed quinoa with 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 15 minutes. Fluff and let cool slightly.
Start potatoes: Place potatoes and 2 garlic cloves in a large pot, cover with cold water, and bring to a boil. Reduce to a gentle boil and cook until tender, 12–15 minutes.

Make meatloaf mix: In a bowl, combine 1.25 lb turkey, 1 cup cooked quinoa (reserve any extra), 1/2 of the chopped onion, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 egg, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp chopped parsley, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Form and bake: Shape mixture into 8 equal mini loaves on a parchment-lined sheet. Bake until cooked through (165°F/74°C), 18–22 minutes.

Gravy base: In a skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tbsp butter with 1 tsp olive oil. Add remaining onion and sliced mushrooms; cook, stirring, until mushrooms are browned and moisture evaporates, 6–8 minutes.

Make gravy: Sprinkle 1 tbsp flour over mushrooms; cook 1 minute, stirring. Deglaze with white wine and simmer 1–2 minutes. Whisk in mushroom stock, add 1/2 tsp thyme and a pinch of black pepper, and simmer until glossy and slightly thick, 3–5 minutes. Reduce heat to low.

Green beans: While gravy simmers, place green beans in a sauté pan with 1/4 cup water and 1 tsp olive oil. Cover and steam-sauté over medium heat until crisp-tender, 4–6 minutes. Finish with black pepper.

Mash potatoes: Drain potatoes and garlic well. Return to pot over low heat for 30 seconds to evaporate excess moisture. Add 3 tbsp butter and 1/3–1/2 cup warm milk; mash until smooth. Season with black pepper.
Finish: Spoon mushroom-thyme gravy over baked mini meatloaves. Serve with garlic mash and green beans. Sprinkle remaining parsley over the top.

meals.name: Chicken & Leek Fricassée with Herbed Barley and Buttered Peas
meals.description: Tender chicken thighs simmered with leeks, mushrooms, white wine, and creme fraiche for a light, creamy French-style sauce, served over herb-scented barley with simple buttered peas. Seasoned without added salt for a family-friendly, low-sodium dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rinse 1 cup barley under cold water; drain.
Peel and slice 2 leeks into 1/2-inch half-moons; rinse well to remove grit.
Slice 8 oz mushrooms.
Chop 2 tbsp parsley and strip 1 tsp thyme leaves.
Zest half a lemon; cut lemon into wedges.
Pat dry 4–6 chicken thighs (about 2 lb) with paper towels.
Set out 2 cups low-sodium vegetable stock (or dilute with water), 1/2 cup white wine, 1/3 cup creme fraiche, and 1 tbsp flour.
cook_steps: Start barley: In a medium pot, add rinsed barley, 2 1/2 cups water, 1 bay leaf, and a pinch of black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook 25–30 minutes until tender. Drain excess liquid if needed; discard bay.
Sear chicken: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Add chicken thighs skin-side down; cook 4–5 minutes until golden. Flip and cook 2 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate.
Build fricassée base: Reduce heat to medium. Add 1 tbsp butter to the skillet. Stir in leeks and mushrooms; cook 5–6 minutes until softened. Sprinkle in 1 tbsp flour; stir 30 seconds.
Deglaze: Pour in 1/2 cup white wine; scrape up browned bits and simmer 1 minute. Stir in 1 cup vegetable stock, thyme leaves, and a few grinds black pepper; bring to a simmer.
Bake: Nestle chicken (and juices) into the sauce, skin-side up. Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 15–20 minutes, until chicken is cooked through (165°F/74°C).
Finish sauce: Return skillet to stovetop on low. Stir in 1/3 cup creme fraiche and 1 tsp lemon zest; simmer 1–2 minutes to thicken. Adjust pepper and lemon to taste.
Buttered peas: In a small pot, add 2 cups peas and 1/4 cup water. Cover and steam on medium 3–4 minutes until just tender; drain if needed. Toss with 1 tbsp butter and a pinch of black pepper.
Finish barley: Fluff barley with a fork; stir in chopped parsley and 1 tsp olive oil.
Serve: Spoon herbed barley onto plates, top with chicken and spoon over leek–mushroom sauce. Serve peas on the side with lemon wedges.

meals.name: Herb-Seared Tuna with Oven Ratatouille and Creamy Polenta
meals.description: Seared tuna steaks with a lemon-herb finish, served alongside a low-sodium oven-roasted zucchini–tomato ratatouille and creamy buttered polenta. Family-friendly, mild, and from-scratch in under an hour.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch half-moons.
Slice bell peppers into strips and onion into wedges.
Cut tomatoes into large chunks.
Mince garlic.
Finely chop parsley and zest the lemon; cut lemon into wedges.
Pat tuna steak dry and season both sides with black pepper.
Measure polenta and water.
cook_steps: Roast vegetables: On a large sheet pan, toss zucchini, bell peppers, onion, tomatoes, and half the garlic with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp thyme, and black pepper. Spread in a single layer and roast 20–25 minutes until tender and lightly browned, stirring once halfway.

Cook polenta: In a medium pot, bring 6 cups water to a boil. Whisk in polenta in a steady stream to avoid lumps. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20–25 minutes, stirring often, until thick and creamy. Stir in butter and a pinch of black pepper; keep warm covered.
Sear tuna: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear tuna steak 2–3 minutes per side for medium-rare (cook longer if preferred). Remove from heat.
Finish tuna: Sprinkle lemon zest and remaining garlic over the hot tuna in the pan; squeeze over some lemon juice.
Plate: Spoon polenta onto plates. Add roasted vegetables. Slice tuna if desired and place on top. Garnish with parsley and serve with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Pan-Seared Sirloin with Shallot–White Wine Sauce, Parsley Mash, and Lemon Broccoli
meals.description: Family-friendly steak night with a light French-style pan sauce, creamy herb mash, and bright broccoli. Seasoned without added salt for a low-sodium, mild, from-scratch dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°F (95°C) to keep steak warm.
Scrub and peel potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks.
Finely chop parsley (leaves and tender stems).
Mince shallots and garlic.
Zest the lemon, then cut it in half.
Cut broccoli into florets; peel and slice stems.
Pat sirloin steak dry with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
cook_steps: Start potatoes: Place potatoes in a pot, cover with cold water by 1 inch, bring to a boil, then simmer until tender, 12–15 minutes.
Sear steak: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear sirloin steak 3–4 minutes per side (to desired doneness). Transfer to a sheet pan and keep warm in the oven to rest.

Make pan sauce: Lower skillet to medium, add 1 tsp olive oil if dry. Add shallots and cook 1–2 minutes, then add garlic for 30 seconds. Deglaze with white wine, scraping browned bits. Add mushroom stock and simmer 3–5 minutes to reduce by about half. Turn off heat; whisk in 1 tbsp butter and a squeeze of lemon juice.

Cook broccoli: In a separate large skillet, add broccoli with 1/4 cup water. Cover and steam 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender. Uncover, add 1 tsp olive oil, lemon zest, and a few grinds of black pepper; toss 1 minute.

Finish mash: Drain potatoes, return to pot over low heat 30 seconds to dry. Add milk and 1 tbsp butter; mash to desired texture. Stir in chopped parsley and black pepper. If needed, loosen with a splash of hot water.
Slice steak against the grain. Plate parsley mash and broccoli, top steak with shallot–white wine sauce, and serve.

meals.name: Seared Duck with Orange Pan Sauce, Rosemary Potatoes, and Braised Red Cabbage
meals.description: Crisp-skinned duck finished with a bright orange pan sauce, served alongside rosemary-roasted potatoes and gently braised red cabbage with apple. Built for low-sodium family dining with mild, comforting flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Scrub potatoes and cut into 1-inch chunks.
Thinly slice red cabbage; thinly slice onion; core and thinly slice apple.
Finely chop rosemary (if whole sprigs).
Pat duck dry; lightly score skin in a crosshatch (do not cut into the meat).
Zest 1 orange; juice both oranges into a bowl (about 1/2–3/4 cup).
Stir cornflour with water to make a smooth slurry.
Set out black pepper, olive oil, butter, and white wine.
cook_steps: On a sheet pan, toss potatoes with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, half the rosemary, and a few grinds of black pepper. Roast 25–35 minutes, turning once, until golden and tender.
Start the cabbage: In a wide pot over medium heat, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook onion 3–4 minutes until softened. Add cabbage and apple; cook 5 minutes, stirring.

Add apple cider vinegar and 1/4 cup water to the cabbage. Cover and simmer on low, stirring occasionally, 12–15 minutes until tender with a slight bite. Season with black pepper to taste and keep warm.

Cook the duck: Place duck skin-side down in a cold, oven-safe skillet. Turn heat to medium. Cook 8–10 minutes to render fat and deeply crisp the skin. Spoon off excess fat as needed (reserve 1 tbsp in pan).
Flip duck and cook 1–2 minutes. Transfer skillet to the oven (same 425°F) and roast 4–7 minutes depending on thickness for medium doneness. Rest duck on a board, skin-side up, 5 minutes.
Make the orange pan sauce: Return skillet to medium heat with 1 tbsp reserved duck fat (or 1 tsp olive oil if needed). Add orange zest and white wine; simmer 1–2 minutes, scraping browned bits.
Add orange juice and honey; simmer 2–3 minutes to reduce slightly. Whisk in the cornflour slurry; simmer 30–60 seconds until glossy. Off heat, whisk in butter to finish. Grind in black pepper.
Slice duck. Plate with rosemary potatoes and braised cabbage. Spoon orange sauce over duck.

meals.name: Herb-Roasted Chicken Thighs with Lemon Potatoes, Carrots, and Pan Sauce
meals.description: Roasted chicken thighs with thyme and rosemary, paired with lemony potatoes, sweet carrots, and a quick white wine–herb pan sauce. Built for low-sodium cooking with bright citrus and fresh herbs instead of added salt.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Line a large sheet pan with parchment (optional for easy cleanup).
Trim excess fat from 8 chicken thighs and pat dry.
Scrub 2 lb potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks.
Peel 4 carrots; cut into 1/2-inch thick sticks or coins.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Zest 1 lemon, then cut it in half (reserve zest and juice separately).
Strip leaves from several sprigs of thyme and rosemary; roughly chop 2 Tbsp mixed herbs.
Measure 1/2 cup white wine and 1/2 cup vegetable stock.
cook_steps: In a large bowl, toss potatoes and carrots with 1.5 Tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, half the chopped herbs, black pepper, and half the lemon zest.

On the sheet pan, spread the potatoes and carrots in a single layer. Nestle chicken thighs on top. Brush chicken with 1 Tbsp olive oil and sprinkle with remaining chopped herbs, black pepper, and remaining lemon zest. Squeeze half the lemon over everything.
Roast for 25 minutes.

Toss green beans with 1 tsp olive oil and black pepper. After the first 25 minutes, add green beans to the pan around the chicken. Roast 10–15 minutes more, until chicken is cooked through (165°F/74°C) and vegetables are tender with browned edges.
Transfer chicken and vegetables to a platter, tent loosely with foil. Pour any pan juices into a small skillet.

Place skillet over medium heat. Add remaining minced garlic; cook 30 seconds. Add white wine; simmer 2–3 minutes, scraping brown bits. Add vegetable stock and a squeeze of lemon juice; simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly syrupy. Whisk in 1 tsp olive oil for sheen. Season with black pepper and extra lemon to taste.
Spoon pan sauce over chicken. Serve with roasted potatoes, carrots, and green beans.

archetypes.name: Family Low-Carb Weeknight Bowls & Wraps (15–30, Mild)
archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly low-carb dinners built as bowls, lettuce wraps, and protein-plus-veg plates with mild seasoning for easy weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a mainstream, low-carb family option with mild heat and 15–30 min simplicity—distinct from existing no-nutrition-focus and other health focuses—covering a common dietary goal not yet represented.

meals.name: Mild Chicken Shawarma Cauliflower Rice Bowls
meals.description: Family-friendly chicken shawarma bowls over sautéed cauliflower rice with crisp cucumbers, tomatoes, and crunchy romaine. Mild spices keep it kid-friendly and low-carb.
prep_steps: Trim and slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Mince garlic.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Dice cucumber.
Roughly chop parsley.
Shred or slice romaine lettuce.
Cut lemon in half for juice.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, ground cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Add chicken and toss to coat.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken in a single layer.
Cook chicken 5–7 minutes, stirring once or twice, until cooked through and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet over medium heat, add a small drizzle of olive oil if needed and the cauliflower rice.
Sauté cauliflower rice 3–4 minutes until hot and slightly tender; season to taste with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Assemble bowls: add a bed of cauliflower rice, top with chicken, romaine, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, parsley, and a few pickles.
Serve immediately. Optional: squeeze extra lemon over bowls to taste.

meals.name: Mild Beef Taco Lettuce Wraps with Cauliflower Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly ground beef taco filling tucked in crisp lettuce leaves with fresh toppings and a quick cauliflower rice side. Mild seasoning keeps it kid-approved and low-carb.
prep_steps: Rinse and dry lettuce; separate 12 large leaves.
Dice onions.
Mince garlic.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Chop coriander.
Slice avocado.
Cut lime into wedges.
Have cauliflower rice ready to heat per pack directions.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground beef; cook 5–7 minutes, breaking it up until browned.
Stir in ground cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper; cook 1–2 minutes to season.
Microwave cauliflower rice per pack directions until hot.
Fill lettuce leaves with seasoned beef.
Top with salsa, cherry tomatoes, avocado, and coriander.
Serve with warm cauliflower rice on the side and lime wedges for squeezing.

meals.name: Za'atar Turkey Lettuce Wraps with Cucumber Yogurt
meals.description: Quick, mild turkey filling seasoned with za'atar, spooned into crisp romaine leaves and topped with a simple cucumber-yogurt sauce. Low-carb and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Wash and dry romaine lettuce; separate 12–16 large leaves for wraps.
Finely dice onions (about 1 cup).
Mince garlic (2 cloves).
Dice cucumber (1 cup) and halve cherry tomatoes (1 cup).
Chop parsley (2 tablespoons).
In a small bowl, stir yogurt with half the parsley, half the garlic, a pinch of salt, and a squeeze of lemon; set aside.
Cut the remaining lemon into wedges for serving.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add turkey; cook 5–7 minutes, breaking it up, until no longer pink.
Season turkey with za'atar, black pepper, and a small pinch of salt; squeeze in lemon juice and cook 1 minute to combine.
Assemble wraps: Fill romaine leaves with turkey, top with cucumber and cherry tomatoes, spoon on yogurt sauce, and finish with remaining parsley.
Serve with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Lemon-Tahini Salmon Bowls with Cauliflower Rice
meals.description: Mild, low-carb salmon and broccoli bowls over cauliflower rice with a quick lemon-tahini drizzle. Simple, weeknight-friendly and family-ready.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Cut broccoli into bite-size pieces.
Mince garlic.
Zest and juice the lemon (about 2–3 tbsp juice).
Chop parsley (optional).
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
cook_steps: On a sheet pan, toss broccoli with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt and pepper; spread in a single layer.
Place salmon on the same pan; rub with 1 tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, a big pinch of salt and pepper, and half the lemon zest.
Roast 12–15 minutes until salmon flakes and broccoli is tender with crisp edges.
While roasting, warm cauliflower rice in a large skillet over medium with 1 tbsp olive oil and remaining garlic for 3–4 minutes; season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk tahini with lemon juice, remaining lemon zest, a pinch of salt, and just enough water to make a pourable sauce.
Build bowls: divide cauliflower rice, top with salmon (flaked or in portions) and roasted broccoli, drizzle lemon-tahini sauce, and finish with parsley.

meals.name: Mild Turkey Fajita Cauliflower Rice Bowls
meals.description: Skillet-cooked turkey with peppers and onions over warm cauliflower rice, topped with avocado and mild salsa for a low-carb, family-friendly bowl.
prep_steps: Slice onions into thin strips.
Slice peppers into thin strips.
Halve lime.
Cut avocado into cubes.
Open cauliflower rice package.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add turkey, season with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, and paprika; cook 4–5 minutes, breaking up until no longer pink.
Add sliced onions and peppers to the skillet; cook 4–5 minutes until tender-crisp.
While the turkey and veg finish, warm cauliflower rice per pack directions in the microwave (or sauté in a second pan with a little olive oil for 3–4 minutes).
Build bowls: divide cauliflower rice, top with turkey-pepper mixture, avocado, and salsa.
Squeeze lime over bowls and serve.

meals.name: Mild Steak Fajita Zucchini Boats
meals.description: Low-carb zucchini boats filled with seasoned sirloin, peppers, and onions, topped with melted cheddar. Mild flavors and weeknight-simple.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a sheet pan.
Halve the zucchini lengthwise and scoop out some center to make shallow boats.
Thinly slice the sirloin steak across the grain.
Slice the onions and peppers into thin strips.
In a small bowl, mix ground cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Juice half the lime; cut the rest into wedges for serving.
cook_steps: Brush zucchini boats with 1 tbsp olive oil and place cut-side down on the sheet pan; bake 10 minutes to soften.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Toss steak with half the spice mix, then sear 2–3 minutes until just cooked. Transfer to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Sauté onions and peppers with the remaining spice mix 4–5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return steak and any juices to the skillet, add lime juice, and toss 30 seconds to combine. Turn off heat.
Flip zucchini boats cut-side up. Fill evenly with the steak-pepper mixture and top with cheddar cheese.
Return sheet pan to the oven for 3–5 minutes until cheese melts.
Serve hot with lime wedges.

meals.name: Mild Lamb Kofta Cauliflower Rice Bowls with Lemon-Tahini Yogurt
meals.description: Pan-seared lamb koftas over cauliflower rice with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and a lemon-tahini yogurt drizzle. Family-friendly, low-carb, and mild.
prep_steps: Finely chop parsley (about 2 tablespoons).
Finely dice onions (1/2 cup).
Mince garlic (2 cloves).
Halve cherry tomatoes (2 cups).
Dice cucumber (1 large).
Cut lemon in half; zest 1/2 teaspoon and juice 2 tablespoons.
In a small bowl, whisk yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, lemon zest, a pinch of salt, and 1 teaspoon olive oil; set aside.
Have cauliflower rice ready to heat per package directions.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine lamb mince, diced onions, minced garlic, chopped parsley, ground cumin, paprika, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper.
Shape the mixture into 8 small koftas (oval patties).
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear koftas 3–4 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (internal temp 71°C/160°F). Transfer to a plate.
Microwave cauliflower rice according to package directions; fluff with a fork and season with a pinch of salt and 1 teaspoon olive oil.
Assemble bowls: divide cauliflower rice among 4 bowls, top with koftas, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes.
Drizzle with the lemon-tahini yogurt. Serve with extra lemon wedges if desired.

meals.name: Philly-Style Cheesesteak Cauliflower Rice Bowls
meals.description: Family-friendly, low-carb bowls with sautéed sirloin, peppers, onions, and mushrooms over cauliflower rice, finished with melted provolone. Mild seasoning keeps it kid-friendly and quick.
prep_steps: Thinly slice the sirloin steak against the grain.
Slice the onions and peppers; clean and slice the mushrooms.
Mince the garlic.
Preheat oven broiler to high (for melting cheese).
Open the cauliflower rice and have it ready near the stove.
cook_steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add half the olive oil.
Sauté onions and peppers with a pinch of salt until softened, 4–5 minutes; add mushrooms and cook 2–3 minutes more. Transfer veggies to a bowl.
Add remaining olive oil to the skillet. Season steak with salt, black pepper, and paprika, then sear in the hot pan, 2–3 minutes, just until browned.
Return veggies to the skillet with the steak, add garlic, and toss for 30–60 seconds until fragrant. Turn off heat.
In a second skillet, warm cauliflower rice over medium heat with a pinch of salt and black pepper, 3–4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Divide cauliflower rice into 4 oven-safe bowls. Top each with the steak-and-veg mixture.
Lay provolone cheese over each bowl and broil 1–2 minutes until melted (watch closely).
Serve hot.

meals.name: Chicken Caesar Lettuce Wraps with Bacon
meals.description: Fast, low-carb Caesar-style lettuce wraps with shredded roast chicken, crisp bacon, tomatoes, and parmesan. Mild, family-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse and dry romaine lettuce; separate large leaves for wraps.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Shred roast chicken into bite-size pieces.
Cut bacon into bite-size pieces.
Shave or grate parmesan cheese.
cook_steps: Heat a skillet over medium heat (StoveTop). Cook bacon until crisp, 6–8 minutes; transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
Warm the shredded roast chicken: either add to the skillet for 2–3 minutes or microwave in a bowl for 45–60 seconds (Microwave).
In a bowl, toss warm chicken with caesar dressing and a few grinds of black pepper.
Assemble wraps: lay out romaine leaves, add dressed chicken, top with bacon, cherry tomatoes, and parmesan cheese.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon over the wraps and serve immediately.

meals.name: Mild Fish Taco Cauliflower Rice Bowls
meals.description: Oven-roasted seasoned fish over lime-kissed cauliflower rice with crisp cabbage, avocado, and salsa for a low-carb family bowl. Mild flavors, ready in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
In a small bowl, mix ground cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
Thinly slice cabbage.
Halve, pit, and slice avocado.
Cut lime into wedges.
Roughly chop coriander.
Open cauliflower rice package and have it ready to heat.
cook_steps: Place fish fillets on the lined tray; drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle the spice mix evenly on both sides.
Roast fish for 8–10 minutes until it flakes easily with a fork (thicker fillets may need 1–2 minutes more).

While fish roasts, heat a large skillet over medium with a little olive oil; add cauliflower rice and a pinch of salt and black pepper, stir 3–4 minutes until hot. Squeeze in a wedge of lime and stir.
Divide cauliflower rice into 4 bowls.
Flake roasted fish into large pieces and place on top of the rice.
Top each bowl with sliced cabbage, avocado, and spoonfuls of salsa.
Finish with chopped coriander and extra lime wedges on the side.
