archetypes.name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Stovetop family dinners inspired by Indian, Thai, and Chinese flavors—balanced medium heat curries and stir-fries built in 15–30 minutes with a few coordinated components.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a distinct family option with Medium heat and Intermediate complexity focused on Asian stovetop dishes, filling gaps left by existing Simple/NoHeat/Mild archetypes.

meals.name: Green Coconut Chicken Skillet with Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly Thai-Indian green coconut chicken with crisp veggies over fluffy jasmine rice. Medium heat, done on the stovetop in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.
Slice 1 large onion thinly.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 2 bell peppers into strips.
Trim 2 cups green beans; cut into 2–3 cm pieces.
Cut 700 g chicken thighs into bite-size pieces.
Halve 1 lime.
Measure out 3 tablespoons Thai green curry paste, 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk, 1/2 cup chicken stock, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder.
cook_steps: Cook rice: In a pot, add rinsed jasmine rice and 2 cups water with a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and a pinch of salt; sauté 2–3 minutes until starting to soften.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs; season with salt and black pepper. Sear 3–4 minutes, stirring, until no longer pink on the outside.
Stir in Thai green curry paste and turmeric powder; cook 1 minute to coat the chicken.
Pour in coconut milk and chicken stock; stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bell peppers and green beans; simmer 5–7 minutes until veggies are crisp-tender and chicken is cooked through.
Stir in chili flakes; squeeze half the lime into the skillet. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice. Serve curry over rice. Cut remaining lime half into wedges and serve alongside.
Optional: If reheating leftover rice, use a Microwave with a splash of water, covered, 1–2 minutes until hot.
instructions: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.

Cut 700 g chicken thighs into bite-size pieces.
Halve 1 lime.
Measure out 3 tablespoons Thai green curry paste, 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk, 1/2 cup chicken stock, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder.
Cook rice: In a pot, add rinsed jasmine rice and 2 cups water with a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and a pinch of salt; sauté 2–3 minutes until starting to soften.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs; season with salt and black pepper. Sear 3–4 minutes, stirring, until no longer pink on the outside.
Stir in Thai green curry paste and turmeric powder; cook 1 minute to coat the chicken.
Pour in coconut milk and chicken stock; stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bell peppers and green beans; simmer 5–7 minutes until veggies are crisp-tender and chicken is cooked through.
Stir in chili flakes; squeeze half the lime into the skillet. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice. Serve curry over rice. Cut remaining lime half into wedges and serve alongside.
Optional: If reheating leftover rice, use a Microwave with a splash of water, covered, 1–2 minutes until hot.

meals.name: Chili-Garlic Chicken Stir-Fry with Basmati Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly medium-heat chicken and vegetables in a glossy chili-garlic sauce, served over fluffy basmati rice. Built fast on the stovetop with pantry sauces—no soy or nuts.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Slice chicken thighs into thin strips.
Slice onions; slice bell peppers; slice mushrooms; mince garlic; slice spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk sriracha, rice vinegar, tomato paste, coconut sugar, and chicken stock.
In a separate bowl, toss chicken thighs with cornflour, salt, and black pepper.
Set a large skillet or wok on the stove; gather sunflower oil and a spatula.
cook_steps: Cook basmati rice in a pot with water per pack guidance until tender; keep warm.
Heat sunflower oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat until shimmering.
Add coated chicken thighs in an even layer; sear 3–4 minutes, stirring once, until starting to brown.
Add onions and mushrooms; stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add bell peppers; stir-fry 2 minutes more.
Add garlic; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir the sauce, then pour it into the skillet; toss to coat and bring to a simmer.
Simmer 2–3 minutes, stirring, until the sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
Taste and adjust heat with a little more sriracha if desired; season with a pinch of salt if needed.
Fluff the rice. Serve stir-fry over basmati rice and garnish with spring onion.

meals.name: Massaman Beef & Potato Skillet with Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Tender beef and potatoes simmered in fragrant Thai massaman curry with a touch of fish sauce sweetness. Served over fluffy jasmine rice for a family-friendly, medium-heat skillet dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Peel and cut potatoes into 2 cm cubes.
Slice onions into thin half-moons.
Trim and thinly slice spring onion.
Slice beef thinly against the grain.
Cut lime into wedges.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice to a pot with water per pack ratio, bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low until tender. Keep warm.
Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear beef in two batches for 1–2 minutes per side until just browned; remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add onions and sauté 2 minutes until starting to soften.
Stir in massaman curry paste and cook 30–45 seconds until fragrant.
Add coconut milk, potatoes, and brown sugar. Stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Cover and simmer 10–12 minutes, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are fork-tender.
Return beef and any juices to the skillet. Add fish sauce and a pinch of salt. Simmer 2–3 minutes to warm through and thicken to a saucy consistency.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or salt if needed.
Serve curry over jasmine rice. Top with spring onion and serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.

meals.name: Tamarind Soy Tofu Noodles (Pad Thai-Style)
meals.description: Family-friendly Thai-style stir-fried rice noodles with tofu, vegetables, and a tangy tamarind-soy sauce. Medium heat and quick stovetop timing for a balanced weeknight skillet.
prep_steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the rice noodles.
Drain and pat dry tofu; cut into 2 cm cubes.
Slice shallots thinly; mince garlic.
Slice bell pepper into thin strips; peel and julienne carrots; trim snow peas.
Slice spring onion; cut lime into wedges.
In a small bowl, mix tamarind chutney, soy sauce, brown sugar, and sriracha.
cook_steps: Add rice noodles to boiling water, turn off heat, and soak until just tender (5–8 minutes). Drain and set aside.
Heat peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add tofu; season lightly with salt and black pepper. Sear until golden on most sides (4–5 minutes). Push to one side.
Add shallots and garlic to the open side; stir-fry 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Add bell pepper, carrots, and snow peas; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Push everything to the sides; crack in eggs and scramble until just set (30–60 seconds).
Add drained rice noodles to the pan. Pour in the tamarind-soy sauce and toss to coat evenly (1–2 minutes). If sticking, splash in 1–2 tablespoons water.
Taste and adjust heat/salt. Remove from heat and toss in half the spring onion.
Plate and top with peanuts and remaining spring onion. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.

meals.name: Chili-Black Pepper Chicken Stir-Fry with Brown Basmati Rice
meals.description: Juicy peppery chicken and crisp vegetables in a chili-vinegar glaze, served over nutty brown basmati. Medium heat, fast skillet cooking.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear.
Dice 600–700 g chicken thighs into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Cut 1 large onion into thin slices.
Slice 1–2 bell peppers into strips.
Cut 1 small head broccoli into small florets.
Mince 3–4 cloves garlic.
Finely chop 1 fresh chili (or keep seeds for extra heat).
In a bowl, toss chicken with 2 tbsp cornflour, 1 tsp black pepper, and 1/2 tsp salt.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp chilli paste, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, and the juice of 1/2 lime.
cook_steps: Rice: Add rinsed brown basmati rice to a pot with 4 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on StoveTop 25 minutes until tender; rest 5 minutes covered.
Quick-steam broccoli: Place florets in a microwave-safe bowl with a splash of water, cover, and Microwave 2–3 minutes until bright green; drain.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Sear half the chicken 3–4 minutes until browned; remove. Repeat with another 1 tbsp canola oil and remaining chicken; remove.
Reduce heat to medium-high; add 1 tsp canola oil if dry. Stir-fry onions 1 minute, then add garlic and chopped chili; cook 30 seconds.
Add bell peppers and steamed broccoli; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.

Return chicken to the pan. Pour in the chilli paste mixture and 1–2 tsp szechuan pepper oil; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy and chicken is cooked through. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste; add more lime if desired.
Fluff rice. Serve stir-fry over rice.

meals.name: Indo-Chinese Chili Paneer Stir-Fry with Basmati Rice
meals.description: Crispy paneer and peppers in a tangy, medium-heat soy-tomato sauce, served over fluffy basmati rice. A fast Indo-Chinese skillet dinner for the family.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; set aside.
Cut paneer into 2 cm cubes; pat very dry with paper towels.
Core and slice bell peppers into strips.
Slice onions thinly.
Mince garlic.
Slice chilies (remove seeds for less heat).
Thinly slice spring onion; keep greens for garnish.
In a bowl, whisk soy sauce, rice vinegar, tomato paste, brown sugar, vegetable stock, white pepper, and a pinch of salt.
In a separate small bowl, reserve 1 tablespoon cornflour for the sauce; put remaining cornflour in another bowl for dusting paneer.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed basmati rice to a pot with water (about 1.75–2 cups water per cup rice). Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender; rest 5 minutes covered.

Crisp paneer: Toss paneer cubes in the larger bowl of cornflour to lightly coat. Heat canola oil in a large skillet/wok over medium-high. Fry paneer 4–6 minutes, turning, until golden on most sides. Remove to a plate.
Stir-fry aromatics: In the same pan, add a touch more canola oil if dry. Add onions, garlic, and chilies; stir-fry 1–2 minutes until fragrant.
Cook vegetables: Add bell peppers; stir-fry 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Make sauce: Re-whisk the sauce bowl. Sprinkle the reserved 1 tablespoon cornflour into the sauce and whisk smooth.
Combine: Return paneer to the pan. Pour in the sauce and toss. Cook 1–2 minutes until glossy and thickened, loosening with a splash of vegetable stock if needed.
Finish: Drizzle in sesame oil and toss. Stir in most of the spring onion greens.
Serve: Fluff rice. Plate rice, top with chili paneer, and garnish with remaining spring onion greens.

meals.name: Chili-Soy Eggplant & Tofu Stir-Fry with Jasmine Rice
meals.description: A weeknight Chinese–Thai style skillet of tender eggplant and crispy-edged tofu in a medium-heat chili-soy glaze, served over fluffy jasmine rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain well.
Cut 2 medium eggplant into 2 cm cubes.
Pat dry 400–500 g tofu and cut into 2 cm cubes.
Slice 1 large onions into thin wedges.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Slice 3 spring onion (separate whites and greens).
In a bowl, whisk together 6 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tbsp chili oil, 1 tsp szechuan pepper oil, and 1 tbsp cornflour until smooth.
cook_steps: Add rinsed jasmine rice to a pot with 2.5 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes; fluff.
Heat 2 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add eggplant; stir-fry 5–6 minutes until browned and starting to soften. Push to the side.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil, then tofu. Sear 3–4 minutes until golden on edges.
Add onions, spring onion whites, and garlic. Stir-fry 2 minutes until fragrant.
Whisk the sauce again, then pour into the pan. Toss to coat and simmer 1–2 minutes until glossy and thickened. If too thick, loosen with a splash of water; if thin, simmer 1 more minute.
Taste and adjust heat with more chili oil or chili flakes if desired.
Serve stir-fry over jasmine rice. Top with spring onion greens.

meals.name: Chicken Jalfrezi Skillet with Peppers over Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Quick stovetop chicken jalfrezi with onions and bell peppers in a tangy-spicy sauce, served over fluffy jasmine rice. Balanced medium heat and weeknight-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice in cold water until mostly clear; drain.
Cut 700 g chicken thighs into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Slice 2 onions and 2 bell peppers into strips.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Halve 1 lime.
Measure spices: 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garam masala.
Open 1 can diced tomatoes and 1 jar jalfrezi sauce.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 2.5 cups water to a pot; bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat 1.5 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Sear chicken in a single layer 3–4 minutes until lightly browned; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Stir and cook 2 minutes more; push to one side.
Add onions and bell peppers to the empty side with a drizzle of oil if needed; stir-fry 3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add minced garlic, chili flakes, and cumin; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in diced tomatoes and jalfrezi sauce; stir to coat everything. Bring to a lively simmer and cook 5–7 minutes, stirring, until the sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
Stir in garam masala and squeeze half the lime over the skillet. Taste and season with salt and black pepper as needed.
Serve over fluffed jasmine rice. Cut remaining lime into wedges for the table.

meals.name: Kung Pao-Style Chicken with Peanuts over Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Stovetop Chinese-inspired chicken stir-fry with a tangy, medium-heat chili-soy glaze and crunchy peanuts, served over fluffy jasmine rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; set aside.
Trim and cut 700 g chicken thighs into 2–3 cm pieces; pat dry.
Slice 2 bell peppers into strips and 1 onion into thin wedges.
Mince 4 cloves garlic and slice 4 spring onion (separate whites and greens).
Stir together sauce in a bowl: 1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1–2 tbsp sriracha, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 2 tsp cornflour, and 1/3 cup water.
Measure 1/2 cup peanuts and set aside.
Optional (for quicker plating): Warm pre-cooked rice in the microwave just before serving.
cook_steps: Cook jasmine rice on the stovetop per pack directions (use 1:1.5 rice-to-water ratio); keep covered to steam.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high; add 1 tbsp canola oil. Toast peanuts for 1–2 minutes until fragrant; remove to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp canola oil. Stir-fry chicken in a single layer 4–5 minutes until browned and mostly cooked; season with a pinch of salt and remove to a plate.
In the same pan, add onion wedges and bell pepper; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and spring onion whites; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return chicken to the pan. Stir the sauce (cornflour settles) and pour it in; add 1/2 tsp chili flakes.
Stir-fry 1–2 minutes until the sauce bubbles and thickens, coating the chicken and vegetables. Reduce heat to medium if needed.
Turn off heat; drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil (optional). Toss in toasted peanuts and spring onion greens.
Fluff rice and serve bowls of rice topped with kung pao-style chicken and extra chili flakes to taste.

meals.name: Thai Red Curry Fish with Baby Corn and Bok Choy
meals.description: Tender fish gently poached in a fragrant Thai red curry with baby corn and bok choy, served over fluffy jasmine rice. Medium heat and weeknight-fast on the stovetop.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; set aside.
Thinly slice 2 shallots.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Chop 300 g bok choy into bite-size pieces, separating stems and leaves.
Drain 200 g baby corn; cut into bite-size pieces if large.
Cut 600 g fish fillets into 2–3 cm pieces; pat dry.
Cut 1 lime into wedges.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice to a pot with water (per pack ratio). Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until tender. Keep covered off-heat.
Microwave baby corn for 1 minute to pre-warm; set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Add sliced shallots and cook 2 minutes until softened. Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste and cook 1 minute to bloom.
Pour in 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk and 1 tbsp fish sauce. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bok choy stems and the warmed baby corn; simmer 2–3 minutes until slightly tender.
Nestle fish pieces into the simmering curry in a single layer. Simmer gently (do not boil) for 4–6 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Stir in bok choy leaves and a pinch of chili flakes (optional). Simmer 1 minute until wilted. Taste; add more fish sauce or a small pinch of salt if needed.
Fluff rice. Serve curry over rice with lime wedges for squeezing.

archetypes.name: Family Heat-and-Eat Weeknights (Under 15, No Heat)
archetypes.description: Ultra-fast family dinners built from ready-to-eat mains and sides with simple fresh add-ons, prioritizing zero chili heat for kid-friendly plates.

meals.name: Microwave Lasagne & Salad Plate

meals.name: Microwave Roast Chicken Dinner with Green Beans & Garlic Bread
meals.description: Family-friendly heat-and-eat roast chicken with mashed potatoes, quick-steamed green beans, gravy, and warm garlic baguette. Zero chili heat and ready in minutes.
prep_steps: Read package directions for roast chicken, mashed potatoes, gravy, and garlic baguette to confirm timings.
Rinse green beans; trim ends. Place in a microwave-safe bowl with 2 tablespoons water and cover loosely.
Set out a microwave-safe jug or bowl for the gravy.
cook_steps: Microwave the roast chicken per package directions until hot.
Microwave the mashed potatoes per package directions until hot; keep covered.
Microwave the covered green beans for 3–4 minutes until tender-crisp; drain and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Pour gravy into the jug and microwave in 30–45 second bursts, stirring between, until hot.
Bake the garlic baguette in a preheated oven per package directions (about 8–10 minutes), or microwave if the package allows; slice.
Plate chicken and mashed potatoes, add green beans, and spoon over gravy. Serve with sliced garlic baguette.

archetypes.name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Balanced, aromatic family dinners featuring Turkish and North African favorites—kofta/kebab-style patties, pilafs, roasted veg, and simple tagine-inspired braises—with medium warmth and approachable multi-component steps.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a distinct medium-heat, 30–60 minute intermediate option centered on Turkish and North African cuisines not yet covered, complementing existing simple/no-heat and hot/advanced family archetypes without overlap.

meals.name: Harissa Lamb Kofta with Bulgur Pilaf and Roasted Peppers
meals.description: Juicy harissa-spiced lamb kofta with a tomato bulgur pilaf and oven-roasted peppers, finished with a cool mint yoghurt and sumac.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Rinse 1 1/2 cups bulgur in cold water; drain well.
Finely chop 1 large onion and 3 cloves garlic; divide half for kofta and half for pilaf.
Chop a small handful of parsley and mint; keep separate.
Cut 3 bell peppers into thick strips; toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Zest and juice 1/2 lemon; set aside.
Measure vegetable stock (about 2 1/4 cups).
cook_steps: Roast peppers: Spread bell peppers on a baking tray and roast 18–22 minutes until tender and lightly charred; turn once.
Start pilaf base: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add half the chopped onion and garlic with a pinch of salt; cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Add 1 tbsp tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in rinsed bulgur to coat.

Pour in vegetable stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and cook on low for 12–15 minutes until bulgur is tender and liquid is absorbed. Turn off heat, rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork and fold in chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice.

Make kofta mix: In a bowl, combine lamb mince, remaining onion and garlic, 1 tbsp harissa paste, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp coriander, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Shape kofta: With damp hands, form 8–12 oval patties or logs.
Cook kofta: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear kofta 3–4 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (internal temp ~70°C/160°F).
Mint yoghurt: In a small bowl, combine yoghurt with chopped mint, lemon zest, a squeeze of lemon juice, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of sumac.
Plate: Spoon bulgur pilaf onto plates, add roasted peppers and kofta. Drizzle mint yoghurt over or serve on the side. Sprinkle a little extra sumac if desired.

meals.name: Turkish-Style Yoghurt Chicken with Saffron Rice and Tomato-Cucumber Salad
meals.description: Oven-roasted yoghurt-marinated chicken thighs with warm spices, served over fragrant saffron basmati rice and a bright tomato-cucumber salad with sumac and lemon.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Finely grate 3 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; keep separate.
Thinly slice 1 large onion.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak 15 minutes, then drain.
Dice 3 tomatoes and 1 cucumber; thinly slice 1/2 red onion; chop a small handful of parsley.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix yoghurt, grated garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1.5 tsp paprika, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Pat dry chicken thighs and coat with the yoghurt marinade; place on a lined baking tray.
Roast chicken at 220°C/425°F for 25–30 minutes until browned and cooked through (juices run clear). Rest 5 minutes.
While chicken roasts, warm 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pot over medium heat. Add sliced onion and a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 minutes until soft.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 1 minute to coat. Add a pinch of saffron rubbed between fingers, 2.25 cups water, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest, covered, 10 minutes. Fluff before serving.
For the salad, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley. Toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1–2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Plate saffron rice, top with chicken, and serve salad on the side. Squeeze extra lemon over chicken if desired.

meals.name: Chermoula Baked Fish with Olive Couscous and Roast Vegetables
meals.description: Baked fish in chermoula with a lemon finish, served over olive-studded couscous and a tray of roasted peppers, zucchini, and tomatoes. Medium warmth and family-friendly prep with both oven and stovetop steps.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Pat dry fish fillets with paper towel.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Slice red onion into wedges.
Cut bell peppers into strips.
Cut zucchini into thick half-moons.
Finely chop parsley and mint.
Zest then cut the lemon into wedges.
Bring vegetable stock to a boil in a small pot or kettle.
cook_steps: On a large baking tray, toss cherry tomatoes, red onion, bell peppers, and zucchini with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch salt, black pepper, and chili flakes. Spread in an even layer and roast for 20–25 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
In a bowl, coat fish fillets with chermoula, 1 tbsp lemon juice (from the lemon), a pinch of salt, and 1 tsp olive oil. Set aside to marinate for 10 minutes while vegetables roast.
Place couscous in a heatproof bowl with a pinch of salt and 1 tsp olive oil. Pour the hot vegetable stock over, stir once, cover tightly (plate or lid), and let stand 5–8 minutes.
When vegetables have about 10–12 minutes left, make space on the tray or use a second tray. Arrange marinated fish fillets and bake 10–12 minutes until opaque and flaky.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in olives, parsley, mint, and lemon zest. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve couscous on plates, top with baked fish, add roasted vegetables on the side, and finish with lemon wedges.

meals.name: Apricot-Almond Chicken Tagine with Fluffy Couscous
meals.description: Oven-finished chicken thigh tagine with apricots, warm spices, and toasted almonds, served over parsley couscous. Medium warmth and family-friendly portions.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Slice 2 medium onions and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Pit and quarter 6 apricot.
Finely chop the rind of 1/2 preserved lemon.
Roughly chop 1/3 cup almonds and chop 1/2 cup parsley.
Measure spices: 1 tsp cinnamon, 1.5 tsp cumin, 1/2–1 tsp chili flakes.
Boil 2.5 cups water for couscous.
cook_steps: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
Season 800 g chicken thighs with 1 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp black pepper; brown 3–4 min per side. Transfer to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil if needed, then onions and a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 min until softened. Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.
Add cinnamon, cumin, and chili flakes; toast 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in apricot, preserved lemon, and 2 cups vegetable stock; bring to a simmer. Return chicken (and juices), cover, and transfer to the oven for 25–30 min until chicken is tender.
While the tagine cooks, place 2 cups couscous in a bowl with 1/2 tsp salt and 1 tbsp olive oil. Pour over 2.5 cups boiling water, cover, and let stand 10 min. Fluff with a fork and fold in parsley.
Toast almonds in a dry pan over medium heat for 2–3 min until golden.
Remove tagine from the oven; taste and adjust with salt and black pepper as needed.
Serve couscous in bowls, top with chicken and sauce, and sprinkle with toasted almonds. Add spoonfuls of hummus on the side if using.

Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
Season 800 g chicken thighs with 1 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp black pepper; brown 3–4 min per side. Transfer to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil if needed, then onions and a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 min until softened. Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.
Add cinnamon, cumin, and chili flakes; toast 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in apricot, preserved lemon, and 2 cups vegetable stock; bring to a simmer. Return chicken (and juices), cover, and transfer to the oven for 25–30 min until chicken is tender.
While the tagine cooks, place 2 cups couscous in a bowl with 1/2 tsp salt and 1 tbsp olive oil. Pour over 2.5 cups boiling water, cover, and let stand 10 min. Fluff with a fork and fold in parsley.
Toast almonds in a dry pan over medium heat for 2–3 min until golden.
Remove tagine from the oven; taste and adjust with salt and black pepper as needed.
Serve couscous in bowls, top with chicken and sauce, and sprinkle with toasted almonds. Add spoonfuls of hummus on the side if using.

meals.name: Turkish Beef & Eggplant Bake with Preserved Lemon Bulgur
meals.description: Moussaka-style layers of roasted eggplant and spiced beef baked under a yoghurt-egg topping, served with fragrant preserved lemon bulgur. Medium warmth, family-friendly, and from-scratch.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Slice eggplant into 1 cm rounds; sprinkle lightly with salt and set aside 10 minutes.
Dice onions and chop garlic.
Finely chop parsley (reserve some for bulgur).
Finely chop preserved lemon (remove any large seeds).
In a bowl, whisk yoghurt, eggs, flour, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of black pepper until smooth.
Rinse bulgur in a fine sieve and drain well.
Pat eggplant slices dry with paper towel.
cook_steps: Toss eggplant slices with 2 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of black pepper; spread on two baking trays and roast 18–22 minutes, turning once, until tender and lightly browned. Reduce oven to 180°C (355°F).
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 5 minutes until translucent; add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add beef mince and cook 5–7 minutes, breaking up, until browned and most liquid evaporates.
Stir in baharat, cinnamon, chili flakes, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper to taste; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute; add crushed tomatoes. Simmer 8–10 minutes until thick. Stir in half the chopped parsley and adjust seasoning.
Lightly oil a medium baking dish. Layer half the roasted eggplant, top with the beef-tomato mixture, then the remaining eggplant. Pour the yoghurt-egg mixture evenly over the top.
Bake at 180°C (355°F) for 15–20 minutes until the topping is set and lightly golden at the edges. Rest 5 minutes before serving.
While the bake is in the oven, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add rinsed bulgur and toast 1 minute, stirring.
Add vegetable stock, preserved lemon, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12 minutes.
Remove bulgur from heat and rest covered 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and fold in remaining chopped parsley.
Serve the beef & eggplant bake with preserved lemon bulgur on the side.

meals.name: Harissa Eggplant & Chickpea Stew with Preserved Lemon Saffron Rice
meals.description: Roasted eggplant and chickpeas simmered in a harissa-tomato sauce, served over fragrant saffron basmati rice finished with preserved lemon and parsley. Medium warmth with Turkish and North African spices.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F).
Rinse 1 1/2 cups basmati rice in cold water until clear; drain well.
Warm 2 tablespoons water and crumble a pinch of saffron into it; set aside.
Cut 2 eggplant into 2–3 cm cubes.
Slice 1 large onion thinly; mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 2 tablespoons preserved lemon peel (rinse if very salty).
Halve 1 cup cherry tomatoes.
Rinse and drain 2 cups chickpeas if using canned.
Chop 1/4 cup parsley.
cook_steps: On a baking tray, toss eggplant and cherry tomatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and 1 teaspoon paprika. Roast 20–25 minutes until browned and soft.
In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium. Add onion and cook 5–7 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 1 tablespoon harissa paste, 1 teaspoon cumin, and 1 teaspoon coriander; cook 30 seconds.
Add 1 1/2 cups crushed tomatoes and 1 tablespoon tomato paste with 1/2 cup water. Simmer 5 minutes.
Stir in chickpeas. Simmer 8–10 minutes to thicken. Adjust heat with extra harissa paste if needed; season with salt and black pepper to taste.

While sauce simmers, in a separate saucepan add rinsed basmati rice, 2 1/4 cups water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the saffron water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Rest off heat 5 minutes.
Fold roasted eggplant and tomatoes into the chickpea sauce. Simmer 2 minutes. Sprinkle in 1/2 teaspoon sumac (optional) and adjust seasoning.
Fluff rice with a fork and gently fold in the chopped preserved lemon and half the parsley.
Serve saffron rice in bowls, top with the harissa eggplant-chickpea stew, and finish with remaining parsley.

meals.name: Turkish Olive Oil Green Beans with Basmati Pilaf and Chermoula Roasted Carrots
meals.description: A family-style Turkish green bean braise paired with fluffy basmati rice and North African chermoula-roasted carrots for balanced, medium warmth.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Rinse 1.5 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 10 minutes, then drain.
Trim green beans and cut into 5 cm pieces.
Slice onions and mince garlic.
Roughly chop tomatoes (if whole).
Peel carrots and cut into batons.
Roughly chop parsley.
Zest and juice the lemon.
cook_steps: Roast carrots: Toss carrots with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp chermoula, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of black pepper. Spread on a baking tray and roast 20–25 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
Finish carrots: Remove from oven; toss with remaining 1 tbsp chermoula and 1–2 tsp lemon juice. Set aside warm.
Start beans: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a wide pot over medium. Add onions with a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 minutes until soft. Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.

Braise: Add green beans, tomatoes, tomato paste, chili flakes, a pinch of black pepper, and 1/2 cup vegetable stock. Stir, cover, and simmer 20–25 minutes, stirring once or twice, until beans are tender and saucy. If dry, add a splash more stock.
Finish beans: Stir in 1 tsp lemon zest and half the parsley. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.

Cook rice: In a saucepan, warm 1 tbsp olive oil over medium. Add drained rice; stir 1 minute. Add 2.25 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Remove from heat and rest covered 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork and fold in remaining parsley.
Serve rice topped with the olive oil green beans and a side of chermoula roasted carrots. Sprinkle sumac over the beans if using.

meals.name: Spinach & Feta Borek with Sumac Tomato-Cucumber Salad and Garlic Yoghurt
meals.description: Crisp oven-baked phyllo borek filled with spinach, feta, herbs, and gentle chili heat, served with a bright sumac tomato-cucumber salad and cooling garlic yoghurt.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Line a large baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Finely chop 1 medium onion.
Squeeze excess moisture from 400 g spinach if watery.
Crumble 200 g feta cheese into a bowl.
Beat 2 eggs in a small bowl.
Finely chop 2 tbsp mint and 1/4 cup parsley.
Dice 3 tomatoes and 1 cucumber; thinly slice 1/4 red onion for the salad.
Crush 1 garlic clove for the yoghurt.
Lay out 8–10 sheets of phyllo pastry and cover with a clean towel to prevent drying.
cook_steps: Warm 2 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook 4–5 minutes until translucent.
Add spinach, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp chili flakes. Cook 2–3 minutes to drive off moisture. Cool 5 minutes.
Stir in crumbled feta, beaten eggs, chopped mint, and half the parsley to make the filling.
Assemble borek: Lay 2 sheets phyllo on the tray, brush lightly with 1–2 tbsp olive oil; repeat to create a 4-sheet base. Spread the filling evenly, leaving a 2 cm border.
Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with olive oil. Tuck edges to seal. Brush the top with 1 tbsp olive oil and sprinkle 1 tbsp sesame seeds.
Bake 25–35 minutes until deep golden and crisp. Rest 5 minutes before slicing.
Make salad: In a bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, remaining parsley, 1 tsp sumac, juice of 1 lemon, 2 tbsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt. Toss and set aside.
Make garlic yoghurt: Mix 1 cup yoghurt with crushed garlic, a pinch of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Slice borek into squares. Serve with salad and a spoon of garlic yoghurt.

meals.name: Turkish Lamb & Bulgur Stuffed Peppers with Tomato Sauce and Cucumber-Mint Salad
meals.description: Tender bell peppers filled with spiced lamb and bulgur, baked in a savory tomato sauce, served with a bright cucumber-mint salad. Medium warmth and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Rinse bulgur in cold water and drain.
Slice tops off bell peppers and remove seeds; keep tops.
Finely chop onions and garlic.
Chop parsley and mint.
Dice cucumber and cut lemon into wedges.
In a bowl, combine lamb mince, rinsed bulgur, half the chopped onions, half the garlic, parsley, mint (reserve some for salad), cumin, paprika, chili flakes, cinnamon, black pepper, and salt.
In a separate bowl, mix crushed tomatoes with tomato paste, remaining onions and garlic, olive oil, salt, and a splash of water to loosen.
cook_steps: Stuff the bell peppers firmly with the lamb-bulgur mixture, leaving a little space at the top; cap with pepper tops.
Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce in the base of a baking dish; nestle stuffed peppers upright and pour remaining sauce around them. Add enough water to bring sauce halfway up the peppers.
Cover dish tightly (lid or baking dish cover) and bake for 35 minutes.
Uncover, baste peppers with sauce, and bake 10–15 minutes more until peppers are tender and filling is cooked through.
While peppers finish, make the salad: toss cucumber with olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, a pinch of salt, and remaining mint.
Rest peppers 5 minutes. Spoon sauce over each serving and plate with cucumber-mint salad. Serve with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Izmir-Style Beef Köfte Tray Bake with Bulgur Pilaf and Preserved Lemon Chopped Salad
meals.description: Baked Turkish beef köfte with potatoes, peppers, and tomato-chili sauce, served with fluffy bulgur pilaf and a bright preserved-lemon salad. Medium warmth and family-friendly, cooked on the stovetop and in the oven.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 200°C/390°F.
Finely chop 1 of the onions and 3 cloves of garlic for the köfte mix.
Slice the remaining onion into thin half-moons for the sauce.
Cut potatoes into 1 cm thick wedges; cut bell peppers into strips.
Chop parsley; finely chop 1 slice of preserved lemon (rind only) for the salad.
Dice tomatoes and cucumber for the salad; thinly slice red onion.
Rinse bulgur in a sieve; drain.
Measure vegetable stock (hot) for pilaf.
cook_steps: Make köfte: In a bowl, mix beef mince, the finely chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, parsley (2 tbsp), ground cumin (1 tsp), paprika (1 tsp), chili flakes (1/2 tsp), salt, and black pepper. Form 12–16 oval patties.
Start tray base: In a large ovenproof dish, toss potatoes and bell peppers with olive oil (2 tbsp), salt, and black pepper.
Sear köfte: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear köfte 1–2 min per side to brown (do not cook through). Transfer onto the potatoes and peppers.

Make sauce: In the same skillet, add sliced onion with a little olive oil if needed; cook 3–4 min. Add 1 clove minced garlic, tomato paste (1 tbsp), chili flakes (1/4 tsp), ground cumin (1/2 tsp); cook 1 min. Stir in crushed tomatoes (1 cup) and water (1/2 cup); season with salt and black pepper. Simmer 2–3 min.
Bake: Pour the sauce over the tray. Cover loosely with foil and bake 20 min, then uncover and bake 10–15 min until potatoes are tender and köfte are cooked through.

Cook bulgur pilaf: While the tray bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium. Add 2 tbsp finely chopped onions; cook 2–3 min. Stir in rinsed bulgur (1 cup) to coat 1 min. Add hot vegetable stock (1.75 cups), a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12–15 min until liquid is absorbed. Rest 5 min, fluff with a fork.

Make salad: In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, cucumber, sliced red onion, chopped parsley (2 tbsp), finely chopped preserved lemon, olive oil (1–2 tbsp), lemon juice (1 tbsp), sumac (1/2 tsp), salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Serve: Spoon bulgur pilaf onto plates, add köfte, peppers, and potatoes with pan sauce. Serve salad on the side.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
archetypes.description: Presentation-forward family meals like paella, bacalhau bakes, and peri-peri platters that take time and care for memorable weekend dinners.
archetypes.rationale: Fills the current gap for Family-oriented, 60+ minute Showstopper meals with new Spanish/Portuguese cuisine coverage distinct from existing quick, hands-off, and medium-heat options.

meals.name: Family Chicken & Chorizo Paella
meals.description: A showstopping Spanish-style paella with saffron rice, seared chicken thighs, and smoky chorizo. Built for a family feast with golden socarrat and fresh lemon-parsley finish.
prep_steps: Finely chop onions.
Dice red pepper.
Mince garlic.
Slice chorizo into 1 cm rounds.
Chop parsley; cut lemon into wedges.
Season chicken thighs with salt and black pepper.
Warm chicken stock in a pot; crumble saffron into the stock and keep hot on low.
If using an outdoor grill, preheat to medium and set up a stable surface for the pan.
cook_steps: Set a wide, heavy pan (paella pan or large skillet) over medium heat on the stovetop or grill; add olive oil.
Brown chorizo 3–4 minutes; remove to a bowl, leaving the rendered oil in the pan.
Sear chicken thighs skin-side down until deeply golden, 6–8 minutes; flip and cook 3–4 minutes more. Remove to a plate.
Add onions and red pepper to the pan; cook until softened, 6–8 minutes. Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes; cook, stirring, until thick and jammy, 3–5 minutes.
Stir in spanish rice to coat in the sofrito, 1 minute.
Pour in white wine; simmer until mostly absorbed, 1–2 minutes.
Add the hot saffron chicken stock and bay leaf; stir once to distribute rice evenly, then stop stirring.
Nestle chicken thighs and chorizo into the rice. Cook uncovered at a steady simmer, rotating the pan occasionally for even heat, about 15 minutes.

Scatter peas over the surface. Continue cooking 10–15 minutes until rice is tender and most liquid is absorbed. For socarrat, increase heat for the last 2–3 minutes without stirring until you hear gentle crackling.
Remove from heat; cover loosely with a clean towel and rest 5–10 minutes.
Discard bay leaf, sprinkle with parsley, and serve with lemon wedges.

meals.name: Portuguese Smoked Hake Bake with Roasted Padrón Peppers
meals.description: A family-size Portuguese-style fish and potato bake in a creamy paprika sauce, finished in the oven and served with blistered Padrón peppers. Weekend showstopper with Spanish and Portuguese flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Peel potatoes and cut into thin matchsticks (or small cubes).
Thinly slice onions; mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley; zest the lemon and set aside the zest.
Rinse and dry padron peppers.
Pat smoked hake dry and flake into large pieces, removing any bones.
Warm milk in a small pot with bay leaves until steaming (do not boil); set aside off heat.
cook_steps: Parboil the cut potatoes in salted water for 5 minutes; drain well.
Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet (StoveTop). Fry drained potatoes over medium-high heat until lightly golden and just tender, 8–10 minutes; transfer to a large bowl.
In the same skillet, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook onions with a pinch of salt over medium heat until soft and lightly golden, 8–10 minutes. Add garlic and 1 tsp paprika; cook 30 seconds.
Deglaze onions with white wine; simmer 1–2 minutes until reduced. Add onions to the bowl with potatoes.
In a clean pot, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to make a roux; cook 1–2 minutes.
Remove bay leaves from the warm milk. Gradually whisk milk into the roux until smooth. Simmer 3–5 minutes, whisking, until thick and glossy. Season with salt and black pepper.
Fold flaked smoked hake, parsley, and lemon zest into the potatoes and onions. Pour over the hot sauce and gently combine. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Transfer mixture to a greased baking dish. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil over the top. Bake (Oven) 25–30 minutes until bubbling and lightly browned.
While the bake finishes, toss padron peppers with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt. Spread on a tray and roast 10–12 minutes until blistered, turning once.
Rest the bake 5 minutes. Squeeze lemon over peppers and the bake to taste. Serve hot with extra parsley.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Peel potatoes and cut into thin matchsticks (or small cubes).
Thinly slice onions; mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley; zest the lemon and set aside the zest.
Rinse and dry padron peppers.
Pat smoked hake dry and flake into large pieces, removing any bones.
Warm milk in a small pot with bay leaves until steaming (do not boil); set aside off heat.
Parboil the cut potatoes in salted water for 5 minutes; drain well.
Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet (StoveTop). Fry drained potatoes over medium-high heat until lightly golden and just tender, 8–10 minutes; transfer to a large bowl.
In the same skillet, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook onions with a pinch of salt over medium heat until soft and lightly golden, 8–10 minutes. Add garlic and 1 tsp paprika; cook 30 seconds.
Deglaze onions with white wine; simmer 1–2 minutes until reduced. Add onions to the bowl with potatoes.
In a clean pot, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to make a roux; cook 1–2 minutes.
Remove bay leaves from the warm milk. Gradually whisk milk into the roux until smooth. Simmer 3–5 minutes, whisking, until thick and glossy. Season with salt and black pepper.
Fold flaked smoked hake, parsley, and lemon zest into the potatoes and onions. Pour over the hot sauce and gently combine. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Transfer mixture to a greased baking dish. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil over the top. Bake (Oven) 25–30 minutes until bubbling and lightly browned.
While the bake finishes, toss padron peppers with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt. Spread on a tray and roast 10–12 minutes until blistered, turning once.
Rest the bake 5 minutes. Squeeze lemon over peppers and the bake to taste. Serve hot with extra parsley.

meals.name: Charred Peri-Peri Butterflied Chicken with Lemon Potatoes and Blistered Padrón Peppers
meals.description: A family-style Portuguese-Spanish feast: grill-roasted peri-peri butterflied chicken with crispy lemon potatoes and quick-blistered Padrón peppers.
prep_steps: Pat dry the butterflied chicken with paper towels.
In a bowl, mix peri-peri sauce, peri-peri spice blend, 3 tbsp olive oil, 3 minced garlic cloves, zest of 1 lemon, juice of 1 lemon, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Rub marinade all over the chicken (under the skin where possible). Cover and marinate 30–60 minutes in the fridge.
Peel (optional) and cut potatoes into 3–4 cm chunks. Rinse to remove surface starch.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil for potatoes. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a large roasting tray inside.
Toss padron peppers with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt in a bowl; set aside.
Finely chop parsley. Slice the remaining lemon into wedges for serving.
Prepare the grill for medium heat with a two-zone setup (indirect and direct heat). Oil the grates.
cook_steps: Parboil potatoes in boiling water for 8–10 minutes until just tender on the edges. Drain and let steam-dry 2 minutes.

In a large bowl, toss hot potatoes with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp paprika, and 2 minced garlic cloves. Carefully tip onto the preheated tray and roast 35–45 minutes, turning once, until golden and crisp.
Place marinated butterflied chicken skin-side up over indirect heat on the grill. Close lid and cook 35–45 minutes, maintaining steady medium heat.

Move chicken to direct heat, skin-side down, and char 3–5 minutes to crisp. Flip and brush with a little extra peri-peri sauce if desired; cook until juices run clear and thickest part reaches doneness.
While chicken finishes, blister padron peppers: place a cast-iron pan on the grill or use a hot stovetop pan. Add peppers and cook 3–5 minutes, tossing, until blistered. Season with a pinch of salt.
Rest chicken 10 minutes. Scatter chopped parsley over potatoes.
Carve chicken. Serve with lemon wedges, crispy lemon potatoes, and blistered padron peppers.

meals.name: Caldeirada de Peixe (Portuguese Family Fish Stew)
meals.description: A layered Portuguese fish stew baked and simmered with potatoes, peppers, tomatoes, and aromatic bay-saffron broth for a showpiece family pot.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Rinse and pat dry fish fillets; cut into large chunks (about palm-size).
Rinse mussels and discard any broken shells (if using ready-cooked, keep chilled until assembly).
Peel potatoes and slice into 1 cm rounds.
Peel onions and slice into thin rings.
Core and slice red pepper into strips.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley; cut lemon into wedges.
Dissolve fish stock concentrate in 500 ml warm water.
Measure white wine, olive oil, paprika, saffron, salt, and black pepper.
cook_steps: Heat a large oven-safe pot with lid over medium heat; add 3 tbsp olive oil.
Scatter a layer of onions on the bottom, then a layer of potatoes, a few strips of red pepper, and half the garlic; season lightly with salt, black pepper, and a pinch of paprika.
Add half the fish fillets in a single layer; add 1 bay leaf.
Repeat layers: onions, potatoes, red pepper, remaining garlic, a little salt, pepper, paprika; then the remaining fish and second bay leaf.
Pour in diced tomatoes, white wine, and the warm fish stock concentrate mixture around the sides so layers stay mostly intact.
Sprinkle saffron over the top and drizzle remaining 1 tbsp olive oil.
Bring to a gentle simmer on the stovetop (about 5–7 minutes).
Cover the pot and transfer to the oven; bake 25–30 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Return pot to stovetop on medium; nestle mussels on top, cover, and cook 5–8 minutes until mussels are heated through and (if raw) opened. Discard any that do not open.
Taste and adjust salt and black pepper. Rest 5 minutes.
Finish with chopped parsley and a few squeezes of lemon. Serve directly from the pot with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Spanish Seafood Fideuà (Toasted Noodle Paella)
meals.description: A showstopping Valencian-style seafood feast made with toasted broken spaghetti, rich saffron-tomato sofrito, and oven-finished for a crisp top. Serve with parsley and lemon for a bright table-side finish.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/430°F.
Break the spaghetti into 2–3 cm pieces (do this in a large bowl).
If the seafood mix is frozen, thaw and drain well; pat dry.
Finely chop the onions.
Dice the red pepper.
Mince the garlic.
Warm 1.2 L water and stir in fish stock concentrate; add a pinch of saffron to infuse.
Chop parsley leaves; cut the lemon into wedges.
Measure spices (paprika, salt, black pepper) and open the diced tomatoes.
cook_steps: Set a wide oven-safe skillet or shallow casserole over medium heat; add 2 tbsp olive oil.
Add the broken spaghetti and toast, stirring, until deep golden in spots (6–8 min). Transfer noodles to a tray.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil to the same pan; add onions and red pepper with a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, until very soft and sweet (10–12 min).
Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes; cook down to a thick, jammy sofrito (8–10 min), stirring occasionally.
Return toasted noodles to the pan and toss to coat in the sofrito.
Pour in the hot saffron stock. Spread noodles evenly; do not stir after this point.
Simmer on medium for 8–10 min until noodles begin to surface and most liquid is absorbed.
Nestle the drained seafood mix evenly over the top and scatter peas around.
Transfer the pan to the oven and bake 10–12 min until seafood is just cooked and the top is drying.
For a crisp bottom (socarrat), return to stovetop over medium-high heat for 2–3 min, listening for gentle crackling; avoid burning.
Rest 5 min off heat. Finish with chopped parsley, black pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Serve straight from the pan with lemon wedges for squeezing at the table.

meals.name: Iberian Tuna & Pepper Empanada (Family-Sized Pie)
meals.description: A Galician-style baked savory pie filled with tuna, slow-cooked onions, red pepper, and tomato, finished with a glossy crust. A centerpiece bake for an Iberian weekend spread.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F). Line a large baking tray.
Activate dough: In a bowl, combine yeast, warm water, and sugar. Let stand 5–10 minutes until foamy.
Make dough base: In a large bowl, add flour and salt. Pour in activated yeast mixture and 3 tbsp olive oil. Mix to form a soft dough.
Knead on a lightly floured surface for 8–10 minutes until smooth. Place in a greased bowl, cover, and proof 45–60 minutes until doubled.
Chop onions finely. Dice red pepper. Mince garlic. Roughly chop parsley.
Drain tuna well.
Place 2 eggs in a small pot of cold water for hard-boiling (do not start heat yet). Crack the 3rd egg into a small bowl and beat for egg wash.
cook_steps: Start the filling base: Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over medium. Add onions, red pepper, and bay leaf. Cook 12–15 minutes, stirring, until very soft and sweet.
Add garlic and paprika; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in diced tomatoes, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Simmer 10–12 minutes until thick and jammy. Remove bay leaf. Fold in tuna and parsley. Cool filling to room temperature.
While the filling simmers, bring the pot with eggs to a boil, then simmer 9 minutes. Cool under cold water, peel, and chop the 2 hard-boiled eggs.
Punch down the risen dough. Divide into two pieces (one slightly larger for the base).
Roll the larger piece into a rectangle roughly 30×40 cm. Lay onto the prepared tray.
Spread the cooled tuna-pepper filling evenly, leaving a 2 cm border. Scatter the chopped hard-boiled eggs over the filling.
Roll the second dough piece to fit as a lid. Place over filling. Pinch and crimp edges to seal.
Cut 3–4 small slits on top to vent. Brush with beaten egg.
Bake 35–45 minutes until deep golden brown and cooked through. Rest 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

meals.name: Smoked Hake à Brás with Blistered Padrón Peppers
meals.description: A Portuguese à Brás-style shredded smoked hake with crisp matchstick potatoes and creamy eggs, finished with olives and parsley, served alongside Spanish-style blistered Padrón peppers. A family showpiece with comforting textures and bright lemon.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 230°C (450°F).
Peel potatoes and cut into thin matchsticks; soak in cold water 20 minutes to remove starch, then drain and dry well with towels.
Slice onions thinly.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley.
Beat eggs in a bowl with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Rinse smoked hake briefly; set aside.
Rinse and dry padron peppers; toss in a bowl with a little olive oil and salt.
Cut lemon into wedges.
Set out a large frying pan for potatoes, a wide sauté pan for the hake mix, and a baking tray for peppers.
cook_steps: In a medium pot, add smoked hake, bay leaves, and enough water to cover; bring to a gentle simmer on the stovetop for 6–8 minutes until just flaky. Drain, discard bay leaves, and flake the fish, removing any skin/bones.

Heat a large frying pan with 80 ml olive oil over medium-high heat. Fry dried potato matchsticks in batches until golden and crisp (6–8 minutes per batch). Transfer to a paper towel–lined tray and season with salt. Keep warm.
While frying potatoes, spread padron peppers on a baking tray, season with salt, and roast in the oven for 8–10 minutes until blistered, turning once. Hold in the switched-off oven to keep warm.
In a wide sauté pan, add 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Cook sliced onions with a pinch of salt until soft and pale golden, 8–10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add flaked smoked hake to the onions and warm through for 2–3 minutes, gently folding.
Reduce heat to low. Pour in beaten eggs and stir slowly with a spatula until just creamy and softly set, 2–3 minutes (do not scramble dry).
Fold in most of the crispy potatoes (reserve a handful for topping), chopped parsley, and most of the olives. Adjust salt and black pepper, and add a small drizzle of olive oil if needed.
Plate the à Brás. Top with reserved crispy potatoes and remaining olives. Serve with blistered padron peppers and lemon wedges on the side for squeezing.

meals.name: Grilled Portuguese Sardines with Tomato-Pepper Rice
meals.description: Char-grilled sardines served over a rich Iberian tomato-pepper rice for a festive family centerpiece. Slow-simmered rice and smoky fish deliver classic Portuguese-Spanish weekend vibes.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat; clean and oil the grates.
Rinse sardines under cold water and pat fully dry with paper towels.
Peel and finely chop onions.
Finely chop garlic.
Core and dice red pepper.
Rinse spanish rice in cold water until water runs mostly clear; drain.
Roughly chop parsley.
Halve the lemon.
Measure water and have fish stock concentrate ready.
cook_steps: Start the rice: Heat a large deep pan over medium heat on the StoveTop and add olive oil.
Sauté onions with a pinch of salt until translucent, 8–10 minutes, then add garlic and red pepper; cook 2–3 minutes.
Stir in paprika and saffron; toast 30 seconds.
Add spanish rice; stir to coat in oil and aromatics for 1 minute.
Pour in diced tomatoes, fish stock concentrate, and water; add bay leaf and a pinch of black pepper. Bring to a boil.

Reduce to low, cover, and simmer gently until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 18–22 minutes. If needed, add a splash of water to finish. Keep covered off-heat 5 minutes; fluff and fold in parsley.
While rice simmers, drizzle sardines with olive oil; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
Grill sardines over direct heat, 3–4 minutes per side, until skin is charred and flesh just opaque. Move to indirect heat if flare-ups occur.
Squeeze lemon over sardines; taste rice and adjust salt and black pepper.
To serve, spread tomato-pepper rice on a warm platter and arrange sardines on top. Serve extra lemon on the side.

meals.name: Portuguese Garlic-Lemon Roast Leg of Lamb with Spanish Panadera Potatoes
meals.description: A showstopping roast leg of lamb marinated with garlic, lemon, paprika, and bay, served over Spanish-style sliced potatoes and onions that soak up the pan juices.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Peel and thinly slice the onions.
Peel and slice the potatoes into 5–7 mm rounds.
Peel and crush the garlic.
Halve and juice the lemon; reserve the squeezed halves.
In a bowl, mix garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, paprika, oregano, salt, black pepper, and white wine to make a marinade.
Pat the leg of lamb dry with paper towels.
Toss potatoes and onions with a little olive oil, salt, black pepper, and a pinch of paprika.
Lightly oil a large roasting pan and spread the potatoes and onions evenly.
Pierce the leg of lamb all over with a knife to help the marinade penetrate.
cook_steps: Rub the leg of lamb thoroughly with the marinade, tucking bay leaves and the squeezed lemon halves under and around the meat.
Heat a large stove-safe roasting pan or skillet over medium-high heat and sear the leg of lamb on all sides until browned (about 8–10 minutes total).
Set the seared lamb on top of the potato-onion bed in the roasting pan, pouring any marinade and pan juices over everything.
Roast at 200°C (390°F) for 20 minutes to develop color.
Reduce oven to 170°C (340°F) and continue roasting 60–80 minutes, basting the lamb and potatoes with pan juices every 20 minutes. Add a splash of water if the pan looks dry.
Check doneness: for medium, aim for 60–63°C (140–145°F) in the thickest part. Roast longer for more doneness as preferred.
Rest the lamb on a board, loosely covered, for 15–20 minutes.
While the lamb rests, return the potatoes to the oven for 10 minutes to crisp edges and reduce the juices slightly.
Slice the lamb across the grain. Scatter chopped parsley over the potatoes and onions.
Serve sliced lamb over the panadera potatoes, spooning pan juices on top.

meals.name: Chicken & Chorizo Paella with Saffron and Peppers
meals.description: A family-sized Spanish paella layered with golden chicken, smoky chorizo, saffron rice, and sweet peppers, finished with lemon and parsley. A centerpiece weekend cook that rewards patience with deep flavor and a crisp socarrat.
prep_steps: Warm 5 cups chicken stock; crumble a pinch of saffron into it to infuse.
Slice chorizo into 0.5 cm rounds.
Pat dry chicken thighs and season all sides with salt and black pepper.
Dice onions; mince garlic.
Core and slice bell peppers into strips.
Chop parsley; cut lemon into wedges.
If using an outdoor grill, preheat it for medium, even heat. If using stovetop, place a wide paella pan or large skillet over medium heat.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in the pan. Add chorizo and cook 3–4 minutes until lightly crisp; remove to a bowl, leaving the rendered oil.
Brown chicken thighs skin-side down 6–8 minutes, flip and brown 3–4 minutes more; remove to a plate (they will finish in the rice).
Add onions and bell peppers with a pinch of salt; cook 6–8 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes; cook 2–3 minutes to reduce excess liquid.
Add spanish rice; stir 1 minute to coat in the tomato and oil.
Pour in white wine; simmer 1–2 minutes until mostly absorbed.
Pour in the hot saffron chicken stock and add bay leaves. Stir once to distribute rice evenly, then do not stir again.
Nestle chicken thighs and chorizo into the rice. Adjust heat to maintain a steady simmer. Cook uncovered 18–20 minutes, rotating the pan occasionally for even cooking.
Scatter peas over the top; cook 5–8 minutes more until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed (add a splash of water if needed).
For socarrat: increase heat to medium-high for 1–2 minutes until you hear gentle crackling; stop before burning.
Remove from heat; tent loosely and rest 5–10 minutes. Discard bay leaves, garnish with parsley, and serve with lemon wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Latin Comfort (Mild, 30–60, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Family-friendly Latin American and Mexican dinners with gentle seasoning—rice-and-bean plates, enchilada or tortilla bakes, picadillo, and roast-chicken arroz with mild salsas and fresh toppings.
archetypes.rationale: This fills a clear gap by offering mild, intermediate 30–60 minute Latin American/Mexican family meals distinct from the existing extra-hot quick set and hot advanced feasts.

meals.name: Family Arroz con Pollo with Corn
meals.description: A mild, family-style Latin arroz con pollo baked to finish—tender chicken thighs over seasoned tomato rice with corn, coriander, and lime. Optional salsa on the side.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Rinse and drain the brown rice until water runs mostly clear.
Dice the onions and bell peppers.
Mince the garlic.
Chop the coriander; cut the lime into wedges.
Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken thighs skin-side down until browned, 4–5 minutes; flip and brown 2 minutes more. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium; add onions and bell peppers. Cook until softened, 4–5 minutes.
Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and oregano. Stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in rinsed brown rice; toast 1 minute, coating grains in oil and spices.
Add crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, corn, bay leaves, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Stir and bring to a gentle simmer.
Nestle chicken thighs on top (skin-side up). Cover with a tight lid or foil.
Bake at 180°C/350°F for 30–35 minutes, until rice is tender and liquid absorbed.
Rest 5–10 minutes off heat, covered. Remove bay leaves.
Fluff rice around the chicken. Sprinkle coriander and squeeze lime over the top.
Serve with extra lime wedges and salsa on the side (optional).

meals.name: Family Picadillo Tacos with Rice
meals.description: Mild beef picadillo with potatoes, olives, and gentle spices, served in warm taco shells with a side of fluffy rice. Family-friendly and comforting with Latin American/Mexican flavors.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear.
Peel and small-dice 2 medium potatoes (about 1 cm cubes).
Finely chop 1 large onion.
Seed and small-dice 1 bell pepper.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/3 cup olives.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F to warm taco shells.
Measure 1 cup beef stock and set aside.
cook_steps: Cook the rice: In a medium pot, combine rinsed jasmine rice, 3 cups water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff.
Warm taco shells: Place taco shells on a baking tray and warm in the oven for 5–7 minutes. Keep warm.
Start the picadillo: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up, 4–5 minutes until browned. Drain excess fat if needed.
Add aromatics: Stir in onions, bell pepper, and a pinch of salt. Cook 3–4 minutes until softened. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Season and build sauce: Stir in 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1 bay leaf, and a few grinds black pepper. Cook 1 minute.

Simmer with potatoes: Add diced potatoes and beef stock. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 12–15 minutes, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are tender and most liquid is reduced. If drying too fast, splash in water.
Finish: Stir in chopped olives and 1–2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar. Taste and season with salt and black pepper to preference. Remove bay leaf.
Serve: Spoon picadillo into warm taco shells. Serve with fluffed rice on the side.

meals.name: Family Chicken Enchilada Bake (Mild)
meals.description: Rolled chicken-and-pepper enchiladas baked with mild sauce and cheddar. Family-friendly comfort with gentle seasoning.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 190°C/375°F.
Finely dice onions.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips.
Mince garlic.
Trim excess fat from chicken thighs and cut into small bite-size pieces.
Grate cheddar cheese if not pre-grated.
Halve the lime for squeezing and wedges.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and bell peppers; cook 5–6 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs, salt, black pepper, cumin, and paprika; cook 6–8 minutes until chicken is just cooked through.
Pour in half of the enchilada sauce; stir to coat and simmer 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Lightly oil a 23x33 cm (9x13 in) baking dish. Spread 2–3 tablespoons enchilada sauce on the bottom.
Warm tortillas briefly in a dry pan or microwave so they’re pliable.
Fill each tortilla with the chicken mixture and a little cheddar; roll and place seam-side down in the dish.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with the rest of the cheddar.
Bake 15–18 minutes until bubbly and cheese is melted.
Rest 5 minutes, then garnish with chopped coriander and a squeeze of lime. Serve with extra lime wedges.

meals.name: Mild Black Bean & Rice Stuffed Peppers
meals.description: Bell peppers baked with a mild Latin/Mexican black bean, tomato, corn, and rice filling. Comforting and family-friendly with bright lime and coriander.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 190°C/375°F.
Rinse 1 cup jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Halve 4 bell peppers lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes.
Dice 1 onion and mince 2 cloves garlic.
Rinse and drain black beans; measure corn.
Halve the lime; chop coriander leaves.
cook_steps: Add 2 cups water and the rinsed jasmine rice to a pot; bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer until tender, 12–15 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes.
While rice cooks, brush or rub bell pepper halves with 1 tsp olive oil, place cut-side up on a baking tray, and bake 10 minutes to soften. Remove and set aside.
Heat 2 tsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion until translucent, 4–5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp salt; cook 30 seconds to bloom spices.
Add diced tomatoes, black beans, and corn. Simmer 5–7 minutes to thicken slightly.
Fold the cooked rice into the skillet mixture. Squeeze in half the lime and adjust salt to taste.
Spoon filling into the pre-baked bell pepper halves. Return to the oven and bake 15–20 minutes until peppers are tender and filling is hot.
Finish with chopped coriander and remaining lime wedges for serving.

meals.name: Family Albóndigas Soup (Mild Mexican Meatball Soup)
meals.description: A comforting pot of beef-and-rice meatball soup simmered with carrots, potatoes, and zucchini in a mild tomato broth. Family-friendly, gentle seasoning, and made from scratch.
prep_steps: Rinse 1/3 cup jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear; drain well.
Finely chop 1 medium onion and 3 cloves garlic; keep half the onion for the meatballs and half for the soup base.
Peel and slice 2 carrots; peel and dice 2 potatoes into 2 cm cubes.
Slice 1 large zucchini into half-moons.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup coriander; cut 1 lime into wedges.

In a bowl, combine ground beef, drained jasmine rice, half the chopped onion, half the chopped garlic, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper; mix just until combined and form 16 golf-ball-sized meatballs.
Set out crushed tomatoes and beef stock at the stove.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the remaining onion and garlic; cook 2–3 minutes until translucent.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon cumin and 1/2 teaspoon oregano; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in 6 cups beef stock and 2 cups crushed tomatoes; bring to a gentle boil.
Lower to a simmer. Gently place the meatballs into the pot one by one.
Add carrots and potatoes. Cover and simmer 20 minutes, maintaining a gentle bubble.
Add zucchini and continue simmering 10–12 minutes, until meatballs are cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Season to taste with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper (adjust as needed).
Stir in most of the chopped coriander. Ladle into bowls and serve with lime wedges; sprinkle remaining coriander on top.

meals.name: Baked Tilapia a la Veracruz with Spanish Rice
meals.description: Mild, family-friendly baked tilapia in a tomato, olive, and oregano sauce, served with fluffy Spanish rice. Comforting Latin/Mexican flavors with simple oven-and-stovetop execution.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Rinse and pat dry tilapia fillets.
Thinly slice onions; mince garlic.
Slice olives if whole.
Halve the lime (reserve wedges for serving).
Measure spanish rice and water.
cook_steps: Start rice: In a pot, cook spanish rice with water according to package directions; keep warm.
Heat olive oil (1 tbsp) in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes, olives, oregano, bay leaves, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper. Simmer 5 minutes. Squeeze in juice from half the lime and stir.
Lightly oil a baking dish with remaining olive oil (1 tbsp). Place tilapia in a single layer; season with 1/2 tsp salt.
Spoon the tomato-olive sauce over the fish. Bake until the fish flakes easily, 12–15 minutes.
Remove bay leaves. Plate the tilapia with Spanish rice. Serve with remaining lime wedges.

meals.name: Chorizo & Black Bean Maize Meal Skillet Pie (Mild)
meals.description: A family-friendly Latin-inspired bake: a savory chorizo, black bean, and tomato filling topped with creamy maize meal and cheddar, finished in the oven until bubbling and golden.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Dice onions and bell peppers; mince garlic.
Rinse and drain black beans.
Shred cheddar cheese.
Chop coriander; cut lime into wedges.
Measure maize meal and vegetable stock (3 cups for maize meal, 1/2 cup for filling).
cook_steps: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo and cook 4–5 minutes, breaking it up. If dry, add olive oil.
Add onions and bell peppers; cook 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic, cumin, oregano, paprika, and chilli powder; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.

Add black beans, diced tomatoes, 1/2 cup vegetable stock, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Simmer 5–7 minutes to slightly thicken. Taste and adjust seasoning. Remove from heat while you make the maize layer.
In a saucepan, bring 3 cups vegetable stock to a simmer. Whisk in maize meal gradually to avoid lumps.
Reduce heat to low and cook, whisking, 5–7 minutes until thick and creamy. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Spread the chorizo-bean mixture evenly in the skillet. Spoon the maize meal over the top and smooth. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over the surface.
Bake 12–15 minutes until the top is set and cheese is melted and lightly golden.
Rest 5 minutes. Top with chopped coriander and serve with lime wedges.

meals.name: Family Citrus-Garlic Chicken Rice & Beans Bowls (Mild)
meals.description: Seared lime-garlic chicken thighs served over fluffy rice with black beans and corn, finished with fresh coriander and avocado. Comforting Latin flavors with gentle seasoning for the whole family.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain well.
Drain and rinse black beans; drain corn.
Finely chop 1 onion and 1 bell pepper; mince 3 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 1 lime (keep separate).
Pat dry 4 chicken thighs; season both sides with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, oregano, and paprika.
Roughly chop a small handful of coriander; slice 1 avocado just before serving.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken thighs 3–4 minutes per side until browned. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, chopped onion and bell pepper; cook 3–4 minutes until softened. Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, and 1/2 teaspoon paprika; cook 30 seconds to bloom spices.
Return chicken to the skillet. Add half the lime zest and 1/2 of the lime juice. Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 15–20 minutes, until chicken is cooked through.

While chicken bakes, combine rinsed rice, 2 cups chicken stock, 1 bay leaf, and a pinch of salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Rest covered 5 minutes; discard bay leaf and fluff.
In a small saucepan over low heat, warm black beans and corn with a pinch of salt and black pepper until hot, 3–4 minutes.
Slice or chop cooked chicken. Toss skillet juices with remaining lime juice and zest to make a mild pan sauce.
Assemble bowls: add a bed of rice, spoon over beans and corn, top with chicken, drizzle pan sauce, and finish with chopped coriander and avocado slices.

meals.name: Family Mexican-Style Beef Shepherd's Pie with Corn
meals.description: Comforting layered casserole of spiced ground beef and vegetables topped with creamy mashed potatoes, baked until golden. Mild flavors and family-friendly Latin/Mexican notes.
prep_steps: Peel and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks; rinse.
Dice onions, bell peppers, and carrots small.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop olives.
Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Set out a medium casserole or baking dish (about 2 L).
cook_steps: Add potatoes to a pot, cover with water and a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, then simmer until tender, 12–15 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium; add onions and carrots, cook 4–5 minutes until starting to soften.
Add bell peppers and garlic; cook 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add ground beef; season with salt and black pepper; cook, breaking up, until browned, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in ground cumin, paprika, and oregano; cook 1 minute.
Add tomato paste; cook 1 minute, stirring.
Pour in diced tomatoes and a splash of beef stock (about 1/2 cup) to loosen; simmer 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Stir in corn and chopped olives; taste and adjust salt and black pepper for a mild, savory filling.
Drain potatoes well; return to pot. Add butter, warm milk, salt, and black pepper; mash until smooth.
Spread the beef mixture evenly in the baking dish. Top with mashed potatoes, smoothing to the edges; rough up the surface with a fork.
Bake 15–20 minutes until the top is lightly golden and the filling bubbles at the edges.
Rest 5 minutes before serving. Spoon into bowls and serve.
instructions: Peel and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks; rinse.
Dice onions, bell peppers, and carrots small.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop olives.
Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Set out a medium casserole or baking dish (about 2 L).
Add potatoes to a pot, cover with water and a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, then simmer until tender, 12–15 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium; add onions and carrots, cook 4–5 minutes until starting to soften.
Add bell peppers and garlic; cook 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add ground beef; season with salt and black pepper; cook, breaking up, until browned, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in ground cumin, paprika, and oregano; cook 1 minute.
Add tomato paste; cook 1 minute, stirring.
Pour in diced tomatoes and a splash of beef stock (about 1/2 cup) to loosen; simmer 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Stir in corn and chopped olives; taste and adjust salt and black pepper for a mild, savory filling.
Drain potatoes well; return to pot. Add butter, warm milk, salt, and black pepper; mash until smooth.
Spread the beef mixture evenly in the baking dish. Top with mashed potatoes, smoothing to the edges; rough up the surface with a fork.
Bake 15–20 minutes until the top is lightly golden and the filling bubbles at the edges.
Rest 5 minutes before serving. Spoon into bowls and serve.

meals.name: Family Pork Carnitas Rice Bowls (Mild)
meals.description: Tender, lightly crisped pork shoulder over fluffy rice with mild salsa beans and corn, finished with avocado and coriander. A family-friendly Latin/Mexican bowl with gentle seasoning.
prep_steps: Cut pork shoulder into 2–3 cm cubes; trim excess fat.
Peel and finely chop onions and garlic.
Rinse jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Open black beans and drain; drain corn.
Halve the lime.
Rinse and chop coriander; dice avocado.
Set oven to broil/grill on high (or preheat to 230°C/450°F) for later.
cook_steps: Start rice: Add jasmine rice and water to a pot (1:1.5 rice-to-water). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 12–15 min until tender. Rest covered 5 min.
Brown pork: Heat olive oil in a wide pot over medium-high. Add pork shoulder in batches; season with salt and black pepper. Brown 6–8 min total, stirring to color all sides.
Build braise: Add onions and garlic; cook 2–3 min until fragrant. Stir in cumin and oregano for 30 seconds.

Simmer pork: Add water (enough to come 1 cm up the pot bottom, about 1 cup), apple cider vinegar, bay leaves, and half the lime juice. Scrape up browned bits. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 30–35 min until pork is tender.
Crisp pork: Transfer pork (drained from liquid) to a foil-lined tray. Broil/grill 5–8 min, turning once, until edges crisp. Toss with remaining lime juice.
Warm toppings: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine salsa, black beans, and corn. Heat 4–5 min until bubbling; season with a pinch of salt if needed.
Assemble bowls: Fluff rice and portion into 4 bowls. Top with crisped pork, spoon over salsa-beans-corn, and finish with avocado and coriander.
