archetypes.name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
archetypes.description: Lean, veggie-forward family dinners inspired by Japanese and Vietnamese home cooking—brothy soups, rice bowls, and quick stir-fries that stay light yet satisfying.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a nutrition-focused, mild, 15–30 minute family archetype with Japanese/Vietnamese flavors—expanding cuisine diversity while avoiding overlap with existing comfort, hands-off, and spicy sets.

meals.name: Lemongrass Chicken Rice Noodle Soup
meals.description: Light, brothy chicken soup with rice noodles, bok choy, and herbs, scented with lemongrass and star anise. Mild and fresh for an easy family weeknight.
prep_steps: Slice 2 spring onion stalks (greens and whites) and keep some greens for garnish.
Thinly slice 2 carrots.
Slice 6–8 mushrooms.
Chop 2–3 bok choy into bite-size pieces.
Cut 500 g chicken thighs into small 2 cm pieces and pat dry.
Halve 1 onion; smash 2 garlic cloves.
Quarter 1 lime.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for the rice noodles.
cook_steps: Cook rice noodles in boiling water until tender, 4–6 minutes; drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion halves (cut side down) and smashed garlic; cook 2–3 minutes until fragrant and lightly browned.
Stir in 1 tbsp lemongrass paste and the sliced spring onion whites; cook 30 seconds.
Pour in 4 cups vegetable stock and 2 cups water; add 1 star anise and 1 bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Add chicken thigh pieces; simmer until just cooked through, 8–10 minutes. Skim any foam.
Add sliced carrots and mushrooms; simmer 2 minutes.
Add bok choy; simmer 2–3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Remove onion halves, star anise, and bay leaf. Season broth with salt and white pepper to taste. Squeeze in 2 lime wedges.
Divide rice noodles among bowls. Ladle hot soup over noodles.
Top with chopped coriander, mint, and reserved spring onion greens. Serve with remaining lime wedges.

meals.name: Lemongrass-Lime Chicken Veggie Vermicelli
meals.description: Light rice vermicelli tossed with lemongrass-lime chicken and a colorful vegetable stir-fry. Fresh herbs and citrus keep it bright and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Thinly slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Mince garlic. Slice spring onion. Roughly chop coriander and mint leaves.
Halve lime; finely grate 1 tsp zest and squeeze 2 tbsp juice.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for the rice vermicelli.
Lay out stir-fry vegetables so they’re ready to go.
cook_steps: Add rice vermicelli to the boiling water and cook until just tender (per pack timing, usually 3–5 minutes). Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chicken thighs and cook, stirring, until lightly browned on the outside, 3–4 minutes.
Stir in garlic and lemongrass paste; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add stir-fry vegetables and 2–3 tbsp water; toss and cook until crisp-tender, 3–4 minutes.
Season with salt, black pepper, rice vinegar, honey, and lime zest; toss to coat.
Add drained rice vermicelli to the pan; toss gently until noodles are coated and warmed through, 1–2 minutes.
Turn off heat. Add lime juice and most of the spring onion, coriander, and mint; toss.
Plate and top with remaining herbs and spring onion. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lime-Basil Chicken Rice Bowls (No Soy)
meals.description: Light chicken and crisp vegetables over jasmine rice, finished with fresh lime and herbs. Clean, bright flavors without soy or fish sauce.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Trim excess fat from 600 g chicken thighs; slice into thin strips.
Slice 1 bell pepper into thin strips.
Peel and thinly slice 2 medium carrots.
Rinse and chop 2 small heads bok choy (separate stems and leaves).
Slice 4 spring onions (whites and greens separated).
Halve 1 small cucumber lengthwise; thinly slice into half-moons for topping.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup basil, 1/4 cup mint, and 1/4 cup coriander.
Halve 2 limes for juicing.
Measure 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 5 minutes covered.
Microwave quick-soften carrots: In a microwave-safe bowl, add sliced carrots and 2 tbsp water. Cover and microwave 1 minute; drain.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Stir-fry chicken: Add chicken, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes until just cooked through and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Add garlic, spring onion whites, carrots, bell pepper, and bok choy stems. Stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add bok choy leaves and spring onion greens. Return chicken to the pan. Toss 1 minute to wilt leaves.
Finish: Turn off heat. Add rice vinegar and juice of 1–2 limes to taste. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork. Divide rice into 4 bowls. Top with chicken and vegetables.
Garnish with cucumber, basil, mint, and coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges if desired.

meals.name: Miso-Soy Udon with Tofu, Bok Choy, and Lime
meals.description: Quick, light udon tossed with seared tofu and crisp veggies in a mild miso-soy sauce, brightened with lime and mint vibes. Family-friendly and ready in 20–25 minutes.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil for the udon noodles.
Drain tofu and pat very dry; cut into 2 cm cubes.
Rinse and slice bok choy into bite-size pieces (separate stems and leafy tops).
Peel carrots and cut into thin matchsticks or half-moons.
Wipe shiitake mushrooms and slice.
Slice spring onion (white and green parts).
In a small bowl, whisk miso paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, juice of 1/2 lime, and 3–4 tbsp water until smooth.
Optional: Warm serving bowls in the microwave for 30–60 seconds.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add tofu; cook 5–6 minutes, turning occasionally, until lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add another 1 tsp sesame oil to the skillet. Stir-fry carrots and bok choy stems for 2 minutes.
Add shiitake mushrooms; cook 2–3 minutes until tender.
Add bok choy leafy tops and most of the spring onion; toss 1 minute until just wilted.
Meanwhile, boil udon noodles per package (usually 2–3 minutes). Drain well.
Return tofu to the skillet. Pour in the miso-soy sauce; toss 30–60 seconds to coat and warm through.
Add drained udon to the skillet; toss until noodles are glossy and evenly coated. If needed, add 1–2 tbsp water to loosen.
Taste and adjust with a squeeze more lime if desired.
Serve hot. Garnish with remaining spring onion and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

meals.name: Citrus-Herb Chicken Rice Noodle Stir-Fry (No Soy)
meals.description: Light, tangy chicken and mixed vegetables tossed with rice noodles in a lime–rice vinegar glaze, finished with fresh coriander. Made fully soy-free and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Bring 4 cups water to a boil (kettle or microwave in a large, microwave-safe bowl).
Soak rice noodles in the hot water until just tender, 6–8 minutes; drain and rinse with cold water.
In a bowl, whisk rice vinegar, juice of 1 lime, honey, cornflour, 1/2 cup water, and a pinch of salt and black pepper to make the glaze.
Trim excess fat and slice chicken thighs into thin strips.
Finely chop garlic and slice spring onion.
Rinse and roughly chop coriander.
cook_steps: Heat canola oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Season chicken lightly with salt and black pepper, then stir-fry until just cooked through and lightly browned, 4–5 minutes; transfer to a plate.
Add a little more canola oil if needed. Stir-fry stir-fry vegetables for 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and spring onion; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return chicken to the pan. Whisk the glaze, then pour it in; stir until it bubbles and thickens, 30–60 seconds.
Add drained rice noodles and toss to coat evenly. If too thick, splash in 1–2 tablespoons water.
Turn off heat, stir in most of the coriander, and squeeze over the remaining lime to taste.
Taste and adjust salt and black pepper. Serve hot, topped with the remaining coriander.

meals.name: Garlic-Lime Chicken with Herb Salad and 7-Grain Bowls (No Soy, No Nuts)
meals.description: Bright, herb-forward chicken served over a warm 7-grain base with a crunchy cucumber-carrot salad and nori. Light, fresh flavors inspired by Japanese and Vietnamese home cooking without common allergens.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups 7-grain medley under cold water.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 2 limes; keep zest and juice separate.
Thinly slice 1 cucumber and julienne 2 carrots.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup each mint, basil, and coriander leaves.
Slice 2 spring onion.
Cut 1 sheet nori into thin strips with scissors.
Trim excess fat from 600 g chicken thighs; pat dry.
cook_steps: Cook grains: Add 1.5 cups 7-grain medley, 3 cups water, and 1/2 tsp salt to a pot. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low until tender and water is absorbed, 18–22 minutes. Fluff.
Make dressing: In a bowl, whisk lime juice, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
Toss salad: In a large bowl, combine cucumber, carrots, mixed greens, chopped mint, basil, coriander, and spring onion. Add half the dressing; toss.
Season chicken: Mix garlic, lime zest, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper; rub over chicken thighs.
Sear chicken: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Cook chicken 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through. Rest 2 minutes, then slice.
Assemble bowls: Divide 7-grain into 4 bowls. Top with salad, sliced chicken, and nori strips. Drizzle remaining dressing over bowls.
Serve: Taste and add a pinch of salt or black pepper if needed.

meals.name: Ponzu-Lime Tilapia with Bok Choy Rice Bowls
meals.description: Light, citrusy tilapia seared and glazed with ponzu, served over jasmine rice with tender bok choy and carrots. Mild and weeknight-simple with Japanese/Vietnamese cues.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Trim and slice 2 heads bok choy (separate thick stems and leafy tops).
Peel and thinly slice 2 carrots.
Mince 2 cloves garlic.
Slice 2 spring onion.
Pat dry tilapia fillets (about 500–600 g total); season both sides with salt and black pepper.
Halve 1 lime; cut one half into wedges for serving, keep half for juice.
Stir together 4 tbsp ponzu sauce with the juice from half a lime in a small bowl.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes, fluff with a fork.

Vegetables (stovetop): Heat 1 tsp canola oil in a large pan over medium. Add carrot slices and bok choy stems with a pinch of salt; sauté 2–3 minutes. Add garlic and bok choy leaves; cook 1–2 minutes until just tender. Transfer to a plate.

Optional microwave assist: Place carrots and bok choy stems in a microwave-safe bowl with 1 tbsp water, cover, and microwave 1–2 minutes to start softening; then finish with leaves and garlic in the pan for 1–2 minutes.
Cook tilapia: Wipe the pan, add 2 tsp canola oil over medium-high. Add seasoned tilapia; sear 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and flakes easily.
Glaze: Lower heat to medium. Pour ponzu-lime mixture around the fish; simmer 30–60 seconds, spooning over fillets until lightly glazed. Remove from heat.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice into 4 bowls. Top with vegetables and a tilapia fillet. Spoon any remaining pan sauce over. Garnish with spring onion and lime wedges.

meals.name: Clear Chicken, Shiitake & Bok Choy Rice Noodle Soup (No Soy)
meals.description: Light, aromatic noodle soup with poached chicken, shiitake, and bok choy in a clear star-anise broth. Japanese and Vietnamese-inspired, mild, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Thinly slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips; pat dry.
Rinse bok choy; slice stems and leaves into 1-inch pieces.
Peel carrot; slice into thin rounds.
Wipe shiitake mushrooms; trim stems and slice caps.
Slice spring onion (greens and whites) thinly.
Rinse coriander and mint; pick leaves.
Cut lime into wedges.
Break nori into small flakes by hand.
cook_steps: Bring a large pot to medium heat; add canola oil.
Add shiitake and carrot; sauté 2–3 minutes until edges soften.
Pour in mushroom broth and water; add star anise, salt, and white pepper. Bring to a gentle boil.
Add chicken thigh strips; reduce to a simmer and poach 5–6 minutes until just cooked through.
Add bok choy; simmer 2 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in rice vinegar; adjust salt/pepper to taste. Remove star anise.
Meanwhile, cook rice noodles per pack directions until just tender; drain.
Divide noodles among 4 bowls. Ladle hot soup over.
Top with spring onion, coriander, mint, and nori flakes. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.
instructions: Thinly slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips; pat dry.
Rinse bok choy; slice stems and leaves into 1-inch pieces.
Peel carrot; slice into thin rounds.
Wipe shiitake mushrooms; trim stems and slice caps.
Slice spring onion (greens and whites) thinly.
Rinse coriander and mint; pick leaves.
Cut lime into wedges.
Break nori into small flakes by hand.
Bring a large pot to medium heat; add canola oil.
Add shiitake and carrot; sauté 2–3 minutes until edges soften.
Pour in mushroom broth and water; add star anise, salt, and white pepper. Bring to a gentle boil.
Add chicken thigh strips; reduce to a simmer and poach 5–6 minutes until just cooked through.
Add bok choy; simmer 2 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in rice vinegar; adjust salt/pepper to taste. Remove star anise.
Meanwhile, cook rice noodles per pack directions until just tender; drain.
Divide noodles among 4 bowls. Ladle hot soup over.
Top with spring onion, coriander, mint, and nori flakes. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.

meals.name: Ginger-Lime Chicken & Zucchini Rice Noodle Bowls (No Soy)
meals.description: Light, herb-forward chicken and vegetables over rice noodles with a tangy ginger-lime dressing. Fresh and mild, inspired by Vietnamese herb bowls with a simple Japanese nori finish.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil for noodles.
Trim excess fat from chicken thighs; pat dry.
Peel and finely grate 1 garlic clove; mince the other.
Zucchini: halve lengthwise, then thinly slice into half-moons.
Carrots: peel and cut into thin matchsticks.
Cucumber: halve lengthwise, scrape seeds if watery, then thinly slice.
Basil and mint: pick leaves; tear larger leaves.
Lime: zest 1 lime (optional), then juice both limes into a small bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk dressing: lime juice (and zest if using), honey, rice vinegar, grated garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Optional: Cut nori into thin strips for garnish.
cook_steps: Season chicken thighs on both sides with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high on the stovetop. Sear chicken 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through; rest on a board, then slice into thin strips.
While chicken cooks, add rice noodles to the boiling water and cook until just tender (per pack timing, usually 4–6 minutes). Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.

In the warm skillet, add zucchini and carrots with a splash of water; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until just crisp-tender. Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.
In a large bowl, toss noodles with half the dressing.
Add sliced chicken, zucchini-carrot mix, cucumber, basil, and mint to the noodles. Drizzle remaining dressing and toss gently to combine.
Taste and adjust salt and black pepper. Top with nori strips if using. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Herb Chicken Rice Paper Rolls (No Soy, No Seafood)
meals.description: Fresh Vietnamese-style rice paper rolls with juicy chicken, crisp vegetables, and a lime-vinegar dipping sauce. Light, mild, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Wash and dry produce.
Julienne carrot and cucumber.
Thinly slice spring onion.
Pick mint and basil leaves.
Mince garlic.
Juice 1 lime; cut the second lime into wedges.
Set a wide bowl with warm water (microwave or stovetop) for soaking rice paper wrappers.
Lay out a clean damp towel or board for rolling.
cook_steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; add canola oil.
Season chicken thighs with salt and black pepper; toss with half the minced garlic.
Cook chicken 5–7 minutes, stirring, until cooked through and lightly browned. Squeeze a little lime juice over, then set aside to cool slightly.
Make dipping sauce: in a small bowl, whisk rice vinegar, remaining minced garlic, 1 tablespoon lime juice, honey, and 1–2 tablespoons water to thin.
Soften 1 rice paper wrapper in warm water for about 10 seconds; place on the damp towel.
Add a leaf of romaine lettuce, a few strips of chicken, carrot, cucumber, and a pinch of spring onion, mint, and basil.
Fold sides in, roll tightly. Repeat with remaining wrappers and fillings.
Serve rolls with dipping sauce and lime wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
archetypes.description: Lean, veggie-forward Greek/Turkish/Middle Eastern family dinners—grilled or oven-finished lean proteins, herby salads, and brothy legumes with restrained oil and bright citrus.
archetypes.rationale: Introduces a quick, simple, mild, Mediterranean-family archetype with a distinct LowFat focus not yet covered, complementing existing Greek/Middle Eastern entries that are hands-off/no-heat or keto-oriented.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Kebab Bowls with Quinoa and Chopped Salad
meals.description: Quick, low-fat Mediterranean bowls with oven-cooked chicken kebabs, fluffy quinoa, and a bright cucumber–tomato salad. Mild flavors, family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve for 30 seconds.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F (or broil on high). Line a baking tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Zest half the lemon, then squeeze the whole lemon for juice.
Mince garlic.
Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, thinly slice red onion, and chop parsley.
Pat chicken kebabs dry with paper towels.
cook_steps: Add quinoa and vegetable stock to a pot. Bring to a boil on the stovetop, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Rest 5 minutes off heat, then fluff.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon zest, half the lemon juice, oregano, garlic, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Brush over chicken kebabs.
Place chicken kebabs on the prepared tray. Roast 10–12 minutes (or broil 8–10 minutes), turning once, until cooked through (juices run clear).
In a large bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, remaining lemon juice, a pinch of salt, black pepper, and sumac (if using). Toss.
Divide quinoa into 4 bowls. Top with chopped salad and chicken kebabs. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lemony Turkey & Chickpea Skillet with Roasted Zucchini-Tomato over Brown Basmati
meals.description: Lean turkey and chickpeas simmered with lemon, oregano, and sumac, served over brown basmati rice with a side of quick-roasted zucchini and cherry tomatoes. Bright, mild, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and set a rack in the upper third.
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until clear.
Slice 2 medium zucchini into half-moons (1 cm).
Halve 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Slice 1 large red onion thinly; reserve half for roasting and half for the skillet.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 500 g turkey into small bite-size strips (or crumble if minced).
Chop 1/2 cup parsley.
Halve and juice 1 lemon; reserve zest if desired.
cook_steps: Start rice: In a pot, combine rinsed brown basmati rice with 3 cups vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 20–25 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes covered, then fluff.

Roast vegetables: On a sheet pan, toss zucchini, half the red onion, and cherry tomatoes with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Cook turkey: While veg roast, heat 1 tsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add turkey and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes, stirring, until lightly browned.
Aromatics: Add remaining red onion and the minced garlic to the skillet. Cook 2–3 minutes until softened.
Add legumes and seasoning: Stir in 1 can (about 400 g) chickpeas (drained), 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp sumac. Cook 2–3 minutes to warm through.
Brighten: Turn heat to low. Stir in lemon juice (to taste) and most of the chopped parsley. Add 1–2 tbsp water if the skillet looks dry. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Plate: Spoon rice into bowls. Top with turkey–chickpea mixture, then the roasted zucchini and tomatoes. Finish with remaining parsley and optional lemon zest.

meals.name: Za’atar Baked Tilapia with Herbed Bulgur Salad
meals.description: Oven-baked tilapia seasoned with za’atar and lemon, served over a bright parsley–mint bulgur salad. Light, mild, and ready in under 30 minutes for a Mediterranean-style family dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Rinse 1 cup bulgur in a fine sieve.
Finely chop parsley and mint.
Dice cucumber and tomatoes; finely slice red onion.
Pat tilapia dry with paper towels.
Halve the lemon; cut a few thin slices from one half, and juice the rest.
cook_steps: Bring vegetable stock to a boil in a medium pot on the stovetop; add bulgur, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 10–12 minutes until tender. Remove from heat and fluff.
Lightly oil a baking tray with 1 tsp olive oil. Place tilapia on the tray; brush with 2 tsp olive oil, sprinkle with za’atar, sumac, a pinch of salt and black pepper, and top with a few lemon slices.
Bake tilapia for 8–10 minutes until the fish flakes easily.
In a large bowl, combine warm bulgur with parsley, mint, cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion. Add remaining olive oil and lemon juice; season with salt and black pepper to taste. Toss to coat.
Plate the herbed bulgur salad and top with baked tilapia. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lemon-Dill Lentil Soup with Roasted Zucchini & Tomatoes
meals.description: Bright, low-fat lentil soup finished with fresh lemon and dill, topped with a quick tray of roasted zucchini and cherry tomatoes.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Rinse lentils in a sieve until water runs clear.
Dice onions, carrots, and celery small.
Slice zucchini into half-moons; halve cherry tomatoes.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop dill and parsley.
Zest and halve the lemon.
cook_steps: On a sheet pan, toss zucchini and cherry tomatoes with 1 tsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tsp olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, and celery; cook 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and ground cumin; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add lentils, bay leaf, vegetable stock, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 15–18 minutes until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Stir in dill, half the parsley, lemon zest, and juice to taste. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Ladle soup into bowls. Top each with roasted zucchini and tomatoes and the remaining parsley. Serve with extra lemon wedges if desired.

meals.name: Herbed Turkey Kofta with Bulgur & Cucumber-Tomato Salad
meals.description: Lean turkey kofta broiled with oregano and cumin, served over fluffy bulgur with a fresh cucumber-tomato salad and lemon yogurt. Light, mild, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Heat oven broiler to high; line a sheet pan with foil and lightly brush with olive oil.
Rinse bulgur in a fine sieve.
Finely chop parsley and mint (about 1/2 cup parsley, 2 tablespoons mint).
Finely grate 1/2 of the red onion and 1 garlic clove for the kofta; finely dice the remaining red onion for the salad.
Dice cucumber and tomatoes; cut lemon in half.
In a small bowl, stir yoghurt with a squeeze of lemon juice and a pinch of salt; set aside.
cook_steps: Cook bulgur: Add bulgur (1 cup) and vegetable stock (2 cups) to a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes; fluff.

Mix kofta: In a bowl, combine turkey (500 g), grated red onion, grated garlic, parsley (1/4 cup), mint (1 tablespoon), ground cumin (1 teaspoon), oregano (1 teaspoon), black pepper (1/2 teaspoon), and salt (3/4 teaspoon).
Shape kofta into 8 small oval patties and place on the prepared sheet pan. Brush tops lightly with olive oil (about 1 teaspoon).
Broil kofta on the upper rack 6–8 minutes, turning once, until browned and cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F).

Make salad: In a bowl, combine diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, remaining parsley and mint. Add lemon juice (from 1/2 lemon), olive oil (1 tablespoon), a pinch of salt, and black pepper; toss.
Plate: Spoon bulgur onto plates, top with kofta, add a side of cucumber-tomato salad, and drizzle or dollop the lemon yoghurt. Serve with extra lemon wedges.

meals.name: Fasolakia-Style Green Beans & Chickpeas over Brown Basmati
meals.description: A quick, low-fat Greek-inspired tomato braise of green beans, potatoes, and chickpeas served over brown basmati with lemon and parsley. Mild, family-friendly, and fiber-rich.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear.
Trim ends of 500 g green beans; cut into 5 cm pieces.
Peel and dice 2 medium potatoes into 1.5 cm cubes.
Peel and finely chop 1 medium onion.
Peel and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley.
Zest and halve 1 lemon; set aside for finishing.
Measure vegetable stock: 3 cups for rice, plus 1 cup for the braise.
cook_steps: Add 3 cups vegetable stock to a pot; bring to a boil. Stir in rinsed brown basmati rice, reduce to low, cover, and simmer until tender (about 20–25 minutes). Keep covered off heat.
While rice cooks, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a wide pot over medium heat.
Sauté onions with a pinch of salt until translucent, 3–4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add diced potatoes and 1/2 cup vegetable stock; cover and steam-sauté 4 minutes to start softening.

Stir in green beans, diced tomatoes (with juices), remaining 1/2 cup vegetable stock, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes until beans and potatoes are tender.
Fold in drained chickpeas and warm 2–3 minutes. Turn off heat; add lemon zest, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, and parsley. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Fluff rice. Spoon braised vegetables and chickpeas over rice and serve.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Baked Fish with 7‑Grain Pilaf, Cucumber-Mint Salad, and Tzatziki
meals.description: Flaky herb-lemon fish baked with cherry tomatoes and olives, served with a simple 7-grain pilaf and a crisp cucumber-mint salad. A spoon of tzatziki adds a cool, light finish.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a sheet pan with baking paper.
Rinse 7-grain medley and drain.
Halve 1 lemon; zest then juice it (keep zest and juice separate).
Halve 1 cup cherry tomatoes.
Slice 1/3 cup olives.
Mince 2 cloves garlic.
Chop 2 tablespoons parsley and 1 tablespoon mint.
Peel, halve, and thinly slice 1/2 red onion.
Quarter 1 large cucumber lengthwise, then slice into half-moons.
cook_steps: Start pilaf: In a pot, combine 1 cup 7-grain medley, 2 cups vegetable stock, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer until tender (about 20 minutes). Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.

Season fish: Place 4 fish fillets on the sheet pan. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil, sprinkle 1 teaspoon oregano, half the lemon zest, half the minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. Scatter cherry tomatoes and olives around.
Bake fish: Roast on middle rack until fish flakes easily and tomatoes soften (10–12 minutes, depending on thickness).
Make salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, red onion, remaining lemon zest, mint, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, a pinch of sumac, salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Finish fish: Squeeze half the lemon juice over the baked fish and tomatoes. Sprinkle parsley.
Serve: Spoon 7-grain pilaf onto plates. Top with fish and roasted tomatoes/olives. Add cucumber-mint salad on the side and 2 tablespoons tzatziki per plate. Offer remaining lemon juice to taste.

Bake fish: Roast on middle rack until fish flakes easily and tomatoes soften (10–12 minutes, depending on thickness).
Make salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, red onion, remaining lemon zest, mint, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, a pinch of sumac, salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Finish fish: Squeeze half the lemon juice over the baked fish and tomatoes. Sprinkle parsley.
Serve: Spoon 7-grain pilaf onto plates. Top with fish and roasted tomatoes/olives. Add cucumber-mint salad on the side and 2 tablespoons tzatziki per plate. Offer remaining lemon juice to taste.

meals.name: Turkish Bulgur–Chickpea Pilaf with Roasted Zucchini and Cucumber-Mint Salad
meals.description: A light, lemony bulgur and chickpea pilaf cooked on the stovetop, paired with oven-roasted zucchini and a crisp cucumber-mint salad. Mild, high-fiber, and weeknight-simple.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Rinse and drain chickpeas.
Dice red onion; mince garlic.
Cut zucchini into half-moons.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Dice cucumber; chop parsley and mint.
Zest and juice lemon (keep separate).
Warm vegetable stock in a small pot or microwave-safe jug.
cook_steps: Roast vegetables: Toss zucchini and cherry tomatoes with 1 tsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper on a baking tray; roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Start pilaf base: In a wide pot, heat 2 tsp olive oil over medium. Add red onion with a pinch of salt; cook 3–4 minutes until softened. Add garlic, cumin, and paprika; cook 30 seconds.

Simmer pilaf: Stir in bulgur and chickpeas to coat. Add vegetable stock and 1 tbsp tomato paste if using. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes until bulgur is tender and liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat; rest covered 5 minutes.
Make salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, parsley, mint, lemon juice, lemon zest, a drizzle of olive oil (1 tsp), salt, and black pepper. Toss to coat.
Finish pilaf: Fluff bulgur with a fork. Stir in half the roasted zucchini and tomatoes plus chopped parsley; adjust salt and black pepper. Squeeze in a little lemon juice to taste.
Serve: Plate pilaf with remaining roasted vegetables on top and the cucumber-mint salad on the side. Add a spoon of hummus per plate if desired.

meals.name: Lemon-Herb Orzo with Chickpeas and Roasted Eggplant-Tomato
meals.description: Bright, low-fat orzo tossed with lemon, parsley, and chickpeas, topped with tray-roasted eggplant, red onion, and cherry tomatoes. Mild Mediterranean flavors in under 30 minutes for a family dinner.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Cut eggplant into 2 cm cubes.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Slice red onion thinly.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley.
Zest and juice the lemon (keep separate).
Measure vegetable stock.
cook_steps: On a sheet pan, toss eggplant, cherry tomatoes, and red onion with olive oil, oregano, salt, and black pepper; spread in a single layer.
Roast vegetables for 18–20 minutes, stirring once halfway, until eggplant is tender and edges are lightly browned.
Meanwhile, place a medium pot on the stovetop; add vegetable stock and bring to a boil.
Stir in orzo and a pinch of salt; reduce heat to a brisk simmer and cook 8–10 minutes until al dente.
Drain any excess liquid if needed; return orzo to the pot and fold in chickpeas and garlic. Warm over low heat for 1–2 minutes.
Turn off heat; add lemon zest, half the lemon juice, parsley, and a few grinds of black pepper. Adjust salt and lemon to taste.
Divide orzo among bowls. Top with roasted vegetables. Sprinkle sumac and the remaining lemon juice if desired.
Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Kebabs with Brown Basmati and Cucumber-Tomato Salad
meals.description: Oven-finished chicken kebabs with a bright lemon-oregano finish, served over fluffy brown basmati rice and a fresh cucumber–tomato salad. Light on oil and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups brown basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a sheet pan with foil.
Quarter 1 cucumber lengthwise, then slice into half-moons.
Halve 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Thinly slice 1/2 red onion.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley and 2 tablespoons mint.
Zest and juice 1 lemon into a small bowl.
In a small cup, mix 1 tablespoon olive oil with 1 teaspoon oregano and a pinch of salt and black pepper for the kebabs.
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice to a pot with 3 cups vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 25 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes covered.
Place chicken kebabs on the lined sheet pan. Brush with the olive oil–oregano mixture.
Bake chicken kebabs for 12–15 minutes, turning once, until cooked through (juices run clear).

While kebabs cook, make the salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, and mint. Add half the lemon zest and 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Fluff the rice. Stir in remaining lemon zest and 1 tablespoon lemon juice, plus a pinch of salt if needed.
Brush the baked kebabs with any juices on the pan. Squeeze the remaining lemon over the kebabs.
Serve rice in bowls, top with chicken kebabs, and add the cucumber–tomato salad on the side.

archetypes.name: Family Pressure Cooker Express Dinners (15–30, Mild)
archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly meals built in a pressure cooker/Instant Pot—soups, stews, shredded proteins, and pasta dishes with mild seasoning and balanced flavors.
archetypes.rationale: This fills the uncovered niche of quick (15–30 min) pressure-cooker family dinners—distinct from existing slow-cooker hands-off and air-fryer sets—broadly appealing with mild heat and mainstream American/Italian flavors.

meals.name: Pressure Cooker Creamy Tomato Chicken Orzo
meals.description: Family-friendly orzo with tender chicken in a mild, creamy tomato sauce made fast in the pressure cooker. Comforting American-Italian flavors in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Dice onions.
Mince garlic.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-size pieces and pat dry.
Measure orzo, passata, chicken stock, peas, cream, and parmesan cheese.
Set pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal).
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in the pot.
Add onions and cook 2–3 minutes until softened; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add chicken thighs, salt, pepper, and italian seasoning; stir and sauté 2–3 minutes until lightly seared.
Cancel Sauté. Add orzo, passata, and chicken stock; stir to submerge orzo. Layer peas on top without stirring.
Seal lid and cook on High Pressure for 5 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Open lid and stir well; the mixture will look loose.
Stir in cream and parmesan cheese until melted and creamy. Adjust salt and pepper.
Rest 2–3 minutes on Warm to thicken. Sprinkle basil and serve.

meals.name: Instant Pot American Goulash (Beef & Macaroni)
meals.description: Comforting beef and macaroni in a mild tomato sauce, made fast in the pressure cooker. Family-friendly and ready in about 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Dice onions (about 1 medium).
Dice bell peppers (2 medium).
Mince garlic (3 cloves).
Measure macaroni (12 oz), beef stock (3 cups), and tomato pasta sauce (2 cups).
Set out Italian seasoning, paprika, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté. Add olive oil and ground beef; cook 3–5 minutes, breaking it up until mostly browned.
Add onions, bell peppers, and garlic. Sauté 2–3 minutes until softened. Spoon off excess fat if needed.
Stir in Italian seasoning, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add a splash of beef stock and scrape the bottom to deglaze.
Pour in the tomato pasta sauce and the remaining beef stock; stir to combine.
Add macaroni on top and press down to submerge, but do not stir.
Seal the lid. Cook on High Pressure for 5 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Stir well; let sit 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Serve hot.

meals.name: Instant Pot Cheesy Chicken & Broccoli Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly chicken, broccoli, and rice cooked fast in the pressure cooker, finished with melted cheddar. Mild, creamy, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice under cold water until mostly clear; drain well.
Dice 1 medium onion; mince 3 cloves garlic.
Trim and cut 1.5 lb chicken thighs into bite-size pieces.
Cut broccoli into small florets to make about 3 cups.
Shred 1.5 cups cheddar if not pre-shredded.
Measure 1.75 cups chicken stock.
cook_steps: Set pressure cooker to Sauté. Add olive oil and heat until shimmering.
Add onions; cook 2 minutes until softened. Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Add chicken, paprika, salt, and pepper; sauté 2–3 minutes until the outside is no longer pink.
Press Cancel. Stir in rinsed rice to coat. Pour in chicken stock and scrape the bottom well to deglaze.
Level the mixture; do not stir. Lock lid and cook on High Pressure for 6 minutes.
Quick-release pressure immediately.
Open lid, add broccoli, and gently stir in. Cover with lid (no pressure) on Keep Warm for 3–5 minutes until broccoli is tender-crisp.
Stir in cheddar until melted and creamy. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Serve hot; garnish with chopped parsley if using.

meals.name: Instant Pot Beef & Mushroom Stroganoff (Egg Noodles)
meals.description: Tender beef and mushrooms in a creamy, mild stroganoff sauce, finished right in the pressure cooker with egg noodles. Family-friendly and ready in about 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Dice onions.
Slice mushrooms.
Mince garlic.
Measure beef stock and water.
Measure paprika, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Chop parsley.
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté. Add butter and let it melt.
Add onions and mushrooms. Sauté 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add beef stew meat, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir to coat and brown lightly for 2–3 minutes.
Pour in Worcestershire sauce and beef stock. Scrape the bottom to release any browned bits. Add water.
Cancel Sauté. Seal the lid and cook on High Pressure for 12 minutes. Quick release when done.
Open the lid. Add egg noodles and stir to submerge; add a splash of water only if needed to barely cover the noodles.
Seal and cook on High Pressure for 3 minutes. Quick release immediately.
Stir in sour cream until smooth. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Let sit 2 minutes to thicken. Top with parsley and serve.
instructions: Dice onions.

Let sit 2 minutes to thicken. Top with parsley and serve.

meals.name: Instant Pot Family Chicken Noodle Soup
meals.description: Comforting chicken noodle soup made quickly in the pressure cooker with tender chicken thighs, carrots, and egg noodles. Mild, family-friendly flavors with a bright parsley-lemon finish.
prep_steps: Dice onions.
Peel and slice carrots into thin rounds.
Mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley.
Cut lemon into wedges.
Pat chicken thighs dry and season lightly with salt and pepper.
cook_steps: Set pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil.
Add onions and carrots. Sauté 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs, chicken stock, water, bay leaves, thyme, a pinch of salt, and a few grinds of pepper. Stir to combine.
Cancel Sauté. Seal lid and cook on High Pressure for 8 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Open lid, remove bay leaves, and transfer chicken to a cutting board.
Set cooker back to Sauté (Normal). Add egg noodles and simmer 5–6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender.
Shred chicken with two forks and return to the pot. Stir in parsley.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges to squeeze over bowls.

meals.name: Instant Pot Sausage & Peppers Penne
meals.description: Family-friendly one-pot penne with sausages, sweet peppers, and a mild tomato sauce made fast in the pressure cooker.
prep_steps: Slice sausages into 1/2-inch rounds.
Slice bell peppers into strips.
Dice onions.
Mince garlic.
Measure penne pasta, chicken stock, diced tomatoes, and tomato pasta sauce.
Grate parmesan cheese and chop parsley (if using).
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil.
Brown sliced sausages for 3–4 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Add onions and bell peppers; sauté 2–3 minutes until slightly softened.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken stock and scrape the bottom to deglaze.
Add penne pasta and spread in an even layer. Pour diced tomatoes and tomato pasta sauce on top. Sprinkle italian seasoning. Do not stir.
Seal the lid and set to Pressure Cook (High) for 5 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Open lid and stir gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
If sauce seems thin, let sit on Keep Warm for 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Top with parmesan cheese and parsley before serving.

meals.name: Instant Pot Family Minestrone with Macaroni & Cannellini
meals.description: Hearty, mild minestrone made fast in the pressure cooker with vegetables, beans, and macaroni. Family-friendly and balanced with American-Italian flavors.
prep_steps: Dice onions.
Dice carrots.
Dice bell peppers.
Slice zucchini into half-moons.
Roughly chop kale, removing tough stems.
Mince garlic.
Drain and rinse cannellini beans.
Measure vegetable stock, diced tomatoes, macaroni, and seasonings.
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil.
Add onions, carrots, and bell peppers. Sauté 3–4 minutes until starting to soften.
Stir in garlic and italian seasoning; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add zucchini and kale; stir 1 minute to wilt slightly.
Stir in tomato paste until coated.
Add vegetable stock, diced tomatoes (with juices), cannellini beans, bay leaves, salt, and pepper. Scrape the bottom to release any browned bits.
Stir in macaroni, ensuring pasta is submerged but not clumped.
Seal the lid. Pressure cook on High for 3 minutes.
Quick-release the pressure. Open the lid and remove bay leaves.
Stir, taste, and adjust salt and pepper. Let sit 2–3 minutes to thicken before serving.

Mince garlic.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-size pieces and pat dry.

Mince garlic.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-size pieces and pat dry.
Rinse 7-grain medley under cold water in a fine strainer.
Measure chicken stock, open diced tomatoes, and set peas and seasonings nearby.
Set the pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil.
Sauté onions and carrots for 3–4 minutes until slightly softened.
Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.
Add chicken thighs, salt, pepper, and italian seasoning. Sauté 2–3 minutes until the outside is no longer pink.
Cancel Sauté. Add rinsed 7-grain medley, chicken stock, and diced tomatoes with their juices. Stir and scrape the bottom to remove any browned bits.
Add bay leaves. Lock the lid, set to High Pressure for 10 minutes.
Quick release the pressure. Remove bay leaves.
Stir in peas. Set to Sauté (Low) for 2–3 minutes to heat through.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Stir in chopped parsley and serve.

meals.name: Instant Pot Creamy Tomato Basil Tortelloni Soup
meals.description: Family-friendly tomato basil soup with tender tortelloni, finished creamy and cheesy right in the pressure cooker. Mild, cozy, and ready fast.
prep_steps: Dice the onions.
Mince the garlic.
Chop the basil (if using fresh).
Grate the parmesan cheese.
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil and heat 1 minute.
Sauté onions for 3–4 minutes until softened; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, water, basil, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
Stir in tortelloni and make sure it is submerged.
Cancel Sauté. Seal the lid and cook on High Pressure for 1 minute.
Quick release pressure immediately. Open the lid and stir.
Switch back to Sauté (Low). Stir in cream and parmesan cheese until melted and creamy, 1–2 minutes.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Turn off heat and let sit 2 minutes to thicken before serving.

archetypes.name: Family Quick Grill & Salad Nights (Mild, 15–30)
archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly grill plates with mild seasoning—quickly seared proteins and veg on the braai paired with simple salads and starch sides for a balanced weeknight dinner.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Braai Chicken & Crunchy Greek Salad
meals.description: Fast-grilled chicken thighs with a lemon-garlic-oregano rub, served alongside a crisp tomato, cucumber, olive, and greens salad. Mild, bright flavors for an easy family braai night.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat (200–230°C). If using a grill pan, preheat on StoveTop over medium-high.
Pat dry chicken thighs with paper towel.
In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, oregano, grated garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Trim and slice cucumber into half-moons.
Cut tomatoes into wedges (or quarter cherry tomatoes).
Thinly slice red onion.
Rinse and dry mixed greens.
Pit olives if needed.
cook_steps: Toss chicken thighs in the lemon-oregano mixture to coat evenly.
Oil grill grates lightly with a paper towel dipped in olive oil.
Grill chicken 6–7 minutes per side, turning once, until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 75°C.
Rest chicken on a plate for 3–5 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
Drizzle salad with olive oil and a splash of apple cider vinegar; season with salt and black pepper. Toss to coat.
Slice or serve chicken thighs whole alongside the salad.

meals.name: BBQ Pork Chops with Grilled Corn & Tangy Cabbage Slaw
meals.description: Quick, mild pork chops finished with barbecue sauce, served with charred corn and a crunchy vinegar slaw. Family-friendly and ready off the grill in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat (200–230°C).
In a large bowl, whisk olive oil (2 tbsp), apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, and black pepper for the slaw dressing.
Finely shred cabbage and peel and grate or julienne carrots; add to the bowl but do not toss yet.
Pat pork chops dry; rub with olive oil (1 tbsp), barbecue rub, and a pinch of salt.
Shuck corn; brush lightly with olive oil and season with a little salt.
cook_steps: Place corn on the grill; cook 10–12 minutes, turning every few minutes until lightly charred and tender.
Grill pork chops 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through and lightly charred.
Brush barbecue sauce on both sides of the chops during the last 1 minute of grilling; let glaze set.
Transfer chops to a plate and rest 3 minutes.
Toss cabbage and carrots with the dressing until coated; adjust salt and black pepper to taste. Sprinkle parsley if using.
Serve pork chops with grilled corn and a heap of tangy slaw.

meals.name: Braai Beef Skewers with Lemon Couscous & Cucumber-Yoghurt
meals.description: Quick-grilled beef skewers served with fluffy lemon couscous and a cool cucumber-yoghurt sauce. Mild, fresh, and family-friendly for a fast grill night.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Bring 2 cups water to a boil on the stovetop.
Finely chop 2 tablespoons parsley.
Zest and juice 1 lemon (keep separate).
Halve 1 cup cherry tomatoes.
Cut 1 small cucumber into small dice.
Mince 1 clove garlic.
Pat beef skewers dry; season all sides with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Grill beef skewers 8–10 minutes, turning every 2–3 minutes until nicely charred and cooked to your liking; rest 3 minutes.
While skewers grill, place couscous in a bowl, pour in boiling water, cover and let stand 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix yoghurt with minced garlic and 1–2 teaspoons lemon juice; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Stir in half the diced cucumber.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Add lemon zest, remaining lemon juice to taste, parsley, cherry tomatoes, remaining diced cucumber, a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and black pepper; toss.
Serve beef skewers with the lemon couscous and a spoon of cucumber-yoghurt on the side.

meals.name: Boerewors Rolls with Quick Tomato-Onion Relish & Garden Salad
meals.description: Family-friendly boerewors rolls grilled fast on the braai, topped with a sweet-tangy tomato-onion relish and served with a simple mixed-greens salad. Mild and weeknight-quick.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Dice tomatoes (about 3 medium).
Finely chop onions (1 large).
Measure apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, and olive oil for the relish.
Rinse and dry mixed greens.
Split bread rolls and set aside.
Place vinaigrette near the salad bowl.
cook_steps: Grill boerewors over direct medium-high heat for 12–15 minutes, turning every 3–4 minutes until browned and cooked through.
While the boerewors cooks, heat olive oil in a small pan on the StoveTop over medium heat; add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in tomatoes, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, salt, and black pepper; simmer 5–7 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
Toast bread rolls cut-side down on the grill for 30–60 seconds until lightly crisp.
Toss mixed greens with vinaigrette in a bowl.
Assemble rolls: place boerewors in toasted bread rolls and spoon over the warm tomato-onion relish.
Serve immediately with the mixed-greens salad on the side.

meals.name: Grilled Fish Fillets with Greek Orzo Salad
meals.description: Quickly grilled fish with lemon-oregano pairs with a fresh Greek-style orzo salad. Mild, bright, and family-friendly for a weeknight braai.
prep_steps: Preheat the OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Bring a medium pot of water to a boil on the stove for the orzo.
Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
Halve the lemon; zest one half and juice both halves into a small bowl.
Slice cucumber into half-moons; halve cherry tomatoes; thinly slice red onion.
Rinse olives and crumble feta cheese.
In a cup, whisk olive oil, vinegar, a pinch of salt, black pepper, lemon zest, and a pinch of oregano for the salad dressing.
cook_steps: Cook orzo in boiling water until al dente (about 8–10 minutes). Drain, rinse under cool water, and shake dry.
Toss cooled orzo with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, olives, feta cheese, and half of the dressing. Set aside.
Rub fish fillets with olive oil, a squeeze of lemon juice, salt, black pepper, and oregano.
Oil grill grates. Grill fish 2–4 minutes per side (thickness-dependent) until opaque and flakes easily.
Plate fish. Drizzle a little of the remaining dressing over the fish and the rest over the orzo if needed.
Serve immediately with extra lemon wedges (from the grilled lemon halves if desired).

meals.name: Braai Lamb Chops with Grilled Oregano Potatoes & Cucumber-Tomato Salad
meals.description: Quick, mild lamb chops on the braai with crisp grilled potato slices and a fresh cucumber-tomato salad. Simple flavors, fast cooking, family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high (or heat a stove-top grill pan).
Slice potatoes into 1 cm thick rounds.
In a bowl, toss potato slices with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, a big pinch of salt, and a few grinds of black pepper.
Pat lamb chops dry; rub with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Slice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, and thinly slice red onion.
Toss cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion with vinaigrette; set aside.
Cut lemon into wedges.
cook_steps: Lay potato slices on the hot grill; cook 5–7 minutes per side until tender and lightly charred. Move to a platter.
Grill lamb chops 3–4 minutes per side for medium (adjust to preferred doneness).
Rest lamb chops 5 minutes; squeeze lemon over just before serving.
Serve lamb with grilled potatoes and the cucumber-tomato salad.

meals.name: Herb-Grilled Sirloin with Tomato-Cucumber-Feta Salad and Grilled Baguette
meals.description: Fast braai-seared sirloin with a bright Greek-style salad and crunchy grilled bread. Mild, family-friendly flavors done in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to high heat; clean and oil the grates.
Pat dry sirloin steak with paper towel.
Halve the lemon and set one half for squeezing; cut the other half into wedges for serving.
Dice tomatoes, chop cucumber, thinly slice red onion, and pit/slice olives if needed.
Crumble feta cheese.
Slice baguette on the bias into 8–12 slices.
Peel the garlic clove and lightly crush.
In a bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and olives.
cook_steps: Season steak: rub with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Dress the salad: add 2 tbsp olive oil, a big squeeze of lemon, 1/4 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper; toss. Top with crumbled feta and set aside.
Brush baguette slices lightly with 1 tbsp olive oil.
Grill steak over direct high heat for 3–5 minutes per side (to desired doneness). Transfer to a board and rest 5 minutes.
Grill baguette 30–60 seconds per side until lightly charred; while warm, rub one side of each slice with the crushed garlic.
Slice the rested steak across the grain.
Serve sliced steak with the tomato-cucumber-feta salad, grilled baguette, and lemon wedges.

meals.name: Grilled Halloumi Veg Skewers with Watermelon-Feta Salad
meals.description: Quick halloumi and vegetable skewers on the braai with a cool watermelon-cucumber-feta salad. Mild, fresh, and weeknight fast.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high (or heat a StoveTop grill pan).
Cut halloumi cheese into 3 cm cubes.
Cut courgette into 1.5 cm thick half-moons.
Cut bell peppers into 3 cm pieces.
Cut red onion into chunky wedges.
Brush mushrooms clean and halve any large pieces.
In a bowl, combine olive oil, oregano, salt, and black pepper for the skewers.
Cube watermelon and dice cucumber; crumble feta cheese; roughly chop basil (optional).
In a large bowl, add watermelon, cucumber, feta cheese, olives, a drizzle of olive oil, and apple cider vinegar; season with salt and black pepper.
Cut lemon into wedges for serving.
cook_steps: Toss halloumi cheese, courgette, bell peppers, red onion, and mushrooms with the seasoned olive oil.
Thread halloumi and vegetables onto skewers, alternating pieces.
Grill skewers 8–10 minutes, turning every 2–3 minutes, until halloumi is golden and vegetables are tender with light char.
Finish salad: add basil to the bowl, toss gently, and adjust vinegar, salt, and black pepper to taste.
Serve skewers hot with lemon wedges for squeezing and the watermelon-feta salad on the side.

meals.name: Grilled Ostrich with Chimichurri, Veg Skewers & Quick Cucumber Salad
meals.description: Fast braai-seared ostrich fillet with chimichurri, grilled courgette and peppers, jasmine rice, and a crunchy cucumber side. Mild, simple, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Rinse jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Slice courgette into 1 cm thick rounds; cut bell peppers into chunky strips.
Slice cucumber into half-moons.
Pat ostrich fillet dry; brush lightly with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
In a bowl, toss cucumber with lemon juice, 1 tsp olive oil, and apple cider vinegar; set aside.
Brush courgette and bell peppers with olive oil; season with a pinch of salt.
cook_steps: Cook jasmine rice on the StoveTop according to pack directions (about 12–15 minutes), then keep warm.
Place ostrich fillet on the hot grill; cook 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (adjust to preference).
Grill courgette and bell peppers alongside the ostrich, 3–5 minutes, turning until tender with light char.
Rest ostrich 5 minutes, then slice across the grain.
Plate rice, add grilled vegetables, and top ostrich slices with chimichurri.
Serve with the cucumber salad on the side.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Kebabs with Grilled Baby Carrots and Tomato-Cucumber Salad
meals.description: Quick-grilled chicken kebabs with a bright lemon-oregano finish, served alongside charred baby carrots and a crisp tomato-cucumber salad. Mild, fresh, and weeknight-fast.
prep_steps: Preheat outdoor grill (or a stovetop grill pan) to medium-high.
Rinse and pat dry baby carrots; trim ends.
Cut tomatoes into wedges (or halve cherry tomatoes if using them).
Dice cucumber; thinly slice a little red onion.
Chop parsley.
Zest and juice the lemon into a small bowl; add olive oil, oregano, salt, and black pepper to make a simple dressing.
Pat chicken kebabs dry with paper towel.
cook_steps: Toss baby carrots with a little olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Place baby carrots on the hot grill; cook 10–12 minutes, turning occasionally, until tender with light char.
Grill chicken kebabs 8–10 minutes, turning every 2–3 minutes, until cooked through.
While grilling, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley in a bowl; spoon over half the lemon-oregano dressing and toss.
Transfer cooked carrots to a plate and drizzle with a little of the remaining dressing.
Move kebabs to a platter and brush with the last of the dressing. Rest 2 minutes, then serve with the salad and carrots.

archetypes.name: Family Weeknight Classics (Mild, 15–30 min)
archetypes.description: Balanced, crowd-pleasing dinners for a typical household that cook in 15–30 minutes with straightforward steps and gentle seasoning.
archetypes.rationale: Establishes a mainstream, high-appeal baseline for typical families—fast, simple, mild, and familiar cuisines—forming the backbone before adding specialized diets or adventurous profiles.

meals.name: Oven-Baked Meatballs with Napoletana Spaghetti and Roasted Broccoli
meals.description: Family-friendly spaghetti with warm napoletana sauce, topped with baked beef meatballs and a side of roasted broccoli. Mild, simple, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the spaghetti.
Cut broccoli into bite-size florets.
Peel and finely chop garlic.
Grate parmesan cheese.
cook_steps: Place beef meatballs on the lined tray. Bake for 12–15 minutes until browned and cooked through, turning once halfway.
On a second section of the same tray, toss broccoli with olive oil, half the garlic, a pinch of salt, and pepper. Roast for 10–12 minutes until tender-crisp.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
In a wide pan over medium heat, warm napoletana sauce with the remaining garlic for 2–3 minutes.
Add drained spaghetti to the pan with the sauce. Toss, loosening with a splash of reserved pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve spaghetti in bowls, top with baked meatballs, and add roasted broccoli on the side. Finish with parmesan cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the spaghetti.
Cut broccoli into bite-size florets.
Peel and finely chop garlic.
Grate parmesan cheese.
Place beef meatballs on the lined tray. Bake for 12–15 minutes until browned and cooked through, turning once halfway.
On a second section of the same tray, toss broccoli with olive oil, half the garlic, a pinch of salt, and pepper. Roast for 10–12 minutes until tender-crisp.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
In a wide pan over medium heat, warm napoletana sauce with the remaining garlic for 2–3 minutes.
Add drained spaghetti to the pan with the sauce. Toss, loosening with a splash of reserved pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve spaghetti in bowls, top with baked meatballs, and add roasted broccoli on the side. Finish with parmesan cheese.

meals.name: Sausage & Pepper Penne Skillet with Garlic Butter Ciabatta
meals.description: A family-friendly penne tossed in a mild tomato-basil sauce with sautéed sausages and peppers, served with warm garlic butter ciabatta. Simple, quick, and crowd-pleasing.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the pasta.
Slice sausages into bite-size rounds.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips.
Peel and finely chop onions.
Peel and mince garlic.
Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F for the garlic butter ciabatta.
Grate parmesan cheese if not pre-grated.
cook_steps: Bake garlic butter ciabatta on a tray until hot and crisp (8–10 minutes); keep warm.
Boil penne pasta until al dente (about 10–11 minutes); reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced sausages and cook until browned (4–5 minutes).
Add onions and bell peppers; sauté until softened (4–5 minutes).
Stir in garlic and italian seasoning; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in tomato passata with basil; season with salt and pepper; simmer 3–4 minutes. Add a splash of pasta water if sauce is too thick.
Add drained penne to the skillet; toss to coat. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with half the parmesan cheese; toss briefly.
Slice the garlic butter ciabatta and serve alongside the pasta. Top pasta with remaining parmesan.

meals.name: One-Pan Creamy Chicken & Mushroom Orzo with Garlic Butter Baguette
meals.description: A family-friendly, mild orzo skillet with tender chicken and mushrooms in a creamy parmesan sauce, plus warm garlic butter baguette on the side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F for the garlic butter baguette.
Dice 1 medium onions.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Slice 250 g mushrooms.
Cut 600 g chicken thigh fillets into small bite-size pieces.
Chop a small handful of parsley.
Measure orzo (about 300 g), chicken stock (about 4 cups), cream (about 1/2 cup), and grated parmesan cheese (about 1/2 cup).
cook_steps: Place the garlic butter baguette on a tray and bake according to pack directions (about 10–12 minutes).
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thigh fillets lightly with salt and pepper, add to the skillet, and cook 4–5 minutes until lightly browned; remove to a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet, then onions and mushrooms; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and orzo; cook 1 minute to toast the orzo.
Pour in chicken stock, stir, and bring to a gentle simmer. Reduce heat to medium, cover partially, and cook 8–10 minutes, stirring every couple of minutes to prevent sticking.
Return chicken and any juices to the pan in the last 3–4 minutes of orzo cooking.
When orzo is al dente and most liquid is absorbed, stir in cream and parmesan cheese. Simmer 1–2 minutes until creamy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Turn off heat and fold in parsley. Rest 1 minute to thicken.
Slice the garlic butter baguette and serve alongside the creamy chicken and mushroom orzo.

meals.name: BBQ Chicken Kebabs with Basmati Rice and Garden Salad
meals.description: Oven-glazed chicken kebabs with fluffy basmati rice and a crisp lettuce-cucumber-tomato salad. Mild, fast, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Rinse basmati rice in a sieve until water runs clear.
Chop lettuce, slice cucumber, and halve cherry tomatoes; set in a large bowl.
Measure BBQ sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Place chicken kebabs on the prepared tray. Brush with half the BBQ sauce.
Bake kebabs for 10 minutes, then brush with remaining BBQ sauce and bake 5–8 minutes more until cooked through (juices run clear).

While kebabs bake, add rinsed basmati rice to a pot with water (about 1.5–2 cups water per cup rice) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes; fluff with a fork.
Toss lettuce, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes with vinaigrette. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Serve kebabs over basmati rice with the salad on the side.

meals.name: Oven-Roasted Boerewors with Creamy Pap and Tomato-Onion Relish
meals.description: South African-style boerewors roasted in the oven, served with quick creamy pap and a warm tomato-onion relish, plus roasted broccoli on the side. Mild, simple, and weeknight-fast.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Line a baking tray with foil; lightly oil it.
Cut broccoli into bite-size florets.
Coil the boerewors onto the tray (secure with a skewer if needed).
Set a medium pot with 3 cups boiling water for pap.
Open the tomato and onion mix.
cook_steps: Roast the boerewors for 20–25 minutes, turning once halfway, until browned and cooked through.
Toss broccoli with oil, salt, and garlic powder on a second tray; roast for 15–18 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
For pap: whisk maize meal into the boiling salted water, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes, stirring once or twice until thick. Stir in butter to finish.
Warm the tomato and onion mix in a small saucepan over medium heat for 5–7 minutes; season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Slice the boerewors. Plate pap, top with tomato-onion relish, add sliced boerewors and roasted broccoli. Serve chakalaka on the side for those who want it.

meals.name: Stovetop Creamy Tuna & Corn Fusilli
meals.description: Family-friendly pasta in a mild, cheesy cream sauce with tuna, corn, and peas. Cooks entirely on the stovetop in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Finely dice the onions.
Mince the garlic.
Grate the cheddar cheese.
Drain the tuna and corn.
Measure milk and set flour and butter by the stove.
Rinse and chop parsley.
cook_steps: Cook fusilli in boiling salted water until al dente; reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil and butter in a large deep skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and cook until softened, 3–4 minutes; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Sprinkle in flour and stir for 1 minute to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in milk until smooth; simmer 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Stir in cheddar cheese until melted; season with salt and pepper.
Fold in tuna, corn, and peas; warm through 1–2 minutes.
Add drained fusilli and a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen; toss until coated.
Adjust seasoning to taste and finish with chopped parsley.
Serve hot.

meals.name: Braai-Spiced Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce and Roasted Green Beans
meals.description: Quick-seared pork chops seasoned with braai spice get a silky mushroom-cream pan sauce, served alongside oven-roasted green beans. Mild, family-friendly, and weeknight fast.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Trim the ends from the green beans.
Rinse and slice the mushrooms.
Peel and finely chop the garlic.
Pat pork chops dry with paper towels; season both sides with salt, pepper, and braai spice mix.
cook_steps: Toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper; spread on a baking tray.
Roast green beans for 12–15 minutes until tender-crisp, tossing once halfway.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until nicely browned and cooked through (internal temp 63°C/145°F); transfer to a plate to rest.
Reduce heat to medium; add 1 tbsp butter to the skillet.
Add mushrooms and cook 4–5 minutes until browned and any liquid reduces.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken stock and simmer 1–2 minutes, scraping the pan.
Lower heat and stir in cream; simmer 2–3 minutes until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Off heat, swirl in remaining 1 tbsp butter for gloss. Return pork chops to the pan and spoon sauce over.
Serve pork chops with creamy mushroom sauce and roasted green beans.

meals.name: Family Sloppy Joe Sandwiches with Oven Potato Wedges
meals.description: Mild, saucy beef mince piled on soft buns with chutney-kissed flavor, served alongside crispy oven potato wedges. Weeknight-friendly and kid-approved.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Dice onions (1 large) and bell peppers (1).
Mince garlic (2 cloves).
Split burger buns (4) and set aside.
cook_steps: Spread potato wedges on a baking tray and bake for 20–25 minutes until golden, turning once.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef and cook, breaking it up, 4–5 minutes until browned; drain excess fat if needed.
Add onions and bell peppers; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce, ketchup, chutney, mustard, salt, and pepper; stir to combine.
Reduce heat to medium and simmer 5–7 minutes until thick and glossy. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Toast burger buns cut-side down in a dry pan for 1–2 minutes (optional).
Spoon the sloppy joe mixture onto buns and serve with hot potato wedges.

meals.name: Stovetop Pesto Tortelloni with Cherry Tomatoes and Spinach
meals.description: Tender cheese-filled tortelloni tossed in pesto with sweet cherry tomatoes and wilted spinach. Mild, quick, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes.
Peel and mince the garlic.
If needed, grate the parmesan cheese.
Open the pesto and have it ready.
If the spinach leaves are large, roughly chop them.
cook_steps: Boil the tortelloni until just tender (check pack timing, usually 3–4 minutes). Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook 2–3 minutes until they start to soften.
Add spinach and cook 1–2 minutes until wilted.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in pesto and a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen.
Add drained tortelloni and toss gently to coat, adding more pasta water as needed for a silky sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with parmesan cheese and serve.

meals.name: Tomato-Braised Beef Meatballs with Buttered Couscous and Roasted Green Beans
meals.description: Quick-simmered beef meatballs in napoletana sauce served over buttered couscous with a tray of roasted green beans. Mild, simple, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Trim green beans and pat dry.
Dice onions and mince garlic.
Chop parsley.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
archetypes.description: Presentation-worthy South African family feasts built around braai platters and slow potjie or oven bakes with classic sides—hands-on technique, medium heat, and >60-minute cook times.
archetypes.rationale: Fills a clear gap for a South African weekend project in the Advanced, 60+ minute, grill-forward space—distinct from existing simple grill nights and other regional showstoppers.

meals.name: Braai Lamb & Boerewors with Oven-Baked Pap and Chakalaka
meals.description: An advanced South African braai platter of lamb chops and boerewors, served with oven-baked pap and a spicy chakalaka bean-tomato relish. Built for a long, relaxed cook with balanced medium heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Light your outdoor grill for medium-hot direct heat on one side and medium heat on the other.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, braai spice mix, peri-peri spice blend, salt, and black pepper. Rub over lamb chops; coil boerewors and brush lightly with olive oil.
Dice onions and red pepper. Grate carrots. Mince garlic.
Grease a medium baking dish with olive oil. In the dish, whisk maize meal with chicken stock and a pinch of salt until smooth. Cover tightly with foil.
Open baked beans and crushed tomatoes.
cook_steps: Bake the pap: Place the covered baking dish in the oven and bake for 60 minutes. At 30 minutes, carefully remove, whisk or stir to break any lumps, re-cover, and return to the oven.
Start the chakalaka: Set a cast-iron pot or heavy pan on the grill over medium heat. Add olive oil, then onions, carrots, and red pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 8–10 minutes.
Add garlic, curry powder, and a pinch of peri-peri spice blend. Stir 1 minute until fragrant.

Stir in crushed tomatoes, baked beans, bay leaf, thyme, and a splash of chicken stock for looseness if needed. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer uncovered over gentle heat, stirring occasionally, 25–35 minutes, until thick and glossy. Remove bay leaf and adjust seasoning.
Grill the meats: Sear lamb chops over the hot side 2–3 minutes per side to develop color, then move to medium heat and cook to preferred doneness (about 6–8 minutes total for medium). Rest 5 minutes.
Grill the boerewors coil over medium heat, turning occasionally, 12–15 minutes until cooked through and juices run clear. Rest briefly, then slice into chunks.
Finish the pap: Remove from oven, whisk or stir to desired stiffness, and season with a little salt if needed.
Plate: Spoon pap onto a platter, ladle over chakalaka, and arrange lamb chops and boerewors alongside. Serve hot.

meals.name: Oxtail Potjie with Tomato Braise and Chakalaka
meals.description: Slow-braised South African oxtail potjie with a wine-tomato base, finished tender and served with a bright chakalaka side. Built over coals with an oven finish for steady heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F).
Light a medium braai fire and let it burn to steady medium coals.
Pat dry oxtail and season all sides with salt and black pepper.
Peel and slice onion.
Peel and chop carrots into large chunks.
Peel potatoes and cut into large chunks.
Peel and crush garlic.
Open diced tomatoes and beef stock.
Tie thyme and rosemary together if preferred for easy removal.
cook_steps: Set a heavy potjie or Dutch oven over steady coals; add olive oil until shimmering.
Sear oxtail in batches until deeply browned on all sides; set aside on a tray.
Add onion to the pot with a little more olive oil if needed; cook until softened.
Stir in garlic, paprika, cumin seeds, and chilli flakes; cook 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Deglaze with Chenin Blanc, scraping up browned bits; reduce by half.
Return oxtail and any juices to the pot; add diced tomatoes, beef stock, bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Cover. Option A (braai): Keep over low, steady coals for 2.5–3 hours, maintaining a gentle bubble. Option B (oven): Transfer covered pot to the oven and braise 2.5–3 hours.
After 1.5–2 hours, add carrot chunks; after another 30 minutes, add potato chunks. Stir, re-cover, and continue until oxtail is very tender and potatoes are just cooked.
Uncover for the last 10–15 minutes to slightly reduce. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste; remove bay leaves and herb stems.
Serve hot with chakalaka on the side and scatter coriander over the potjie.
instructions: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F).

Peel and slice onion.
Peel and chop carrots into large chunks.
Peel potatoes and cut into large chunks.
Peel and crush garlic.
Open diced tomatoes and beef stock.

Stir in garlic, paprika, cumin seeds, and chilli flakes; cook 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Deglaze with Chenin Blanc, scraping up browned bits; reduce by half.
Return oxtail and any juices to the pot; add diced tomatoes, beef stock, bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary. Bring to a gentle simmer.

meals.name: Smoked Braai Brisket with Pap and Chakalaka Relish
meals.description: Low-and-slow braai-smoked beef brisket finished tender in the oven, served with maize meal pap and a quick chakalaka relish. A classic South African feast built for weekend project cooking.
prep_steps: Soak a generous load of braai wood per your grill/smoker instructions; prepare a two-zone fire (hot and cool side).
Preheat OutdoorGrill to 120–135°C (250–275°F) indirect and Oven to 150°C (300°F).
Trim excess surface fat from beef brisket, leaving a 5–8 mm cap.
In a bowl, mix braai spice mix (3 tbsp), paprika (1 tbsp), salt (2 tsp), and black pepper (2 tsp). Rub all over brisket and rest 20 minutes at room temperature.
Stir together mop sauce: apple cider vinegar (1/2 cup), BBQ sauce (1/3 cup), olive oil (1 tbsp), chilli flakes (1 tsp), garlic powder (1 tsp).
Dice onion (1 large) and bell peppers (2).
Measure chakalaka (2 cups) and set aside.
Measure maize meal (2 cups) and chicken stock (6 cups). Keep extra salt ready.
cook_steps: Place brisket fat-side up on the grill’s cool zone. Close lid; stabilize at 120–135°C (250–275°F). Feed braai wood as needed for clean smoke.
Smoke for 3 hours, mopping lightly every 45 minutes. Maintain gentle, clean smoke and steady temperature.
Transfer brisket to an oven-safe roasting dish with a lid. Add 1/4 cup mop to the dish, cover, and move to the Oven at 150°C (300°F).
Braise-roast 2–3 hours until a probe slides in with little resistance (target internal 93–96°C / 200–205°F). Rest covered 30 minutes off heat.
While brisket finishes, make chakalaka relish: set a pan over StoveTop medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sauté onion 4 minutes, add bell peppers and cook 4 minutes more.
Stir in chakalaka and a pinch of salt; simmer 5–8 minutes to meld. Hold warm on low.

Cook pap: bring chicken stock to a boil on StoveTop. Rain in maize meal while whisking. Reduce to low, cover, and cook 20–25 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes until thick and smooth. Season with salt to taste and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Slice brisket across the grain into 5–10 mm slices. Brush with remaining warm mop or a little BBQ sauce if desired.
Plate sliced brisket with generous spoonfuls of pap and chakalaka relish. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Braai Snoek with Mango Chutney Glaze, Fire Corn & Peppers, and Oven-Baked Potatoes
meals.description: Whole snoek braaied with a glossy mango-chutney glaze, served with charred corn and peppers and crisp-skinned oven potatoes. A coastal South African feast built for the braai with an oven side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Scrub 6 medium potatoes; pat dry and prick each a few times with a fork.
Shuck 6 ears of corn; trim silks. Halve 2 large bell peppers and remove seeds.
Finely chop a small handful of parsley (about 1/4 cup).
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
In a bowl, mix 1/2 cup mango chutney, 3 tbsp melted butter, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp chilli flakes, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper to make the glaze.
Pat 1 whole snoek dry; brush skin lightly with 1 tbsp olive oil and season both sides with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Build a medium braai fire with steady coals for direct heat plus a cooler zone; clean and oil the grill grates.
cook_steps: Potatoes: Rub potatoes with 1 tbsp olive oil and 1/2 tsp salt. Place on a tray and bake 60–75 minutes until skins are crisp and centers tender. Keep warm.

Corn & peppers: Just before braaing the fish, toss corn and pepper halves with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt. Grill over medium coals, turning occasionally, 12–15 minutes until lightly charred and tender. Move to a warm side.
Snoek setup: Place snoek skin-side down on a clean, oiled grid over medium heat (cooler side if flare-ups). Close the lid if your braai has one.
Glaze and cook: After 5 minutes, brush the flesh generously with the chutney glaze. Continue cooking skin-side down 10–15 minutes, brushing twice more, until the fish flakes at the thickest part.
Optional finish: For light caramelisation, flip briefly (30–60 seconds) flesh-side down over a cooler spot to avoid sticking.
Rest and garnish: Slide snoek onto a tray. Brush with any remaining warm glaze and scatter parsley.
Serve: Halve or quarter the baked potatoes. Serve with the charred corn and peppers alongside the glazed snoek.
